I don’t know, but don’t worry, don’t worry, because I know how to take a picture now. (They get ready) Okay, see? Look down (Looks down), look down, look down… (He falls asleep.)
(awakens) Yeah! (Looks up and does The Face.)
Ahhh.
Oh yeah, that looks good.
Okay.
I’m marrying her.
Die Hard still great!
What’d you rent?
(looking at the tape) Joey, this is Die Hard 1 again.
Yeah, I just got uh, got plans.
No, see the thing is I want to get out of here before Joey gets all worked up and starts calling everybody bitch.
That’s sweet.
So uh, what did this woman look like?
Well, is there any chance you were looking into a bright, shiny thing called a mirror?
No, no I only dated two girls in college, both blonde, both not attractive… (Thinks a little while.) Hold on one second; let me check this out. (He gets up and grabs a photo album.
Well, let’s see… (Finding the picture he wants.) Okay uh, is that her? (Pointing to the picture.)
Julie Grath, my camp girlfriend.
(pause) No, we’re still together. Yeah we went out for two summers, and then I broke up with her.
Well, ‘cause she came back the third summer and she’d gotten really fa-aa-aw-ow…
I did not say fat! I said, "Fa-aa-aw-ow…"
Yeah. Yeah, but it was a really, really long time ago! Does she still feel bad?
Well, you know what they say, elephants never forget. (Monica is not amused by that statement.) Seriously, good luck marrying me.
Can you figure out what I’m doing?
Who?
Because you kept talking to him while he was trying to go to the bathroom?!
What? Are you kidding? That was like 16 years ago.
Okay, I will do it. But I have to warn you; this may make me a better person and that is not the man you fell in love with!
(she opens the door) Julie hi! Chandler Bing, I, I guess you remember me.
(To Monica) It’s a nickname, I’ll explain later.
Ah, uh, I owe you a long overdue apology. I never should have broken up with you because you were overweight.
You-you-you didn’t know that. (Pause as she nods no.) Well, I guess my work here is done!
As bad as that went, I actually enjoyed myself. I think that I’m going to apologize for all of the stupid things I do.
I would really love it if I could do both.
What?
What?!
A hundred and forty-five pounds.
Look I know it was a stupid reason to break up with somebody, but I was 15!
Okay. Okay, now wait a minute that was totally different.
You were not supposed to hear that! I said that behind you back!

Look you have to realize I don’t think of you as a thin, beautiful woman. (Monica glares at him.) See this is one of things that I can apologize for later! Look, what I mean is you’re Monica! Okay? And I am in love with Monica.
So you can balloon up or you can shrink down and I will still love you.
I’d carry you around in my pocket.
Skidmark’s still got a way with the ladies.
…Come on! Why are we here?!
The hot chicks?
Wow that’s actually pretty cool.
Sounds like two people are really enjoying the Dewey decimal system.
You didn’t bring me here to do that, did you?
OH…MY…GAWD! I am so sorry sweetie, are you okay? You didn’t tell her we were getting married, did you?
Did she freak out?
Right.
(laughs) You said no, right?
You said no, right?!
Lie!!! How hard is that?! The check’s in the mail! Oh your baby is so cute! I can’t wait to read your book, Ross!!
What do you think, she’s just gonna sit there quietly? You don’t think she’s gonna want to make a toast? You don’t think she’s gonna want to grab the microphone and sing Part-time Lover?!
Y’know what? It’s gonna be okay. Y’know what? She’s probably not gonna even want to come.
No! That was a lie! See how easy that was?
Yes!!
Yes!!!
Well actually uh, there was something we wanted to tell you about the wedding. Um, it’s going to be a small ceremony. Uh, tiny! We’re not even sure why we’re having it.
I say we go with Careless Whisper.
(To Monica) Did she see us yet? Did she see us?
Aren’t you just a tinsy bit curious?
No-no-no-no, if we let her stay, she will stay forever!
Is that what you’re thinking about right now?
Janice, I’m sorry but umm, you can’t stay here tonight.
Honestly? Our apartment is a hotbed for electromagnetic activity. Now Monica and I have been immunized, but sadly you have not.
Say again?
Feelings, such strong feelings.
I just wanted to show Monica your book. (Ross just glares at him.)
No, no, no. No-no-no.
No, we're playing this game I learned at work. You have to name all the states in six minutes.
Now, that's a lot harder than it sounds. You always forget at least one, or in some cases... fourteen (looks over to Monica).
Oh, okay, time's up!
Oh that's not bad, Pheebs?
Okay, so Rachel's got 48 and Phoebe has the lead in…vegetables, Joey?
Does South Oregon have a sports-team? (Joey strikes one from his list) There you go.
Oooh that may be a New World's record (Looks at his watch and picks up Ross' pad)
Uh, Magellan? You got 46 states. (Smiles and hands Ross back his pad)
I am only one man! (Monica heads out) Okay Ross, time is up!
Look Ross, if you don't know them by now, you will never know them, okay? That is the beauty of this game. It makes you want to kill yourself.
Okay, but if you can't…no dinner!
Sure, and Joey; do not let Ross look at any of the maps or the globe in your apartment.
I don't know. Maybe it's because it smells a little weird. It's like old pumpkins or something.
Which smells delicious!
What?
Tell her, I'm allergic, and I will sue!
Huh! Where is the dog?!
Phoebe, we can hear the dog barking!
What is it doing here?
Extremely allergic, okay? If I'm anywhere near a dog for more than 5 minutes, my throat will just close up!
(gasping) Really?
Well, it still has to go, right?
Okay, it's um…
(to Joey) I have to! Okay? It's time! (Joey shrugs as if to say, "Do what you have to do") Okay, I hate dogs.
They are needy, they are jumpy, and you can't tell what they are thinking, and that scares me a little bit.
(scared) Is there a puppy here?
(to Tag) Okay, you are new!
Okay, it's just that dogs make me a little uncomfortable.
And I don't wanna say this, I don't want you guys to hate me, but uh, I don't think, I can be around that dog anymore. Okay, so either the dog goes, or I go. (An awkward silence ensues.) Oh my god!!
(comes out of the bathroom) Here I am.
How did you…know? (Heads back into the bathroom)
(comes out of the bathroom) Where's Monica?
Why not?
Well, I, I should go in there.
Why not?
This is ridiculous. (He heads for Phoebe's bedroom)
Monica's all upset, because I sent Clunkers away.
Yeah, I can be a hero, I could do that. I could, I could do... I, w-w-what if, what if it attacks me?
And that doesn't scare you? (He walks out)
No, no he went for a walk.
Please, please, please, don't be mad at me.

Okay, I went over to Ross' apartment to bring back Clunkers. Y’know, for you, and…(Clears his throat) I left the door open and she must have gotten out and I looked everywhere, all over the apartment, including the roof, which FYI Ross, one of your neighbors, growing weed. I couldn't find him, and I am so, so, so, sorry. But I do know where we could all go ease the pain. (Points up and then over to the street)
Clunkers?! Oh my god!
(to Clunkers) It is so good to see you!
It's up to you.
All right.
You got it. (Starts looking at the pad, while Ross gets the turkey out of the fridge and starts to unwrap it) You got Nevada twice.
Yeah. (Throws the pad on the table and heads for the bedroom)
Okay, let me just straighten out your helmet there. (Does so.)
Okay. Okay.
That sounds like my first bike. (They all turn and look at him.) My dad gave me his old one.
Hey! What are you guys doing?
I’m sorry, who?
But we don’t know the neighbors.
Wouldn’t it be easier if we just moved?
Eh, somebody’s in a good mood!
Well, either that or uh…(Motions towards Joey’s door.)
(about to cry) Am not!
Don’t worry, I’m brave! I am brave! I…I am brave! (They get to the door and Monica goes to open it.) No-no-no-no!! (He stops her.) (Through the door.) Can you tell me who is there please?
(laughs) 4:00 A.M.
I am sorry, but some of us have to get up early and go to work! (Monica looks at him) (To Monica) He does not know that I am not some of us.
Mm! Night Gar’! (Monica closes the door.)
Hey, you cry every time somebody talks about Titanic!
Hey! So are you enjoying the bike?
(with his mouth full) What happened? I’m just eating candy.
Absolutely! Y’know, because tushie can mean both ass and good worker.
What is the matter with you?
Maybe, isn’t she the woman who lives below you and has s*x really loud?
Y’know what would work?
Stop making candy!
You mean they like you.
Is that why you became a chef? So that people would like you?
(asking a man leaning against the wall) What is going on?
Joey!
What are you doing?

Get in here! (They head for the door and Chandler sees Smokes-A-Lot Lady standing next to the door and smoking, to her) Hey, and you can not smoke in here! (Takes the cigarette and takes a drag for himself.) (Exhaling in ecstasy) Merry Christmas.

All right everybody! Just be quiet! Be quiet! Be quiet!! Pipe-pipe-pipe down! (They settle down) What is the matter with you people?! This woman was trying to do a nice thing for you. She was making candy so she could try to get to know all of you, and I’ll bet that not one of you can tell me her name! Am I right?
No not (imitating) Candy Lady.
All right, y’know what? Forget it, all of you forget it! You’ve ruined it! Go home! You’ve ruined it! You’ve ruined it!
You’re welcome. (They kiss.)
No! Smokes-A-Lot Lady blew smoke directly into my mouth. Eh-uh—are you okay?
Buh-bye. (Hangs up the phone) I just got us reservations at Michelle’s and tickets to the Musicman to celebrate our first holiday season as a betroughed couple.
…betrothed couple.
Hey!
Pheebs?
Skull?
How long have we been home?
Lovely!
Hey, you know what I was thinking? When we get married, are you gonna change your last name to Bing?
Why not?
Hey!
Ohh! You guys gonna be living together again?
Well, she's just so much fun with Joey, I just assumed, she'd still be living with him.
No reason, except…she…told…me.
No! No, she didn't say that. I-I-I think you should talk to Monica now.
Bing doesn't seem so weird now, does it?
(to the Maitre d') Hi, could we get two burritos to go, please? (Laughs.)
Forty-five minutes? We have tickets to the Musicman at 8:00.
Is this because of the burrito thing?
Give him money? It was a joke!
Right, calm down, O'Mally. I'll slip him some money.
Hey, I can be smooth. (Walks back to the Maitre d', very smoothly) Listen, we're a little bit in a hurry, so, if you can get us a table a little quicker, I'd appreciate it. (Shakes his hand)
Okay. (Walks back to Monica)
Had the money in the wrong hand. (Shows her his left hand with the money in it)
How do you know so much about this?
Richard used to do it, didn't he?
Mustached b*st*rd…
(walks up to the Maitre d') Excuse me...
(finds his money) Ahh-hahaha! (Turns around to give the Maitre d' his money, but he isn't there anymore)

Thank you Gunther, put it there. (He gets up, and shakes Gunther's hand. A bunch of coins fall out his hand. He sits down next to Monica.) Definitely not easier with coins. (Joey gets up and picks up the coins. Chandler thinks, Joey is just helping him to pick them up.) Thank you.
Hey Pheebs!

If you wanna give Joey a Christmas present that disrupts the entire building, why not get him something a little bit more subtle, like a wrecking ball, or a phial of small pox to release in the hallway?
(entering in a Santa costume) Ho, ho, ho! Merry Christmas!
Hey! (Grunts as Ben hits him at full speed.)
Well, I'm here to see my old buddy Ben. What are you doing here, weird…turtle-man?
What?

You bet I did, Ben, put it there! (He shakes Ben's hand, but the money falls out of his hands) (to Monica) Well, it would have worked this time, if his hands weren't so damn small! (Realizes, that Ben is standing right there) Ho, ho, ho!
You called everyone and said you were having trouble finding a Santa costume, so I borrowed one from a guy at work!
Why?
But I didn't get to shake my belly like a bowl full of jelly.
Fine, I'll give the suit back.
Santa? Really?
Did your Dad ever dress up like Santa?
Then it's okay! (They kiss.)
Because, if Santa and the Holiday…Armadillo? (Ross nods) ...are ever in the same room for too long the universe will implode. Merry Christmas!
Well, I'll stay, but only because I wanna hear about Hanukkah. Ben, will you sit here with Santa and learn about Hanukkah?
My favorite part was when Superman flew all the Jews out of Egypt. (Glaring at Joey who’s nodding.)
Ohh. Mmm.
Hey, you have got to try this cheesecake.
(nervously) It was at the front door. When I got home. Somebody sent it to us.
I—no! I didn't read the box before I opened it. And you can't return a box after you've opened the box.
Because it's too delicious.

No-no-no! It is going to be okay, because Mrs. Braverman is gonna send away for a free one and that way we all win! The only losers are the big cheesecake conglomerate, (Reading the label) Momma’s Little Bakery. (Pause) I feel terrible, I’m a horrible, horrible, horrible person.
So…
Oh, what’s at 8:00?
Well, maybe since the age of 9, Frannie’s made some new friends.
I used to undress my cousin Glenn. (Monica looks at him then shushes him.)
Another cheesecake came! They delivered it to the wrong address again!
I can’t seem to say goodbye.
Well I’ve forgotten what it tastes like okay?!
(closing the box) Y’know what? Forget it! We are just hungry! We have not had lunch! We are just light-headed! So let us go out and have lunch and forget about the cheesecake.
Good idea. Where do you want to go to lunch?
Well, thank you for lunch.
So apparently we just don’t pay for food anymore. (Rachel laughs then Chandler notices something.) Do you see what I see?
Mrs. Braverman must be out. (They move closer to it.)
By then, the cheesecake may have gone bad. We don’t want her to come back to bad cheesecake.
Well, we don’t want that.
But we should take it.
Why?
Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! (Rachel grabs the cheesecake and they take off upstairs.)
I’m full, and yet I know if I stop eating this, I’ll regret it.
What are you doing tonight?
Dude! Dude! (Motions that Joey should pull up his pants.)
Oh really? Uh, Monica said she had a date at 9:00.
That’s what Monica said.
Are you eating the cheesecake without me?!
I will give you a hundred dollars to whistle right now. (She tries to whistle and blows little chunks of cheesecake out of her mouth.) How can you eat the cheesecake without me?!
Y’know what? I don’t trust you with this cake anymore! And I got it first, and I’m takin’ it back! (Grabs the cheesecake and heads for his apartment.)
Oh yes!
Oh yes!
Oh yes! Oh yes!
Well that’s not fair, you’ve already had some!
What do we use to split it?
(examining the cake) Okay well, this side looks bigger. Uh… There’s more crust on this side. Y’know? So, maybe if I measured…
All right, I’ll pick that one. (Points.)
(gloatingly and holding his piece) Ohhh!

Oh-ho-ho-ho-no! No! No switching! No sharing, and don’t come crying to me! Ha-ha-ha! I may just sit here and have my cake all day! Just sit here in the hallway and eat my… (Rachel knocks the plate from his hand and it falls on the floor. That process leaves just the forkful Chandler has, Rachel starts to go after that little bit and Chandler retreats into his apartment.)
Stick to your side!
(looking up with her) That’s a plane!
(with a quivering voice) No, I’m not!
Because it’s flattering! (Shivers harder) Come on Monica! Come on Monica! (He goes inside.)
(whispering) Monica!
I know, just quick-quick question, quick question. Which one was Deep Impact and which one was Armageddon?

Sorry, I just…can’t sleep. Ooh! (Turns on the light and Monica groans.) Where is that book that you are reading with the two women who were ice-skating and wearing, wearing those hats with the flowers on it? Because every time I look at that cover I’m like…(Fake snores.)
What?! (Monica kicks him in the shin.) Ow! (He gets out of bed and heads into the living room.)
Shhhhhhhhh!!! (Monica enters) I’m sorry, I thought maybe I’d make some warm milk and it would help me sleep.
It got interesting! Damn you Oprah!
Hey, y’know what we can do? Y’know, now that we are up? We can just like talk to each other all night long, y’know like we did when we were first going out. It’d be fun!
Okay, so how bummed were you when the second sister died huh?
(Pause) No. No, I-I was, I was talking about the book I was reading.
That’s correct.
(startled) What? What? What?
Yeah! You?
(intrigued) Yeah? (Monica nods yes.) I hope you’re not thinking about cleaning the living room.
Do you know what just happened?
No. We were in the middle of s*x…and you fell asleep.
(turning the light back on) Monica?
I was giving you some of my best moves, and you missed it. So please wake up so we can do it right!
Okay.

Yeah! (Monica falls asleep) No! No! No! Don’t fall asleep! Okay, I am going to make you some coffee. (Monica doesn’t move as he gets out of bed and as he’s heading for the door.) And I probably won’t spill coffee grounds all over the kitchen floor.
Hm-hmm, I told you! (Looks at the clock) I can’t believe that I’ve only got two hours before I call in sick for work.
Well, you’re not gonna believe this, but if you have seven minutes…
Do you wanna?
Couldn’t I just say, "This is Ross?"
(knocking on the window while outside) Sorry! (Runs off.)

Joey! Joe! (Sees that he’s not here and starts investigating. He picks up the bag of chips.) Full bag. (He picks up the beer.) Beer’s still cold. Something terrible must’ve happened here! (He decides it’s not that important; sits down on Rosita, and the back falls off causing him to flip over.) Oh no-no-no-no-no-no! (Runs over to Stevie.) Stevie, I was never here! (Runs out.)

My chair. Now, if anybody asks, your name is Rosita! (He runs out the door, grabs the back of Rosita, and we can hear Joey and Rachel talking as they are coming up the stairs. Neither of them have reached the landing yet.)
Hey!
Yeah, I’d love to but I’ve tried that so many times they won’t even let me in the store anymore.
(excitedly) Are you telling me that you bought the chair that is making all other lounge systems obsolete? The chair that Sit magazine called the Chair of the Year?
That’s awesome! That’s great! What made you do it?!
Whoa-whoa-whoa! You broke Joey’s chair?
I thought I broke Joey’s chair! That’s why I replaced it with mine!
Well, what did you think, that-that elves came in and fixed it?
I’m gettin’ my chair back! (Heads for Joey and Rachel’s.)
Joey you broke my chair!!
I think I should get the chair!
Because you (Points to Joey) broke a chair and you (Points to Rachel) broke a chair! The only one around here that hasn’t broke a chair, is me!
Well, where’s the logic in that?!
So Joey breaks my chair and I get nothing!
What are you guys? Like a gang or something?!
(To Monica) She’s not as pretty as she was when she was 29.
No Rach, it’s not just you. My thirtieth birthday certainly wasn’t that much fun.
Ross, a sports car? Wouldn’t it have been cheaper to just stuff a sock down there?
(To Joey) Would you put that back on?! Monica’s gonna be here any minute!
(frustrated) Okay, for the last time. It’s not named for each individual man.

Oh well, not as lovely as you. I mean, I can’t believe that you would have a thirty-year-old daughter! (To Mr. Geller) And you! I can’t believe that you would have a tux that’s thirty years old! (Puts his hand on Mr. Geller’s shoulder.)
Ohh! (He quickly removes his hand and looks at it.)
Okay! Okay! Everybody down! Everybody down! (Rachel turns off the lights and everyone crouches. As everyone crouches, a ripping noise erupts from the assemblage.)
(getting up to investigate) Okay, everybody stay here. I will find out what’s going on.
Hey-hey are you drunk?
Okay, here is the thing. We have thrown a very formal surprise party for you in there! All of your friends are in there and your parents!
Yes!
Yes!!
Okay, here’s the thing. We’re gonna get you some coffee and they will never know that you’re drunk.
Yeah, I’ll take care of it.
(laughing) Okay we have to do something about your breath.
That’s still yours. Okay, now remember it’s a surprise party. So, when you go in, act surprised.
Okay.
Okay before we start the celebration, Monica has to go put on her party dress.
See? (Does his laugh.) Here we go. (Starts walking her to their room, and has to pass in front of Mr. Geller who’s sitting at the table and Mrs. Geller who’s standing next to him.)
(correcting her) Phil.
Now, there is a dress laid out on your bed. (Monica stumbles on the steps.) Okay, (catches her) you’re doing great. You’re doing great. You’re doing fine.
Monica’s a little drunk.
(To Monica) Go change! (To Phoebe) She doesn’t want her parents to know she’s drunk.
Monica’s wasted.
(To Rachel) Okay, will you just go help her change please!
Okay, open ours next. Open ours next!
For my last birthday you gave me a hug! (To Rachel) Okay, read the card! Read the card!
No-no-no-no! That was the joke!
No, because you’re not a grandmother!
(to a waiter) Oh that’s great! Right there! Can we get some of that over here please? (The waiter comes over) There we go.
(To Monica) How are you feeling?
(To Monica) Now all you have to do is just get through a little bit more, okay? Then we can put you in bed, okay? Just smile and don’t talk to anyone.
Pheebs!!
I think it’s necessary. (Backs away anyhow.)
What?
Okay, here we go.
Hey! How’d it go?
Well, here we are, just a bunch of thirty year olds.
(To Ross) Monica said wedding.
Do you think you could get through a poem?
Too?
Well, whatever it is, I hope it involves winking. (Winks in a spy-type manner.)
That’s great!
So great things are happening at work and in your personal life!
Don’t do it.
I think it’s the dying cat parade.
(turning around and looking) Oh my God!
Y’know that thing that Ross was gonna do at our wedding?! He was hanging out with me yesterday and he turned to me and said, "You’re half Scottish right?"
Yes!!
Why is your family Ross?!
If you listen very carefully, I think its Celebration by Cool and the Gang.
Well, I feel like a snack!
Oh no thanks. I don’t like anything from my Scottish heritage.
Well it’s just my entire family was run out of Scotland by…Vikings. Anyway, lots of bad memories. (Makes a few unintelligible noises.)
We heard you play all the way from your apartment!
That’s not really important right now. What is important is; while we appreciate the gesture, we just don’t feel bagpipes are appropriate for our wedding.
Because we hate them.
We have heard you play.
You mean the spitter?
Easy for you to say; you’ll be wearing a veil.
You mean the guy who kept staring at your chest?
Sorry, I just don’t like the idea of when I say "I do," he’s thinking, "Yeah, I’d do her too!"
Yeah!
Guys thank you very much but neither of you is marrying us.
We are going to have a legitimate member of the clergy! And when I say legitimate I mean, gay and in control of his saliva!
No, but Horny for Monica Minister called, wanting to know if we were still together.
Joe…
(To Monica) Y’know, we haven’t found anybody else.
Yeah you can do it.
Yeah.
Hey!
Hey!
Our minister…
Okay.
(To Monica) Should we call the spitter?
Yeah. O-okay.

See Joe, not that that’s not grrreat! But, one of the cool things about having somebody we know perform the ceremony is that it can be about us! Y’know, it can be more personal. You can tell stories about us!
No, not us… (Motions Joey and him.) Us! (Motions Monica and him.)
See Joe, we want you to tell stories but y’know, romantic stories. Nice stories.
Joe?
Isn’t that what happened with you and the bridesmaid?
And I was a perfect gentleman and I walked her to her hotel room and said goodnight.
But then later that night…
(answering the door) Hey!
Well I was… I wasn't exactly expecting company after…(He looks at his watch.) 9:15.
Well, last time I saw him he was heading out the door with the bridesmaid and a bucket of strawberries. So uh, you’re not still upset about what that guy told ya are ya?
Well, look it’s been a really emotional time y’know, and you’ve had a lot to drink. And you’ve just got to let that go okay? I mean you were the most beautiful woman in the room tonight!
You kidding? You’re the most beautiful woman in most rooms… (She jumps up and kisses him.) (Breaking the kiss.) Whoa! Whoa! Whoa! What’s going on? You and I just made out! You and I are making out?
But we don’t do that.
How drunk are you?
(thinks) That’s the perfect amount!
What?
I know.
Well, I have kissed over four women. (They kiss again.) Do you wanna get under the covers?
Okay!
It bodes well for me that speed impresses you.
Yep!
Count of three?
Two!
Well I think it’s safe to say that our friendship is effectively ruined.
Eh!

Baby shower. Wow! That sounds sooo like something I don’t want to do! Later! (Finally, he makes his exit.)
This is what I’ve got going for the party so far, liquor wise. Get a lot of liquor.
Okay, now uh, in terms of the invite list, I’ve got you, me, and Chandler and I’m gonna invite Gunther ‘cause, well, we’ve been talking about this pretty loud.
All right—oh! Listen, I know this is your party, but I’d really like to the number of museum geeks that are gonna be there.
Okay! We’ll need a six-pack of Zima.
You got it.
Well, there’s gonna be strippers there. He didn’t say anything about no strippers.
Oh, I chose not to hear that.
Yeah?
Oh-whoa-wait, Gunther don’t-don’t forget your shirt. (He gives Gunther his shirt and Gunther leaves.)
Oh, little party favours, check it out! (It’s a shirt that reads, "Ross Geller, Bachelor Bash 1998")
Oh-oh! (Shows him what’s on the back, "Best Man Joey Tribbiani, with a huge picture of him.)
Oh, hey, don’t forget your shirt.

Okay, hey, museum geeks, party’s over. Okay. Wave bye-bye to the nice lady. There you go. Back to your parent’s basement. All right. (The museum geeks exit and Joey unlocks his door and lets the chick and the duck out.) Come on boys, come on out! Here you go. All right.
Yeah!
Oh yeah-yeah. And I got the duck totally trained. Watch this. Stare at the wall. (The duck complies.) Hardly move. (The duck complies.) Be white. (The duck complies.)
Oh thanks. Thanks. It was great meetin’ ya. And listen if any of my friends gets married, or have a birthday, or a Tuesday…
Oh unless you uh, you wanna hang around.
Yeah. I’ll let you play with my duck.
Hey, (realises he doesn’t know her name.) stripper! (He notices that the ring box is open, so he picks it up, sees it’s empty and starts to panic.)
(running and banging on Chandler’s door) The stripper stole the ring!! The stripper stole the ring!! Chandler! Chandler, get up! Get up! The stripper stole the ring!
The ring is gone!
Dude, this isn’t funny! What am I gonna do?! I go to bed last night, everything’s cool! I wake up this morning, the stripper’s gone and the ring is gone!
Of course!! (Shrugs.)
Ugh! I don’t know what I’m going to do! I called the company that sent and th-they don’t care! Then I called 9-1-1 and they laughed at me, if this isn’t an emergency, then what is?
Hey…
So uh, hey, that uh, that wedding ring, huh? Man, that’s nice!
I was uh, I was thinking I might want to pick one of those babies up for myself, I might want to get one of those…
(laughs, softly) Yeah, the stripper stole it.
Dude, I screwed up, you don’t have to turn me in!
Oh, yeah, well I already did that! They said they’re gonna look into it right after they solved all the murders.
I did that too! They wouldn’t give me her real name or her number. They said, "If I bothered them again they’d call the police." I said, "If you talk to the police, you tell them I’m missing a ring!"
Look Ross, I am so-so sorry. I-I-I…
Oh, that sounds like fun, but we’ve got a ring to find!!

All right, okay, this is great, uh, Chandler, you get behind the desk. And-and when she comes in hopefully, she won’t recognise you because, well, why would she? Uh, okay, and then you buzz Ross and I. (to Ross) You be Mr. Gonzalez, and I’ll be uh, Mr. Wong.
There was a ring, in a box, on my nightstand, after you left, it was gone!

I don’t get it! It was in my room all night! And if she didn’t take it, and I didn’t take it; and you (Chandler) didn’t take it, then who did? (The duck quacks.) Shh! We’re trying to think! (Ross and Chandler realise it at the same moment and stare at Joey, who doesn’t get it. After a short pause, with the duck still quacking, Joey figures it out and starts pointing at the duck.)
If anything should happen to him…
So! Things can go wrong! You don’t know! What if he doesn’t make it?!
Yeah, but what if he doesn’t? He’s such a good duck.
I’m so worried about him, y’know?
H-h-h-how’s the duck?
Ohh, great! Oh hey, listen Ross, thanks for being so cool about this.
No, it’s not. I mean you-you made me your best man and I totally let you down!
Yeah, it is! You wouldn’t have lost the ring, right? Y’know what, Ross you were right from the start, he (Chandler) should be your best man.
Now, don’t argue with me…
Really?
(starting to cry) I gotta go check something over here. (He walks away so that they can’t see him cry.)
It’s all London, baby! Here we go. (He takes a picture of a less than enthused Chandler and starts towards the girls’ apartment.)
Yeah, in my third drawer on my dresser. You don’t want to lose that.
Ohh!! (Runs to his room.)
Woo-hoo!!
London baby!
(louder) London baby!!
Bye, Pheebs!
London baby!! (And Rachel slowly closes the door, sadly.)
Come on! Do something!

Okay, here! (Gives him the camera.) I wanna be the on camera guy. All right, first stop, Westminster Abbey. (Joey folds out his "pop-up" map of London. All of the major landmarks pop-up like in a pop-up book.)
It’s London, baby! All right, the hotel’s here. (Points to the map.) Wait. No, we wanna go… No. I know. (Sets the map down.) I’m gonna have to go into the map. (So Joey literally steps into the map.)
I got it! (Picks up the map and starts walking.) Here we go.
Shhh! (Pause) Man, you made me lose it! (He goes into the map again.)
All right! Westminster Abbey! Hands down, best Abbey I’ve ever seen. Hey! (Pushes Chandler in front of the camera.) Okay. What do you think of the Abbey, Chandler?
Really? To what?
Man, you are Westminster Crabby. (He starts chasing Chandler towards the Abbey.)
Hey!
Check this out? Huh? (Joey has this big tall hat with a British flag on the front of it.) Yeah. That’s the stuff. What do you think?
Well, I like it. Here you go. (He pays for the hat.)
Oh, I embarrass you?
Oh yeah? (Puts the hat on.) If you’re gonna make me choose between you and the hat? I choose the hat.
Thanks.
Hey.
Oh. (Takes off the hat.) Sorry!
Me too.
Noo!! I’ve had the best day ever! Dude, check this out!
Sh-shh-shh! (He motions for her to watch something he has taped.)
(on tape) Okay, so say hi to my friend and tell him that you like the hat.
(on tape) Oh, Chandler.
That’s Fergie baby!!
Well, I was trying to figure out how to get to Buckingham Palace, right? So, I’m in my map and-and…(Ross enters) Hey!
Wait up! (They both run to the bathroom.)
Yeah. (Pause) Hey, I hope Ross didn’t think that we just went in there because we were uncomfortable being out here!
(on phone) Hey, Pheebs! It’s Joey!
That just cost me four bucks. But uh listen, I just called to see how the chick and the duck are doing?
Kinda, but I’ve just been having way too much fun.
No, I don’t think so.
Who’s seven?
Ahh, the babies miss me?
What? You ordered pizza without me?!
Two pizzas?!
Wait, well, where did you get it from?!
What’s in it?

(Looking up at the waiter)That’s not food...No, I don’t, no...(Taps Chandler on the shoulder.) Everything's different here...I want to go home. I...I miss my family. I miss the coffee house. I can’t even remember what Phoebe looks like.
(Pointing  at Chandler.) Your different here too. Your mean in England. (Chandler throws his hands up to his head in frustration. They walk away from each other.)

Hey, best man number two, Joey Tribbiani. Now I’m not good with the jokes like Chandler here. Boy...but ahh, I just want to say congratulation to the happy couple. I first met Ross in this coffee house back home...Home...New York City...Where everybody knows my name. Well anyway, I love you guys. (pointing at everyone.) But not as much as I love America. (Looking at Chandler.) Could we please..go home now?
(Putting his arm around her.) I’m not going anywhere, sweetheart.
Hello?
Hey. I spent the night out. I met this cute bridesmaid. She is so...
Ahh Pheebs, you know you’re still my number one girl.
Ohh great!!!
(Confused.) But, he loves Emily?
Okay.
Hold on. Hold on. (Picking up a note pad and writing and reading the message aloud.) Rachel coming. Do...Something.
Right!
Hey.
Have you seen Monica?
(With a confused look on his face.) What?
Look we’ve got to find her. Phoebe just called!! Rachel’s coming to tell Ross she loves him!!
I know! That’s why we got to find Monica!! You know where she is?
(Whispering.) Pisst, Monica. Alright, we really need to start looking out for Rachel. I’ll cover the front door. You watch that big hole at the back of the building and I got Chandler covering Ross.
Okay. (They both walk off to watch for Rachel.)
Hey, Felicity.
Yeah.
(In a New York accent.) Fuggetaboutit. (She giggles.) How you doin?
Oh, yeah.
(Smiling.) Ohh great!! (Putting the phone to his ear.) Hello. (He begins to escort her down the aisle.)
No, but it’s okay. She just came in and gave him a hug, that it.
No.

Ah, I’m-I’m walking down the aisle...Still walking. (Mrs. Waltham takes her place.) I’m about to pass the bridesmaid I hooked up with last night. (Looking at the bridesmaid.) Hey! (Talking to Phoebe.) I told her "Hey." And now I’m at the front with Ross. It’s Phoebe. (He shows Ross the phone.) He looks pretty mad. Uh...I’d better go.
Well, that went well. Yeah.
(To the gang) Hey, no matter what happens with Ross and Emily, we still get cake right?
Hey, what’s up? (He has solved the problem of eating the steak, he’s eating it with his hands.)
Well, I figured we’re in another country, so it doesn’t count.
(approaching) Ross, hey, the band’s ready outside for your first dance with Emily, so…
You spit on me man! (Wipes his face.)
Emily is kinda taking a long time, huh?
Hey, dude, let me in. I got a girl out here!
No you don’t, I just saw you go in there with Monica!
Look, which one of us is gonna be having s*x in there, me or you?
My Giant? I love that movie!
Can I ask you something?
Felicity and I, we’re watching My Giant, and I was thinking, "I’m never gonna be as good an actor as that giant." Do you think I’m just wasting my life with this acting thing?
I mean, the giant is like five years younger than me, y’know, you think I’ll ever get there?
Thanks man.
But what about how much taller he is than me?
I mean, there’s no way I can make myself taller now, y’know? And who knows what science will come up with in the future, but Chandler, what if I die an unsuccessful, regular sized man?
Hey, Monica, wow you’ve been in the bathroom for like a half-hour.
Had the beef-tips, huh?
Hi!
All right, I’m gonna go say hi the chick and the duck.
Why would you need to say hi to them, you’ve been feeding them for four days?
Hey, it's me! I'm comin' in!
Ahh, I'm gonna go get some chicken. Want some?
Okay.
You sure? Some extra crispy? Dirty rice? Beans?
All right!
Mornin' Pheebs!
(interrupting) Was his name Angus? (Monica and Chandler laugh.)
Oh, he was this cab driver we had in London.
Yeah-yeah-yeah, and they had that beer! That uh…
Hey, Ross, Bodington's!
That was good beer.
Y'know, I'd walk back to London for another frosty one of those bad boys.
Later! (Exits.)
(To Chandler) I bet it was about her a little.
Say that to him and you're golden. (She just glares at him.)
Hey, Pheebs!
(Jumping out of his way) See ya!! (To the girls.) What the hell was that?!
(Poking his head out.) Havin' some trouble?
I'll kick that door in if you give me a little sugar.
(In tremendous pain) All right. Good deal.
Uh, okay, Pheebs?
Umm, y'know how the other day you were talking about how you didn't get to go to London and how you were kinda feeling left out?
All right, well, we felt really bad about that so we decided we should all take a little trip together!
Yeah, all of us! All day!
Phoebe!
Mine!
Nooo, I said we needed a new plan.
Which, is the new plan!
Uh, Pheebs, you're leaking?
Okay, uh Pheebs, quick. Look! This (His video camera) is for the babies to look at someday, so is-is there anything you want to say? Y'know before it all starts?
I gotta get the before shot!
Oh! (In an announcer type voice) And so the miracle of life begins, and aaiiyyyeeee! (He grabs his side and doubles over in pain.)
Ooh, something hurts!
Are they? I didn't know I cared that much.
Oh my!
Not in my head.
(in a sexy voice) Yep! There's always room for Jell-O…
Oh, it's easy. Yeah, I-I can do it with anything. Watch uh, (snaps his fingers and in a sexy voice) Grandma's chicken salad…

(entering) Ross! Get a shot of this. (He's carrying an issue of the USA Today and hands Ross the camera.) Hey babies! These are the headlines on the day you were born! Okay, now girl baby turn away and boy babies… (Throws the paper away to reveal a copy of Playpen, which is the TV version of Playboy Magazine.) Check it out, huh?! This is what naked women looked like the month you were born. All right, now let's dive right into the good stuff. (Joey opens the magazine and Ross sticks the camera in it.)
Oh, a couple of nurses asked them out. Maybe they're with them.
Yeah, I was bummed too.
I think Saturday--(groans in pain again).

(entering from the elevator caring gifts for the kids) Hey, you guys! Look what I found in the giiiiiiift shop. (He doubles over in pain in front an old man in a wheel chair.) Get up! Get up! Get up! (The old man waves him away.)
Umm, well, what else could it be?
Or?
Well, maybe a little. I wish you hadn't seen me throw up.
(interrupting) Whoa-whoa! No-no-no-no-no, nothing is going up! Okay? Up, up is not an option--what's a urethra? (Monica whispers what it is in his ear.) Are you crazy?!
Ohh, get these things out of me!
I want the drugs Ross, I want the drugs! (He starts rocking back and forth, taking Ross with him.)
Argh!
Argh!
Oh my God.
They're so small! (Both he and Ross look at them with satisfied looks on their faces.)
Well, we were! But Ross was talking so loud on his phone they threw us out!
(to Monica and Rachel) He's talking to London!
Well no, not yet. He's calling everyone on her side of the family hoping that someone will help him get in touch with her.
Ross! Way to suck up to the family.
(entering, wearing a tux) Hey!
Don't worry, I had it dry-cleaned.
Well, I'm doing this telethon thing on TV and my agent got me a job as co-host!
A little uh, good deed for PBS and a little TV exposure, now that's the kind of math Joey likes to do!
Why don’t you like PBS, Pheebs?
I'm sorry Pheebs, I just, y'know, I just wanted to do a good deed. Like-like you did with the babies.
Whoa! Whoa! Whoa! What about you, having those babies for your brother? Talk about selfish!
Well, yeah, it was a really nice thing and all, but it made you feel really good right?
It made you feel good, so that makes it selfish. Look, there's no unselfish good deeds, sorry.
Well, may I ask for one example?
That's because all people are selfish.
Are you calling you people? (Chandler rolls his eyes.) Yeah, well sorry to burst that bubble, Pheebs, but selfless good deeds don't exist. Okay? And you the deal on Santa Clause right?
That he doesn't exist.
(To the pledge volunteers) How ya doin'? Welcome. Good to see ya!
That's great. But uh, I'm not really expecting a lot of calls.
But I'm the host!
You don't seem to understand. See, I was Dr. Drake Remoray.
(on phone) Hey Mon!
See, there was kind of a mix up in my agent's office, but I'm still on TV and that's good exposure.
Oh, uh, okay, how, how about now? (He waves his hand in front of the woman next to him and you can now see his arm on TV.)
Hello New York! (The woman bats his hand out of the way.)
(in a bored voice) PBS telethon.
What?! What good is that gonna do anybody?
Now, y'know the bee probably died after he stung ya.
Hey, excuse me, would you mind switching with me?
Come on man! You've been here all day!
(in an unenthusiastic voice) PBS Telethon.
Hey Pheebs!
$200? Are you sure Pheebs? I mean, after what Sesame Street did to ya?
And you don't a little good about donating the money?
A hamster? What, those things are like 10 bucks.
Monica? What time is it?
But it's dark out.
I guess I'll get washed up then. Watch that sunrise. (He goes into the bathroom.)
Hey!
Doesn’t seem like it's going to work, I mean…
Hi!
So I'm thinking, basically we pick it up and then we flip it.

(holding a box) Well, remember when they got in that big fight and broke up and we were all stuck in her with no food or anything? Well, when Ross said Rachel at the wedding, I figured it was gonna happen again, so I hid this in here.
You don't know how long we're gonna be in here! We may have to repopulate the Earth.
Hey, you're back!
How was your conference?
Oh, so your weekend was a total bust?
Hey, you're back too!
Hey, how was your chef thing?
(sticking his head out the door) What are you guys woofing about?
Nooooo!!! Y'know what? Now that I think about it, I constantly find myself without twenties and you always have lots!
You want my advice?
You're not gonna like it.
You got married to fast.
I told ya.
Man, if anyone asked me to give up any of you, I couldn't do it.
Hi, Rach.
I-I-I don't know if this falls under this category, but uh, Ross is right back there. (Points over his shoulder.)
Hey, you're not Kip!
Who cares? You're Rachel! (To Chandler) Who's Kip?
Oh, that poor b*st*rd.
Hey, Mr. Bing. That uh, hotel you stayed at called. Said someone left an eyelash curler in your room.
'Cause I figured you'd hooked up with some girl and she'd left it there.

Y'know, I-I don't even feel like I know you anymore man! All right, look, I'm just gonna ask you this one time. And whatever you say, I'll believe ya. (Pause.) Were you, or were you not on a gay cruise?!
(entering) (He clears his throat to get their attention.) Hey, Rach? Sorry to interrupt but umm, Phoebe wanted me to talk to you about a trip or something.
(shocked) Oh! Ohh! Oh!!
Oohh!! Ohh! Oh-oh-oh! Oh-oh!!
Ohhhhhhhhhhh!!!!!!!
(To Chandler) You?! (To Monica) And-and you?!
How?! When?!
IN LONDON!!!
But it is a big deal!! I have to tell someone!
All right! Man, this is unbelievable! I mean, it's great, but…
Aww, I don't want to see that!
I guess I'm done.
I think I'm gonna take-off.
(entering) Hey! Hey! Hey! Hey!! None of that, not while you're living under my roof!
Look, just because I know about you two, doesn't mean I like looking at it.

Well, I'm sorry if I'm not a middle-aged black woman! (Starts for his room.) And I'm also sorry if sometimes I go to the wrong audition! Okay, look, if I have to pretend I don't know about you two, then you two are gonna have to pretend there's nothing to know about.
(from the bedroom) I can hear that!
I can still hear you!
Hey!
Argh-argh!! (Catches the coat.) Ooh, soft. Is this mink?
Hey, Ross, you're okay with that?
(after Ross is gone) What is he doing? What, Emily, thinks Ross's furniture has got Rachel coodies?
No! Everything's gettin' all messed up, y'know? Emily won't let Ross see Rachel, we're not gonna stop seeing Rachel, hence Ross stops seeing us!
No! But y'know, I'm an actor, I'll act cool.
I'll take it!
Ooh-ooh-ooh, yeah! (He drapes it around his shoulders.) Enh? All right, what do you think?
What's the matter Ross?
That's way uptown! That's like three trains away! (Phoebe pinches him.) Which is great! I love to ride that rail!
Now he's movin'? Man, what is Emily doing to him? (Phoebe pinches him again.) Ow!! He's not even here!!!
Uhh, like dark hair, bushy beard?
Yeah, you fogged Danny.
Dan just moved in downstairs. Yeah, he just got back from like this four-month trek in the Andes. Nice fella.
Ohh. Hey, remember when I ran into this thing (The shutters that close off the kitchen.) and it kinda knocked me out a little?
Uhh, are you saying that you're not entirely happy about this?
You do have a choice!! Ross, why are you listening to her?! Are you, are you crazy?!

It's not right what Emily wants you to do! She is totally-(The gang enters behind Joey and Phoebe pinches him again.)-Owww!! Stop pinching me! Look, now you guys said I only had to keep my mouth shut as long as Ross was happy, right? Well he just told me that he's not entirely happy.
We all hate Emily!
Yeah!
Yes! Yes! Unreasonable!
I kinda feel like it's my fault.
Well, I'm keeping so many things to myself these days, something was bound to slip out! (He glares at Chandler.)
Look, Ross, I feel really bad. I mean, you're going through all this stuff and I just acted like a jerk.
Look, we were way out of line, we totally support you.
Hey, y'know Ross, I think I kinda understand why I kinda lost it today.

Yeah you see umm, well, I'm an actor. Right? So I gotta keep my emotions right at the surface y'know? See what I'm saying? I gotta lot of balls in the air. (Makes like he's juggling.) Y'know what I mean? It's tough! Guys like me, y'know, you wander around, you're alone…
(thinks) I'm not sure.
RACHEL PLEASE!!! JUST HAVE DINNER WITH US!!!
All right, I-I'm sorry. I'm sorry. You see Rach I'm an actor…
It's almost as if he knew.
Well uh, I don't know about who's here, but I can tell you for damn sure who's not here and that's Rachel!!
I think it's going okay. Looks like he's smiling.

You can totally tell! Here look, watch me. (He stands up and turns his back to them so that he is facing the window.) Smile! Frown. Smile! Frown. (The camera cuts to Ross outside hanging up the phone.) Smile! (Ross turns around and sees Joey alternately smiling and frowning and just stares at him for a second and heads back inside.)
What happened? What happened?
No, look. (Shows him the magazine.)
I know, I know, but look at the knobs on her.
Why?
Hey, you can stay with us! We'll take care of ya!
Yeah.
Okay.
Ross?
Not a problem. And listen, hey! Since you're gonna be here for a while, why don't—I was thinking we uh, put your name on the answering machine.
Hey, all right!
(To Chandler) You're fake laughing too, right?
Hey.
Nothing.
(smiles) Kinda.
Dude, you should've gone out once and a while.
Come on, Chandler, Ross is our friend. He needs us right now, so why don't you be a grown up and come and watch some TV in the fort!
Sorry.
Ahhhhhhhhhh…
Hey! Wanna play some foosball? Please?
No-no, no! We have to move the table into my room, yeah! 'Cause of all the boxes. Come on!
All right, I have one question. What is the deal with this? (Imitates Ross's 'quiet down' maneuver, but does move his hands up and down he just flaps his hands as if he's waving good-bye.)
No, the quiet down thing!
Um-hmm! Look, I-I-I don't know how much more of this I can take! Did you know he taped over my Baywatch tape with some show about bugs! My God! What if that had been p0rn?
All right, I guess I can hold out a little longer. Let's have a game.
YES!!
Um-hmm.
(entering) Hey!
You guys got anything to eat? I just went down to Johnos for some chicken and it was closed!
Pheebs, if this guy keeps closing down all of our favorite places, where are we gonna eat?!
Umm, yum!
Mine! (He grabs it.)
Oh that's mine too! (Grabs it and Ross looks at him.) I'm Italian!
But it's available now! Isn't it?
Hey, let's go look at it! (They both jump up.)
Okay!
Yeah!
Somebody was using his head. Hey, let's check out the rest of the place.
But hey, Ross, this place is available now!
Yeah.
Oh, it's perfect!
He knew we were trying to get rid of him. He knew! (Pause.) You think we could get a bathtub in our kitchen?
Maybe, maybe we did a good thing, helping Ross get back on his feet!
Yeah!
Yeah!
I don't know. Maybe pizza?
Oh! Oh!
Hello! (Listens.) Oh yeah! (To Chandler) It's the apartment manager; Ross put us down as references. (To the apartment manager.) Ross is the greatest guy you'll ever meet! Yeah, he's very reliable.
(getting up) Dude, I'm telling ya! I'm fine! (He tries to take a step and falls flat on his face.)
Hey!
You're kidding!
But you can't stay with Phoebe, Ross! We're-we're roomies!

Well, we got plenty of space! There-there's still some over there (Points to where the window is but sees that there isn't any space there and points towards his door.) by-by that speaker. Please, just stay!
Definitely!
All right!
Dude, stop talking crazy and make us some tea!
I need something sweet.
Ooh-ooh, I! I am thankful for this beautiful fall we've been having.

Yeah, the other day I was at the bus-stop and this lovely fall breeze came in out of nowhere and blew this chick's skirt right up. Oh! Which reminds me, I'm also thankful for thongs. (Note: Actually, I think every guy is thankful for thongs. That and spandex. J )

I mean, it's not so much an underpant as it is a feat of engineering. I mean, it's amazing how much they can do with so little material! And the way they play with your mind! Is it there? Is it not there?
Oh, come on! I wanna hear it! It wouldn't be Thanksgiving without Chandler bumming us out!
Man, it must be so cool remembering stuff like that! I don't have any past life memories.
Hey, it's not like it sounds.
(muffled) Hello?
Phoebe?
Look. (He walks out of the bathroom with his head stuck in a huge turkey.)
I know! It's stuck!!!
I put it on to scare Chandler!
Well then help me get it off! Plus, it smells really bad in here.
It's Joey.
I can't! It-it's stuck!
Sorry! Sorry.
(pointing) It worked! I scared ya, I knew it! Ha-ha!
(turning all the way around, and still not facing Chandler) Yeah, you are! (Starts dancing.) I scared you!
Hey, I wasn't the only one who looked like an idiot. All right? Remember when Ross tried to say, "Butternut squash?" And it came out, "Squatternut buash?"
You're a dork.
Yeah, they're mine.
I don't know uhh… (Pause as he thinks about it.) Well, I'm Joey. Yeah, I'm disgusting, I take my underwear off in other people's homes.
(reluctantly taking them) Chandler? A word.
That's it! I'm tired of covering for you two! This has got to stop! (Realizes he still has the underwear in his hand.) Ahh! (Throws them towards Chandler's room.) And tighty-whiteys! What are you, 8?

Oh hey, no, you're not welcome. Okay, look, I hate this! You guys keep embarrassing me! (To Monica) Yesterday, Rachel found your razor in our bathroom and I didn't know what to say, so I said it was mine and-and that I was playing a woman in a play. And one thing led to another and (He puts his leg on the chair and pulls up his pants leg to reveal that he now has shaved legs.)
Yeah, it was! All right, listen, I can't…
Oh-oh, yeah-yeah, I bet all the s*x makes it easier!
All right! But, (To Monica) you do it with me once.
Didn't think so.
Hey, Pheebs!
What's wrong buddy?
I'm surprised you didn't go home wearing your lunch.
So you uh, still wondering?
You're smart. I like that.
Oh no-no-no-no, wait-wait-wait!!
Hiya.
I'm Joey. I mean, I'm disgusting. I make low-budget adult films. (Points at Chandler, angrily.)
You guys promised you'd be more careful! I mean, come on! The good Joey name is being dragged through the mud here!
Well, I'm telling everyone about you! That's the only way to explain the underwear and the video camera that doesn't make me look like a pig!
Yeah, I like that. But no-no, how does that explain why Rachel found my underwear at your place?
Well, get ready to come out of the non-gay closet!
All right. Hey, but it better make me look really, really good. (Starts for his room.) Oh, and another thing, the video camera? Nice!!
Oh no-no-no! No-no-no-no-no-no-no!
No! I am not a pervert! Okay? It's just… I just… Kinda…
Thank you!
What?!! (He turns around and stares at Chandler who's silently pleading with Joey to go along with it.) No I'm not!!
No! No! I am not a s*x addict!
No it isn't! No, it's not. Because you can also explain it with the truth!
(thinking) I slept with Monica.
Uh yes, but it was, we just did it once uh, in London.
Of course it's true! How else would you explain all the weird stuff that's been going on?
Ahh—oy! That was the underwear I was wearing that night in London. Right Monica?
No! If anyone's a s*x addict here, it's Monica! Yeah. Yeah. She has been trying to get me back in the sack ever since London!
That makes sense!
Uhh, Monica?
But sadly I could not be enticed.

Well, I think we've all learned something about who's disgusting and who's not. Eh? All right, now, I'm going to get back to my bucket. I'm only eating the skin, so the chicken's up for grabs. (Offers it to everyone.)
What are you doing?
Why are you doing this?
Dude, you just described seven days worth of stuff. You’ve got to spread it out a little, you know. Haven’t you ever been unemployed?

Hey, don’t get religious on me, ok. (Ross looks a little confused.) A guy in your position needs to be a little better at relaxing. You know. Why do you think we have the comfortable chairs? Huh...come here…sit down. (Ross sits down.) Ready? (Joey flips the foot rest up.) Ahh!! (He reclines the chair fully.) Ohh, yeah!! Huh?!
Ohh, no, no. We’re not going to just sit. (Joey sits down and hits the speed dial button on the phone.) Shhh. (It begins to ring.)
(In a high pitched female voice) Hello Mr. Bing...I love you.
But, I love you.
And that’s Wednesday. (He reclines in his chair.) Ohh.
So Pheebs, where are you doing all, your bell ringing?
How could I not get the part? The play was about a 29-year-old Italian actor from Queens.
She’s a woman!
(Very discouraged) Okay, is there anything else?
That part was perfect for me! I can't believe I didn't get it!
Come on Ross be realistic, y'know? If I did write something, what are the chances I could get those guys to star in it?
Wait a second, I could star in it!
I can't write! Y'know I mean I-I-I'm an actor, I don't have the discipline that takes, y'know? I can't do it.
Really? You'd-you'd do that for me?!
Thanks!
Done!
It's not.
(disappointed) Oh.
Hey, how do you spell suspicious?
Because I think this character is going to be suspicious about stuff.
You're driving me crazy with that!
Don’t stop! Move the bowl further away! Ross could make that shot!
Well, you suck! But at least you suck at a man's game now.
Chandler, I can't be playing games, Ross is gonna be home soon. And I have to write five whole pages if I'm gonna stick to his schedule.
(jumping up) All right! But uh, listen, what do you say we crank it up a notch?
All right, all we need is a little lighter fluid.
Yeah, I think we said good-bye to that when we invented hammer darts.
Uh yeah, right here. (He punches his fist through the wall next to the door.)
Yeah, that's the uh, game we were playing.
You're right, you're right, I'll get back to work.
Hey!
(To Chandler) I didn't finish my five pages.
Yesterday's pages did not reflect my best work.
Dude, if you think Fireball's relaxing, you've obviously have never played.
Come on look guys, don't fight.
Hey-hey guys, hey! How about we settle this over a friendly game of Fireball? Huh? I'll go unhook the smoke detectors!
Oh, y'know the same thing happened to me one time.
Don't you remember when we were jogging in the park and we saw that really pretty bird and wanted to take a picture—I didn't have my camera!
Yeah, wow, sorry Rach.
They're brother and sister!!!
(entering) Hey guys! I was at the library all morning and I already finished my five pages for today!
No dude, Ross tore up the tickets!
Yeah, well, that's fine, but the important thing is that I finished it. And uh, I think it's really good, but y'know it'd really help me is if I could hear it. So would you guys read it for me?
Okay. (Reading.) "It's a typical New York City apartment. Two guys are hanging out." Ross (Points to him.)
Oh no! No-no, keep reading! The good part's coming up. Keep going.

A handsome man enters. (Playing the part of the handsome man.) Hey! How's it going guys? I don't know what you two were talking about, but I'd like to say thanks to both of you. You, (Ross) you wouldn't let me give up on myself, and you (Chandler) well you co-created Fireball. The end.
No-no, this only took five minutes. I spent the rest of the day coming up with new, Ultimate Fireball. (Takes out a bowling ball and a propane torch.) Ha-ha!
(Reading the scene set up.) Okay, it's a typical New York City apartment. Two girls are just hanging out.
What?! Wait-wait-wait! The handsome man was about to enter!!
All right! Here we go! 1999! The year of Joey!
What's the matter?!
All right, I'll take care of it.
Ross! Ross! Ross, listen! Who are you kissing at midnight, huh? Rachel or Phoebe?
Well you gotta kiss someone, you can't kiss your sister.
Chandler.
Dude-dude, who would you rather have kiss your sister, me or Chandler?
Yeah.
Okay, great!
Pheebs! Pheebs! Ross wants to kiss you at midnight!
Rach! Rach! Listen, I'm gonna kiss you at midnight.
So? Who would you rather have kiss you, me or Chandler?
Yeah!
So did that do anything for ya?
All right, my New Year's resolution is to learn how to play the guitar.
Well, y'know those special skills I have listed on my resume? I would love it would be great if one of those was true.
Really? Who-who have you taught?
Yeah that'd be great! Thanks Pheebs!
Nice!! Yeah! Is that part of your resolution, your new thing for today?
You all right Chandler? Is there something funny about that name?
Oh really! Where? Somewhere funny I'd bet! (Chandler is straining to keep quiet as Phoebe enters.)
See ya! All right Pheebs, I am ready for my first lesson.
Umm, okay.
Hey, Pheebs! Check-check this out. (Holds up his hand in one of Phoebe's chords.)
Yeah listen so, I thought I was getting better, so on my way home today I stopped by this guitar store and…
No.
Yes!
Yeah! (Chandler bangs the table in frustration.)
You look like a freak.

Well, everyone will enjoy my music as well. (Does a chord and Monica starts taking pictures of him and Phoebe. They both start to strike a pose with the excessive amount of pictures that Monica takes.)
Yes! Yes, I did.
(thinks) (quietly) G-sharp.
What?! I didn't touch a guitar!
No, I'm not questioning it, I'm saying it's stupid! (Notices Monica standing between them and smiling.) What?! (The camera clicks, taking another picture.)
Your other student, was you!

(looking in the Yellow Pages) Look, maybe I need to try a real teacher! Right here! Here! Andy Cooper, he teaches guitar and look ooh, there's a nice picture of him with a little kid and THE KID'S GOT A GUITAR!!!!!! (Storms out.)
(answering phone) Hello?
Uhh, Chandler's not here.
Okay.
Nice!
Oh. That is quite a situation. Uh, do you see any like, powder?
Good-good, okay, sprinkle some of that on your legs, it'll absorb some of the moisture and then you can get your pants back up.
Umm, do you see any—oh, Vaseline?
Yeah, sure, spread some of that on there.
Ross? You okay?
Really?! Uhh, what color is it?
Well, I'm just—if the paste matches the pants, you can make yourself a pair of paste pants and she won't know the difference!
(To Ross) Uh, Rachel's here, so good luck man, let me know how it works out. (He hangs up the phone and strands Ross in the bathroom.)
Oh well, you're timing couldn't be better. I am putting out fires all over the place.
What-what is it, what is it?
Oh no, no-no-no-no! I don't want to know!
I don't care, Rach! Look, I am tired of being the guy who knows all the secrets but can't tell anyone!
And you're not supposed to be gossiping!!
I'm not listening to you!
Hey, Pheebs?

Look, Pheebs, I just, I wanna apologize for, for saying that your method was stupid and-and maybe ask you to be my teacher again. And-and I promise, I won't touch a guitar until you say I'm ready. (After a short pause she hands him her guitar.) You really think I'm ready?

Wow! Cool! (He takes the guitar, stands up, and goes to play a note. However, while strumming it, he knocks it out of his hands and it bounces off the table and lands on the floor. Phoebe just stares at the guitar.)
(sitting back down) Was the chord at least right…
Howdy partner!
Umm?
Oh, no! (Starts that screaming thing again. Rachel stops him by pulling his fingers out of his ears.)
Well, then it wouldn't be a secret. So yeah, that would be okay. Yeah. Yeah!
Now? You want me to go over there now?
Do you know something?
I might know something.
What's the thing you know?
I can't tell you what I know.
Okay, fine.
You don't know!
(gasps) YOU KNOW!!!!
Yeah, I know!!!!

Too long! Oh my God, Rach, I've been dying to talk to someone about this for so long! Listen, listen, we can't say anything about this to anybody, they're so weird about that! Listen… (Phoebe returns and interrupts them.)
Oh, I am going to go for a walk in the rain.
Rach, I told you everything I knew last night! Look, it's not that big of a deal, so Monica and Chandler are doing it.
Sorry. Monica and Chandler are making love.
(thinks) I don't know.
I don't know.
(thinks) I don't know.
Ohh, I know one thing!
They did it right there on the couch.
Hey Ross!
(eyeing the flattened scone) Anybody gonna eat that?
(entering from his room) All right! Everybody ready to go to the movies?
Really?
Oh. Are you sure you don't want to come? Tom Hanks, Meg Ryan, they get mail and stuff.
All right, let's go Pheebs.
Maybe we should check the trash chute.
That's right, he almost could. Which is exactly how I got stuck there.
(snaps his fingers) He hooked up! He hooked up with someone.
He hooked up!! Tell us about her!
All right, hold on! Hold on. Hold on. This is Ross, okay? He's our friend. He obviously went crazy. He obviously lost his mind.
Phoebe! Don't put ideas in his head!
Damnit Phoebe!!
All right, put your 20 bucks down. First one to find the tasty treat wins. Okay?

All right. Let's get the contestants out of their isolation booths. (He removes the waste bucket that's over the duck and the laundry basket that's over the chicken.) And they're off! (He puts his foot in front of the chick, stopping it from moving.)
Judge rules, no violation.
Yeah!
What?!
And the duck gets the Nutter-Butter!
Judge rules, Nutter-Butter.
Yeah.
(entering) Hey Rach! Hey, you mind if I read my comic books in here?
Oh well, Chandler and Monica are over there and it's kinda hard to concentrate.
Umm, hi.
Chandler, if it really hurts that bad you should just tell her.
Whoa, dude, look out! You almost crushed my hat! (He picks a hat up from the floor. It's one of those magician stovepipe hats.)

Oh! Yeah, look there's this play all right? And I'm up for the part of this real cool like suave international guy. A real clothes horse. So I figure that everyone at the audition is gonna be wearing this kinda y'know, ultra-hip, high fashion stuff.
Yeah, like you could find something as sophisticated as this.
Great! Thanks, Rach!
All right.
Are you all right?
Pheebs! Sorry!
Pheebs, I'm so sorry.
All right, then you'd better show me some of that too then.
Really? A purse?
It looks like a women's purse.
See look, women, carrying the bag. (He puts it on his shoulder and looks at himself in the mirror and likes what he sees.) But it is odd how a women's purse looks good on me, a man.
Maybe you need s*x. I had s*x a couple days ago.
Well, I ain't gonna say no to that.
Hey!

What? Are you referring to my man's bag? At first, I thought it just looked good, but it's practical too. Check it out! It's got compartments for all your stuff! Your wallet! Your keys! Your address book!
Yeah, but sandwich time is right now. (Removes a sandwich and starts eating.)
Why would I return it? I love this bag!
Fine! Do you take Vasa or Mustercard? (He's holding the fake credit cards that come with the bag.)
All right relax, look I'll pay you with the money from the acting job I am definitely gonna get thanks to you.
U-N-I-sexy? (Smiles provocatively.)
Hey Pheebs, I'm so sorry.
Here, I brought you some flowers. (He pulls them out of the bag.)

(approaches, wearing his glasses) Hey you guys, check it out. Check it out. (Moves his hand towards and away from his face.) It's like it's coming right at me. (Chandler helps out a little bit by pushing on Joey's arm, which causes his hand to slap him in his face.)
What did you say to him?
(entering, with bag) Hey! I'm off to my audition. How do I look?

Y'know what? Make fun all you want. This is a great bag! Okay? And it's as handy as it is becoming. Now, just because you don't understand something, doesn't make it wrong. All right? So from now on you guys are gonna have to get used to the fact that Joey, (pats the bag) comes with a bag! (Exits.)
(reading from the script) Well, you must be new here. Why don't we get a table and I'll buy you a drink.
Yeah, sure. (He takes it off and starts reading.) Well, you must be new here. Maybe we should—I'm sorry, can I ask you something? (He stops and asks a question.)
Well, first it's not a purse.
I mean if-if you're thinking it's a woman's bag, it's not. It's a man's bag!
All right look, let me show you the catalog! (Does so.) See? Huh? It's the latest thing! Everyone's got one! Men! Women! Children! Everyone's carrying them!
Noooo. No-no-no, these babies sell themselves.
Yeah but I didn’t read anything.
Okay! All right, I'll see ya. (As he's walking off stage.) (Patting the bag.) We got it! We got it!
(dejected) Hi.
Estelle said I didn't get it. (Sits down next to Rachel on the couch.)
Yeah, I thought so too but, she said the casting people had some problems with me.
Well to tell you the truth, they uh, (Pause) they had a problem with the bag!
Y'know what? It was a stupid play anyway!
I don't wanna give up the bag. I don't have to give up the bag! Do I Rach? (She's avoiding his eyes.) Oh, you think I should give up the bag!
I can't believe I'm hearing this!
Hey, yeah! Then we could do that telephone thing! Y'know, you have a can, we have a can and it's connected by a string!
(entering) Hey guys!
What? What?
You mean how they're friends and nothing more? (Glares at Rachel.)
Yes, but y'know what? It doesn't matter who knows what. Now, enough of us know that we can just tell them that we know! Then all the lying and the secrets would finally be over!
No-no-no! No-no wait Rach, you know what would even be more fun? Telling them.
I can't take any…
Noo! I can't take any more secrets! (To Rachel) I've got your secrets. I've got their secrets. I got secrets of my own y'know!
Oh yeah? Well, you don't know about Hugsy, my bedtime penguin pal. (Joey shies away.)
Ugh.
Yeah?
Well I didn't tell them!
Uhhh, Phoebe and Joey.
And Rachel. I would've told you but they made me promise not to tell!
I'm sorry! But hey, it's over now, right? Because you can tell them that you know they know and I can go back to knowing absolutely nothing!
No! Not unless! Look this must end now!
I'm listening.
So he likes to break stuff.
Yeah, poor cat, never saw that big butt coming.
No.
They know you know.
I couldn't even if I wanted too.
(looking out the window) Hey-hey, check it out! Check it out! Ugly Naked Guy has a naked friend!
(entering the hall) Oh man! Aren't you guys done yet?! I wanna sit in my chair!
Ooh!
I like that! (To Phoebe) Oh, okay! Show him your bra! He's afraid of bras! Can't work 'em! (He swiftly rips open the front of Phoebe's dress revealing her bra.)
It's not my first time.
Dude!
All right! So that's it! It's over! Everybody knows!
(panicking) Dude! He's right there!

Okay, all right, whew! What do you say we all clear out of here and let these two lovebirds get back down to business? (Ross turns and glares at him.) Hey-hey-hey, I-I-I'm just talking here, he-he's the one doing your sister.
(quickly) I call Godfather!
Sure, if you cared enough to call it first.
(to her) Oh, hey Katie! Everyone, this is Katie.
So, are you ready to go?
Oh sure, right back there. (Points.)
I was thinking Chinese food.
I don't know. I mean I like her a lot, and she's really nice, but…
(shyly) She keeps punching me.
Hey, it's a lot harder than it looks! Okay? (Quietly) She-she-she's hurting me.
(sets the coffee down) Y'know, breadstick fangs are always funny.

Uhh, look Katie, uh listen, we-we need to talk. Okay? Umm, look I like you. I-I really do, I like you a lot. Okay? But sometimes when you, when you playfully punch me like that it-it feels like someone's hitting me with a very tiny but very real bat.
No-no.
Yeah, big!
Uh-oh, shht! The Misses.
Hey!
Thanks! I've been working out. Hey listen, is it obvious that I'm wearing six sweaters?

Well look, I’m breaking up with Katie so I had to put on some extra padding. Y'know? I mean, if she hits me when she's happy, can you imagine how hard she's gonna hit me when I tell her I'm taking away the Joey love?
Hey! Hiya!
Huh.
Uhh….
Nah.
What a bad idea!
She's right y'know.
Hey Ross, will you pass me that knife?
Oh, it's okay. You don't have to be so mean about it.
That's not funny at all!
Hey!
What are you guys doing up?
(thinks) Dark red.
Aww, you guys are so cute!
All right, I'll see you in the morning.
(entering) Hey, you guys!
(To Monica) Hey. That uh, that my sweatshirt?
Well uh, it's just that uh, y'know if-if you're gonna be wearing someone's sweatshirt shouldn't it be your boyfriends--and I’m not him.
No-no! No! I mean it's gonna be all smelling like Monica!
No! No, you smell like a meadow. (Pause.) I'm sorry. (Runs to the bathroom.)
(To Phoebe) Hey! (Sees that Monica's there.) Oh.
Yeah, I didn’t know you guys were going to be here.
(backing away) What?! Why?!
Nothing!
All right! There is something. I kinda had a dream, (pause) but I don't want to talk about it. (Starts for his room.)
Well, it involved Monica.
Don't worry, there wasn't any s*x in it or anything. I haven't dreamt about her like that since I found out about you two--ish.
Well, okay. You were my girlfriend and we were doing the crossword puzzle. Y'know like you guys were doing last night. So, that's it. I'm in love with Monica and I'll be moving out.
It-it doesn’t?
That kinda sounds like your dream dude.
In the dream I did enjoy the closeness.
(looks at her) Not really.

No, I don't think it's just about just getting a girlfriend. Y'know? I mean, yeah, I can get a girlfriend! Yeah, we could sit in the chair and do crosswords, but y'know are we ever going to have y'know the closeness like-like you guys have?
Friends first? That's interesting.
No, never done that either.
(in a sexy voice) How you doin'?
Oh, I'd love too, but I got acting class. But y'know what? I guess I can blow that off, (In a sexy voice) for you.
Uh, hey, Rach let me ask you something. Uh, I was just over there talking to Monica and Chandler, boy they are really tight.
Yeah that's not such a bad situation they got going over there. I'm thinking of getting me one of those.
Well, the reason I think Monica and Chandler are so great…
…is because they were friends first. Y'know? So I asked myself, "Who are my friends?" You and Phoebe, and I saw you first. So…
I'm saying maybe you and I crank it up a notch.
I'll treat you real nice. (Pulls out a chair for her.)
Won't-won't that take longer?
Yeah. I understand. I understand. (Pause) Man, I wish I saw Phoebe first!
(entering) Hey!
Yeah, yeah, I met this woman. (Starts for his room.)
Uhh, well, she's…really good in bed.
(To Rachel) Well look, hey, it's all your fault!

Well because you didn't give me advice! No! You gave me a pickup line! As soon as I told her I wanted to y'know, build a foundation and be friends first. I suddenly, through no fault of my own, became irresistible to her! (Pause) And her roommate!
Closeness-shmoshness! There was three of us for crying out loud!
(entering) All right! Hey, who wants pizza?!
(taking a bite) Oh, great! Can you believe I found it on the second floor?
Uhh, just a minute officer!!
Boy, that guy's underwear sucks!
I got this pair marked excess, I gotta tell ya, there was no room for excess anything in there.
That's right Ross, I can see you in your new apartment! And you can see me! Same as yesterday, (To Monica) same as the day before.
Nope. Op, wait! There he goes.

(waving) Very funny Ross! Very life-like and funny. Okay. (Notices that a woman is waving back.) Oh no-no-no, I wasn't waving at you lady. (She just stares at him.) (Joey sees how beautiful she is.) Whoa, maybe I was! Hey, Monica, this totally hot girl in Ross's building is flirting with me.

Yeah, I-I-I'm down with that. (He turns back to the woman.) Okay, here goes. (Thinks.) How (Holds up his hand like an Indian) you (Points at her) a-doin'? (Does a little twisting motion with both hands and ends up pointing at her, he then winks. She smiles and waves again.) (To Monica) It worked! She's waving me over. (Towards the woman.) Okay, I-I-I'll be right over. Let's see, she's on the third floor…
Tell me about it, huh? (Realizes that she can see Monica.) Oh no-no-no, I'm not with her, she's just Monica! (He pantomimes that out.) Ewwuck! (He pushes Monica away and makes a disgusted face.)
This is your place?
But I counted, you're not supposed to live here! Oh man! (Runs away.)
Ugh!!

I ended up at Ross's place. Oh, I musta missed counted or something. (Looks out the window.) Damn! She's not there anymore. Oh, l-l-look, Ross is doing his 'Watching TV' bit. (We see Ross sitting on the couch and flipping through the channels on his remote.)
Did you tell the guy you wanted to have s*x with his wife and then fall right out of your chair?
What happened?
You kissed him?!
I bet that kiss isn't looking like such a big mistake now, is it?
Yeah! (Chandler makes a noise) No?
Oh Rachel look, don't say that, I think you just need a hug from Joey. Come on. Come on. (She hugs him and Joey looks out the window.) She's back! Hot girl's back!

No, in Ross's building! (He throws Rachel onto the chair and heads to the window.) She's back! She's back! (Pantomimes) Okay, wait there, I'll be over in a second. (He counts where she is again.) Got it! (Runs out and does a little hot over a chair.)
Damnit!! Did you move?!
(Looking around) Uhh do you happen to have a hot girl in there?
Yeah. Sorry about that. (He walks away and knocks on the next door which is answered by a little girl.) Oh, hey little girl. Uhh, is-is your mommy, or sister, or babysitter by any chance a hot girl?
Later! (He runs away down the hall and hides behind a corner to a whole other corridor.) Oh man! (Walks down the hallway in desperation.) Hot girl! Hot girl!!
(entering) Hey guys! (Sees their state of undress) What 'cha been doin'? (Has a silly grin.)
I don't know. But I can see through your sheet. (He looks out the window.) Yeah, yeah, that's her. But y'know what? Doesn't matter, I'm never gonna get to meet her anyway.
Because it's impossible to find her apartment! She lives in some like of hot girl parallel universe, or something.
No. No. No. She lives on the third floor, eighth apartment from the left.
I did not know that! Thank you Monica. (Starts to leave) I can't believe I almost lost another girl because of counting.
Dahhhhh!! (Ross has a puzzled look on his face.) No! Noooo!! (Storms off.)
Okay, pick a card.
All right now, memorize it. (Pause) You got it?
(holding up the Queen of Clubs) Is that your card? (He winks and smiles.)

(reading the card) Whoa! This guy is like the biggest commercial casting director in town! (Ross gasps) Ben takes one lousy walk in the park and gets an audition!! (Ross and Carol stare at him, then Joey realizes what he just said.) I mean, way to go Ben! (Gives Ben the thumbs up, which Ben returns.) Man! I've been in that park a million times and no one offered me an audition.
I'm always on the swings! What am I doing wrong?!
Luck!
Whoa-whoa, but her birthday isn't like for another month.
Ross!! We're having a surprise party for Rachel!!
Done.
They're gonna do it together.
What, so I gotta shut it down now?
Whoa-whoa dad? There's a dad in the commercial?
Whoa, hey, maybe I'll go down there with ya and see if I can get an audition to play the dad. I mean who better to play Ben's father than his godfather.
What?! Are you kidding?!
All right!
Hey! I'm in, they're gonna let me audition!
I know! I know! It turns out that one of the casting ladies has actually seen me in a play, so I steered clear of her…

Oh yeah, yeah! He's done tons of commercials. I've seen him in like Sugar Smacks, Playstation, and that one for the phone company. In fact he was so good in that one, he actually convinced me to switch phone companies. Chandler was mad….
That's great. Listen, wouldn't it be great though if I got to play Ben's dad?
I look more like him than you do! (He winks at Carol.)
(also downtrodden) Yeah, I had to teach Ross my bit because I actually didn't get a callback.
(Happily) Yeah I did!
Well, unfortunately, I don't get many callbacks so…
Who knows?
Oh this is great! I might actually get to play Ben's dad!
Man, this is gonna be kinda weird.
Hey Pheebs! (To the guys) Hey!
Ross good, I'm uh glad you're here. I wanna talk to you about something.

Well, I've been thinking about this whole commercial thing, y'know me going up against Ben, the two of us competing, and that can't lead to anything good. So, I think I'm just gonna step aside. I'm gonna tell them that I won't audition.
That's it? You're-you're gonna let me do this?! This-this is my career we're talking about here!
I just said that so you wouldn't let Ben do it! Look Ross, if anyone should step aside it should be Ben!
What? Chandler! Tell 'em!
At least I care about his feelings!
Do you know how hard this is gonna be on him when he doesn’t get it?
Oh, come on! Have you seen what my kid can do?! Huh?! I mean he dials phones! He-he-he eats tortilla chips! He-he plays soccer with the cartoon tiger!
You just give him a spoon baby!
Yeah! Because this commercial belongs to me and Mitch!
Yeah?! So's yours!
Hmmm, soup! (Tries again.) Hmm soup! (Tries again, with a little caveman thrown in.) Hmm, soup!
Oh yeah, no problem.

(goes over to Ben) Hi Ben! So you wanna be an actor huh? I gotta tell ya, it's no picnic. There's tons of rejection. No stability. One day you're Dr. Drake Remoray, the next day you're eating ketchup right out of the bottle.
(angrily) Ross!
Hi!
Uh-oh.
Well this is noodle soup and uh, I've been working with tomato. But that's okay, no problem. No problem. Hmm, noodle soup.
Oh, what did I say?
How's that different? (She looks at him until he gets it.) Oh! Yeah!
Hmm, noodle soup.
Okay.
Hmm, soup. (Pause.) I mean, noodle soup. I mean soup!
No! No! I-I can do it one more time! See? Look! (Eats another spoonful) Hmm, noodle soup. Damnit! (Storms out.)
Hey.
Yeah right! (Gets up for a refill to his snow cone.)
Yeah? Well look Ross, you don't have to. Okay? It's not your fault I suck. I mean what kind of an actor can't even say, "Hmm, noodle soup." (Nods his head in disgust.)
What you do mean?
Wait-whoa-whoa, you lost me.
Well, you're way sounds a lot better than mine. (Thinks about it.) Yeah. Yeah! It's not that I'm a bad actor…
No, it's just ah, I care so damn much about little Ben that uh, it was more important to see him succeed.
Thank you! So, did-did he get it?
Eh, what are you gonna do?
(entering, with his grandmother) Hey everybody, look who's here! You remember my grandmother!
Chandler, she doesn't understand a word of English.
She's my biggest fan. Yeah, she's the only one in the family that's believed in me.
Yeah, I uh weighted like 27 pounds when I was born so…
Wow Pheebs, you speak Italian?
Okay, see that blind guy right there? I'm gonna bash his head in later.
Oh umm, my big scene is coming up. Big scene coming up.
(walking past) True story! (Goes and sits down.)
Okay, here's my big scene. My big scene's here! (They have two of the cops on the street, then they cut to where they're entering an apartment.) Oh my God.
(smiling) Okay, everybody just keep smiling. It'll kill my grandmother if she finds out.
(smiling) Oh, they cut me out of the show.
(smiling) Not likely.  'Cause you see that body bag right there
