There it is, you're blushing!
You like someone. Tell me who it is. Who is it? (tickles her a little)
Tell me who it is.
Come on who? Who do you like? Tell me. You're not getting away that easy. Who do you like, who?
What? Why not? Rach, who can you not get?
(eagerly) Yeah, who is that?
Yeah.
Right, of course. Hey, did you guys finish the speech?
Alright, hey look, and this isn't over, because I really wanna know who...
Yeah. (they leave)
Night.
He said "erectus"!
No, he really said it.
Erectus?
Yeah, and so funny!
Hey! (stands up) As soon as it stops raining we have got to go snorkeling! Some kid told me about the sea turtle and, if you blow bubbles in its face, it chases ya! (smiles ecstatic)
(disappointed) Oh... oh, but that's ok, I'll find someone else to do it... I'll do it alone, but... I don't know what happens if the sea turtle catches you...
(interrupting her) Hey! Don't worry about it! It was fine! I ended up having the best time with Rachel! I just felt bad for you, stuck in that room, working on Ross's speech... (pulls a face)
(bewildered) Oh! Oh, well! At least we're both having fun!
Yeah! A little bit, yeah...
Yeah... I think we do... (sighs, with folded arms)... about what?
(downhearted) Hey...
Uh... Charlie and I broke up.
Oh well, she said we have nothing in common.
No, it's not, we have nothing in common!
I mean, she should be with someone like... Ross! You know what I mean, he uses all those big words too! Man, smart people are dull!
(laughing sarcastically) Ok, Rach!
I feel so stupid, you know? Why... why do I keep going after the wrong girls?
Oh, c'mon, I mean, there's you, then there's Charlie, and it's like... (sighs) What the hell is my problem? OH! (He falls back on the bed)
(sitting up again) I'm telling you, Rach, Charlie is not right for me!
But then who? The waitress I went out with last month? (gives her a meaningful look)
(stands up) No-no-no-no, no! Who, who were you talking about?
Ok! All right, well... I'm gonna see if I can get a room for the night and I'll... I'll see you later!
You like me? (shuts the door)
(shocked) That's a huge thing!
What... for how long?
(outraged) A MONTH??
(stands up) I just have one question!
(desperate) What the hell are you doin'???
Uh, am I curious? I mean, I am as curious as... as... George!!
CURIOUS GEORGE! You know, the monkey, and the guy with the yellow hat!
Yeah, he had a paper route.
No, I know, yeah I know we're great but Rach no... this... this can't happen!
(charmed, but then recoiling) NO, NO! It can't happen at all!

Because... look, no one wants this to happen more than me, ok? (in a trembling voice) I have gone over this moment in my head a hundred times and not once did I ever say no! (sighs) I couldn't do it to Ross!
I know, I know! But I've thought about it a lot since, and it just wouldn't be right... (painfully) I'm sorry...!
NO! No-no-no-no-no-no! Hey! Hey, we'll be fine! Li... hey, like you said: no big deal!
NO BIG DEAL!
Yeah! I'll see ya later! Yeah!
Ooh... I can't believe I'm kissing you. I'm kissing Rachel!
Well, I only said that because of Ross, you know. Then I saw him kissing Charlie...
Oh my God, it's Ross. What are we gonna do?
No idea what it means.
I don't believe this... Have you guys been...
Is he gone?
Pssst...
Well, he's with Charlie now.
(long pause and he twitches a bit) You're a pain in my ass, Geller!
Probably, yeah... I mean, maybe we should... hold off until we talk to Ross.
Yeah, I think that'd be best... So, so I'm gonna... I'm gonna take off...
(turns around very fast) I like although!
Six years? Wow... It's almost as long as highschool...
Absolutely! He's not thinking about you.
I'm thinking about you...
Let's forget about Ross...
What's wrong?
Well, maybe I can help. (he grabs her head passionately, closes his eyes and kisses... Ross in Rachel's dress! He realises it too late, and when he does, pushes Ross's/Rachel's head away)
Yeah... we really need to talk to Ross...
Whoo, whoo. Wow, it's uhm... kinda weird that I'm sitting next to Charlie after we broke up.
Look, does someone mind switching to sit with Charlie?
I understand...
I guess so. I'm just... really nervous.
Ooh...
I'm gonna get the lasagna.
Hey!
Yeah?
You kissed.
I saw you.
Ross, Ross, Ross... It's okay.
It's okay. You know, I totally understand, alright? You guys, make way more sense than her and I ever did, you know. And... I want you to be happy.
Yeah... Now I have something...
Oh... uh... look... before you...
I am those things, yeah.
Dude!
I can't think of anything.
Yeah.
I couldn't. He was saying all these really nice things about me. I didn't want him to get mad and take 'em all back. I'm on a edge on Chandler.
Thank you. Yeah, I appreciate that.
Hey!
So, did you err... did you tell Ross?

No, no, no, no, no, no, no, no... I think it's better if you tell him, you know. It's easier for a woman. That way, you know, if he gets mad, all you have to do is go... I didn't mean it. I'm so so--ooory. (he pushes his breasts together from the side)
Alright, alright, okay, uhm... How 'bout this, how about this? Tomorrow... tomorrow we'll both go and we'll tell him together.
I know, I know..., but that's okay. I mean, we can control ourselves, we're not animals.
Yeah! Good night! (they give each other a small kiss on the mouth, and stare at each other for a while)
Good night! (they give each other a kiss again, but this time it lasts longer)
Stop saying good night.
Okay, Ross, I realise that you didn't expect to walk in and see that, but.. Let me explain, okay?
Rach, he just saw us.
But what you saw, that is the extent of it, okay? One kiss.
Look, we probably should have talked to you about this before it ever happened, but..
Yeah, but it did happen, so...
Ross?
No, no, no!
Probably.
No, no!
Really?
Ross..
Look, don't you think that will be a little weird?
I do like fajitas.
Ah, can I just say I know we're doing this for Ross, and that's cool, but if it was up to me, this is not what we'd be doing on our first date.
I'd take you out for a romantic night. Some champagne, fancy dinner, feel you up on the carriage ride home...
In a carriage!
Hey, Charlie!
So, did you bring a little something for Ross?
Oh. Oh, thanks.
Yeah, I didn't throw any of that out..
Uh, actually, that's..
Okay, listen, hey, Ross. Why don't you try to relax, okay? Maybe have a drink.
Dude, are you okay? And when are the fajitas gonna be ready?
Dude, are you okay?
You know what? I think I'm gonna stay here and make sure he's okay.
Yeah. I'll see you in the morning.
It doesn't look good, does it?
Morning. Here you go.
Yeah.

No, no, no. You actually did that when you were dancing to the Chicago-soundtrack. Look, Ross, about, about Rachel and I. Listen, you don't have to worry about that, okay? Because nothing is gonna happen.
Well, she and I said from the beginning that we weren't gonna do anything unless you were okay with it. And clearly..
It's okay, Ross, alright? I totally understand. Of course you're not fine. You're.. You're Ross and Rachel.
That's what I hear, yeah.
Come on, I mean, you know me, you know...
I'm crazy about her.
I think so.
Yeah, but, Ross, I mean, you're not okay with it.
No, no, no, no, that was - that was just for me. Are you sure about this?
And we're okay?
Yeah. It's actually our first official date
Naa, no. This is the part I'm actually good at.
(pause) It's OK!
Well, I... I know exactly what I'm gonna do!
No, no no no no. See. Each woman is different.You have to appreciate their uniqueness.
No, I do six things! First, I look deep in her eyes. Then, I kiss her. Next I take my hand and I softly graze her thigh.
NO! Not like that, no no. No, like this. (He starts lightly grazing Chandler's thigh)
More foosball?
I thought you paid. (Rachel does not answer and seems puzzled) Ha, guess we won’t be going back there!
Yeah.
Hey what do you say, we move this onto the likes of the couch?
What’s the matter?
I don’t get it, Chandler loved it!
Ok.
(a little giddy) Uh, was that good for you?
Rach, you sure you wanna do this?
Ok. Well, how, how can we make it easier?
Ok, yeah, got it.
This thing welded shut?!
All right, turn around, I got to get a look at this thing.
Sorry!

I'm sorry! (He stands up) This never happened to me before! I'm an expert at taking off bras! I can do it with one hand! I can do it with my eyes closed! One time I just looked at one, and it popped open! I blame your bra!
Then I blame you! Yeah! That's right! You threw me off with all your slapping!
(contemplates for a few moments what Rachel just said) NAH! I don't have another level!!
Hey Chandler can I talk to you for a second (points to the hall).
(To Rachel) Hey!
Yes ma'am, ready to Power through!
Uh! (When she's done she throws her bra at him)
Ok, you're scaring me a little bit.
Oh! yeah!
uh uh!
No, no, no! You kneed me in my misters!
(He just sits there, legs very close together with a painful look on his face) Soldier down!
Well, I know what's the matter with me.
I don't know.
Yeah, was there a part of you that... felt like it was... really wrong?
Yeah, yeah... Absolutely. I mean, just because something's difficult doesn't mean that you quit.
Yeah, so we just keep trying and trying until we... do it.
That's a... pla-an.
(sighs) Wow... I did not see this coming.
I don't get it. I mean, I was so sure this was what I wanted.
I guess they weren't as good friends as we are.
So...
I love ya.
Yeah, me too.
Ooh, yeah, I'm not going anywhere for a while.
Hey!
18, uh? (starts to prepare himself to say his "How You Doin'" line)
What, what!? it's for her hot friends!
And starting to think about settling down!
I'd love to! Yeah!
(To Phoebe) We were supposed to bring presents?
Oh, yeah! How was I supposed to know?

Yeah, but for a one-year-old. What's the point... the other day she laughed for like an hour at a cup. Just a cup with a picture of Elmo on it dressed as a farmer. And he's standing next to this cow and the cow says "El-moo"! (Joey starts laughing) Yeah... that's a funny cup!
Hey Mr. and Mrs. Geller! Let me help you with that.
Oh man, this is great, uh? The three of us together again! You know what would be fun? If we gave this present to Emma from all of us!
Hey Pheebs, you know what? I was thinking... since you wrote a song, maybe I could do something for Emma using my talents!
No, no, no! My talents as an actor!
You know, I could like maybe... I could do a dramatic reading of one of her books!
Hey, I think Emma might like it!
Um, my present!
Actually we prepared performances.
But equally real!
(unconfidently) O K.
Hey, I do it every week with three cameras pointed at me and a whole crew waiting!
I will be doing a dramatic reading of one of Emma’s books.

Uh, why, it’s a... (he picks a book up) one of her favorites, uh, (he reads the title of the book) “Riding the Storm Out. Coping with post-partum depression” eesh! (he puts the book back and picks up another) “Love you forever”. Love you forever. By Robert Munsch. Published by Firefly books. Printed (he pauses and changes the tone to a dramatic one) in Mexico. A mother held her new baby and very slowly rocked him back and forth, back and forth, back and forth, and while she held him she sang “I’ll love you forever, I’ll like you for always, as long as I'm living, my baby you’ll be”. (the picture fades and Joey is now finishing the book). And while he rocked her, he sang “I’ll love you forever, I’ll like you for always, as long as I'm living, my baby you’ll be”.
I'm so confused!
Got it! (Goes towards the front door and stands with his back to it) Hey hey hey! (to Chandler) Where do you think you're going?
Alright, well the rest of you get comfortable, ok, because we're gonna be here for a li...(stops and thinks) Wait a minute, there is a window in there!
Well, that one did not have Emma's face on it.
No.
Ok! (Opens the door for them)
Nighty-night!
Bye, bye.
Hey, hey, hey, hey! I'm not gonna mess with Jack, he's a great man, he fought for our country.

Oh! I forgot you used to live here!
Hello?
Hey! (smiles)
(smile fades) What audition?
What? You never said anything about an audition!
A monologue? I don't have.. (sees the book he was reading before for his "dramatic reading") I got it. (hangs up) (announces to the room) Aah! so... I'm gonna take off!
Oh! I got it! Ok, everyone pick a number from one to ten. Alright? Whoever gets the highest number gets to go first.
Okay, Monica picks ten, I call nine! Anyone else?
Or.. we could flip a coin, and then multiply the..
Right.
Ok, ladies and gentlemen, wind your toys! (they do so)
Come on robot!
Way to go robot!
Hey, good race you guys.
Okay, if Ross and Rachel ask, I've been here the whole time. THE WHOLE TIME!
(to Ross and Rachel) I've been here the whole time!
What is wrong with me. It looked more delicious when it was a pen1s.
Her first cookie? She has cookies all the time!
No! No... and, for the record, I've also never given her a frosting from a can!
U-U-Um, I think there's been an oversight.
Whoo-weh hey weh-hey whoo hey!!
I gotta a lot of nice stuff to say about you guys, ok? And I know how much you wanna have a baby, you know, and I would love to help you get one.
Thank you! Alright, let me see how I'm gonna start... "Dear baby adoption decider people..."
Hey!
Uhm... Aren't you a little overdressed?
That's right, yeah.
Always nice to meet a fan!
I know, she may be the hottest girl I've ever hated.
(using a laptop) Oh, Monica and Chandler's recommendation. I want it to sound smart but.. I don't know any big words or anything, so...
What did I just say?
Oh my God, that's great! I'm smart!! No, no, I'm... (he uses the Thesaurus) "brainy, bright, clever", I love this thing! Look out ladies, Joey Tribbiani's got the whole package!!
Hey, finished my recommendation. (he hands it over to Chandler) Here. And I think you’ll be very, very happy. It’s the longest I ever spent on a computer without looking at p0rn.
(sounding very proud of himself) Some of the words are a little too sophisticated for ya?
Of course it does! It’s smart! I used the the-saurus!
Yep!
Oh, ‘They are warm, nice, people with big hearts’.
Yeah, yeah and hey, I really mean it, dude.
Why not?
Ah, look who’s back! (he sees the bags) Why do you have bags? RACH, WHY DOES SHE HAVE BAGS?
What?
You slept out here?
But uhm, we're getting rid of her, right? Rach, please tell me we’re getting rid of her.
Oh, come on! Last night I was finishing off a pizza and she said (aping Amy badly) "Uoh oh oh, a moment on the lips, forever on the hips!" I don’t need that kind of talk in my house!
'Cause we will appreciate it more when she’s gone?
Yeah, Monica made us!
Yeaah.
(yelling at her) I’M CURVY, AND I LIKE IT!
Great, I'm finished! In fact, I just dropped it off at the agency.
Yeah.
No can do amigo. No, I didn't use the computer. Felt more personal to hand-write it. (Chandler and Monica look even more shocked)
Yeah, and don't worry. I didn't try to sound smart at all! See ya later! (Leaves)

(picks up the phone) Hello? Yeah, this is Joey Tribbiani... Oh, hi! Well, I'm glad you liked my letter... No my mommy and daddy aren't home right now... (looks puzzled) Okay, bye bye. (hangs up) (to himself) She was nice!
Whoo-hoo! (and leaves for Rachel's room)
(Yelling from Rachel's room) She has a lot of crap!
Hey!
Well, hey! Well... (he takes his mug to toast Phoebe) Here's to Phoebe, who's found the greatest guy in the world! To Phoebe and... (a bit uncertain) I wanna say Mike? (pause) To Phoebe and Mike!
(Looking inside the fridge, and we only see his back. Then he closes the door, and we see it's Joey.) Hi sweetie!
No.
Cool!
That's great! Hey, can you cast me in it?

What do you mean? I can do anything, I'm a chameleon! Huh? (he mimes an old man with a beard) I'm old! (then he yawns) I'm tired! (then he mimes someone who's hot...) Hey, I'm hot (...and cold) I'm cold!! Huh?? Come on! What can't I do?
I can do that! (in a deeper voice) "Hello, I'm your professor. When I'm not busy thinking of important things or... professing. I like to use..." Oh, what's the product?
(after a long pause he starts miming again) I'm cold!
Oh! Any word on casting yet?
What do you mean? Rach, don't I seem like a professor you'd buy some kind of e-crap from?
Just watch it, and if you don't like it, you don't pass it on to your bosses!
Thank you. (he sits down)
Damn it! (he leaves)
Just pass it to your boss!
What's up?
(sounds disappointed) Oh.
(looks at him suspiciously) But, ehm... you watched the tape?
(sounds confident) You didn't watch the tape.
Look, it's one thing not to cast me, but to lie to me?
Well, you lied again! (Rachel comes out of her room and is observing the conversation)
Keep going Pinocchio!
(yelling back) No you didn't! (turns and goes towards his room)
You still here?

Ok whoah-hey... Let me just stop you right there, ok? First, you lied, right? Then, you lied about lying, ok? Then you lied about lying about lying, ok? So before you lie about lying about lying about lying about... lying... (loses count and begins to count the number of 'lyings' in the air but gives up.) (yelling) Stop lying!
(very angry) You wanna know wh...? You wanna know why? (goes back into his room)

(comes out holding the tape) Here's how I know you didn't watch the tape, ok? (puts it into the vcr) If you had seen what was on this tape, believe me, you would have some comments. Alright, now remember, I got paid a lot of money for this and it only aired in Japan. (presses play and he appears on the TV screen and a TV commercial begins)
(Yelling at Chandler) And that's how I know you didn't watch the tape! (goes back to his room and slams the door).
(enters from his bedroom) What?
I got it from Monica. She sold it to me for a very reasonable price.
But it's an original Buffay...
Hey? what? what? wey! whoo! what? what!?
GET THAT LEGLESS WITCH OUT OF HERE!
That's not the point Chandler. The point is that you lied.
Now, what do you say?
And?... AND?
Gladys?
You're mean!
Hey!
What's going on?
Hey, is this person who decides whether or not you... get a baby?
Hey, maybe I should stop by! She could be a soap opera fan! It's very impressive when the little people know a celebrity.
(pointing at himself) Celebrity.
(going out with the VCR in his hand) Well, I guess we'll never know whose it is!
(form the other side of the door) Hellooo? Anybody in there order a celebrity?
Guys? Everything ok? It's me, Joe...
Guys!?
What's going on?
Everything doesn't sound fine!
Well, you wouldn't let me in, so I thought you were in trouble.
But you called me 'Bert'!? That's our code word for danger!
We don't? We really should. From now on, 'Bert' will be our code word for danger.
(quivering with anger) I did not care for that!
Ok, ok! (He leaves)
I forgot my bat.
(to Chandler) Bert! Bert! Bert! Bert!
Uhm... ok... uhm... Well, yeah... You have got some nerve, coming back here. I can't believe you never called me.
Oh... yeah... Probably you don't even remember my name. It's Joey, by the way. And don't bother telling me yours, because I totally remember it... lady. Yeah! I waited weeks for you to call me.
No, no! Don't try to turn this around on me, ok? I'm not some kind of... social work, ok, that you can just... do.
Really? Think about it. Come on! You're a beautiful woman, smart, funny, we had a really good time, huh? If I had your number, why wouldn't I call you?
No, no, hey, no! Too late for apologies... ok? You broke my heart. You know how many women I had to sleep with to get over you? (and he leaves the apartment, leaving her shocked)
(acting sad) NO! I waited a long time, I can't wait anymore... (and closes the door behind him)
LAURA! (and points to her, very confident)
Don't you put words in people's mouths, you put turkey in people's mouths!
Three tickets to today's Rangers game!!
Oh.
Yeah, they're great seats too!
Center ice.
So we'll leave before it's over, we'll be back in time.
Dude, two times that happened!
Right, I guess. Alright, so see you at four.
That's some gentle comedy, dude. (he and Ross leave)
Yeah!
Oh, Bob, get off the guy!
I know, yeah.
Yeah. I am sorry he's not here too, but I got to say, (takes some nachos from a plate on the seat where Chandler should have been) I am really enjoying Nacho Chair.
Ohhhh! These seats are great!
(looks at the time) Wow, hey, we'd better get going. If we don't leave right now, we'll be late for dinner.
I don't know...
Okay.
How late are we?
Wow (He opens his apartment door and throws their stuff in.)

Okay. Rachel and Phoebe are already there, okay? So they probably started without us. We could just slip in and no-one needs to know where we were! (he raises his hands and on his right one there's a Rangers foam finger)
Oh, no, no, no, no, no. You just want to put it on your hand!
You are not at Thanksgiving?
We figured we could be late because you guys were gonna be on time (he points the foam finger at the girls)
Yeah, where were you!
Wait a second, wait a second, where have I seen that cowgirl outfit before...
(realizing) Oh! That's Alicia Mae Emory's outfit!
All right. Hey Rach, while you're in there, throw something on Alicia Mae.
No. Here (he tears off the pocket from Ross' shirt, and tears off everything below that as well.)
(whispering) Who do you think its from?
I hate that thing, it's like a... bolt of lightning.
(smiling from ear to ear) Ah-haah! I win!!
That's fire. Beats everything.
Ooh! Well played, Phoebe Buffay, well played.
I had a dream once about a fax machine that did that. (Ross picks it up)
(holds his fist up) WATER BALLOON! (he stuffs the slice in is mouth and gives the foil back to Ross)
(to Ross) Just get in there and make a face to face apology, you know? Look them in the eye. I know I can get them to forgive us.
I'm telling ya... (his eyes open wide and he looks like his eyes are about to pop out. He stares at Ross like this without blinking) I can do it.
Oh! It all looks so beautiful: the turkey, the stuffing...
(still with his door wedged in the door gap, now opens his eyes wide and stares at Monica and Chandler as he did with Ross earlier in the hall) Hey listen guys, we feel really terrible.
Come on you guys, we want you to know we're (His eye widen even more) very very sorry. (Monica and Chandler are now covering their eyes with their hands) (then to the others in the hall) Right guys?
(smiling) Now let's not ruin this day. You worked so hard. Let's move past this and try to have a nice meal all together, huh?
Hey! I'm getting a little tired of this okay? We said we're sorry. It's Thanksgiving for Pete's sakes! A day of forgiveness!
(to Ross, mouthing) Don't make me come up there!
Fine! Let's just go. I don't need your stupid dinner.
Sorry!
Yeah! You three have a nice Thanksgiving.
Yeah! You, Chan, and the vein!
Ha!
Oh-oh! I'm stuck!
No seriously... I'm really wedged in here.
(in agony) aaw-ahhh-aaahhh STOP! STOP! I'm worried about damaging my head.
Alright, hurry up, you gotta do something.
I just wanna say that I'm sorry I referred to the vein as a seperate person...
Oh, that smells good!
Okay.
It isn't working.
Well hurry, I can't feel my ears!
Interesting...
I left them at the park.
It's really starting to hurt.
Ooh! Stop putting things down my pants!
Yeah! Come on!
(looking at himself) Man, I've got food all over me.
Oh, I know how you feel...
Sure. I went through the exact same thing with Alicia Mae Emory... The waiting, the wandering... Then one day... I get that call from Toys "R" Us... She was in stock!
I can't believe it. When you guys come back, you're gonna have a baby! That is so weird!
But just think, ok? What if everything goes right? What if this woman does pick you guys?
I'm gonna say someone I'm gonna have s*x with. (the girl leaves and Phoebe goes toward the couch) (to Phoebe) Hey!
So... who's your friend?
OW, why, why, why?
Oh, name one friend of yours that I did that with.
Mandy, uh? Uh... really hot blonde, big boobs?
I know why I don't remember her, huh? (he winks at Rachel)
Ok, I may not have treated your friends well in the past, but I have grown up a lot, really. Honest, Rach?
(pointing at himself) Growth!
Ok, thank you. And I promise you I will not forget this one. (he starts writing on his hand) Mandy.
Saraaah.
I can see why, nice shirt!
Stupid Gap on every corner!
Hey.
Well...
Nope.

Oh, really? You know what your great friend did? We're out to dinner, ok? (he starts talking about the date and we can see what happened through a flashback video) We're getting along, having a really nice time. I was thinking she was really cool. And then, out of nowhere...
Hey, hey, look! It’s not about a few fries... it’s about what the fries represent.
ALL FOOD!

Hey, hey, hey, hey. Look. I take a girl out, she can order whatever she wants! The more, the better! All right? Just don’t order a Garden salad and then eat my food! That’s a good way to lose some fingers!
(mad and pointing a finger to himself) JOEY DOESN’T SHARE FOOD!

(he thinks a little, considering the option and seems to be quite satisfied) I like that! A sharing buffer! Yeah! I’ll order some extra fries! Maybe a plate of onion rings. Yeah. And a shrimp cocktail. And some buffalo wings. Maybe an individual pizza, uh? And some mozzarella sticks. (he looks absorbed in his food thoughts) What were we talking about?
I think were not wearing the same shirt anymore!!
(now laughing a little) Dude, I really don't think you should be wearing that.
(looking a little agitated now) Looks like someone IS the ladies!!
Oh, that looks great! Good ordering!
oh, I didn't know you liked French fries. Help yourself! What's mine is yours. (Sarah reaches over and takes a few fries)
Uuuh.. yes, they are my stuffed clams.
How about those fries though, huh? (Holds the plate between Sarah’s fingers and his plate, thus blocking her from reaching his)
(Spotting her movements takes her hand into his own) You are beautiful, you know that?
Oh (grinning, trying to hold in his impatience with her) okay.. (she takes her hand back)
(Visibly annoyed) NOW look what you did!!
I don't like it when people take food off of my plate, okay?

You promised Dr. Weinburg, you’d never use that phrase.
(laughs) That’s right. My Mom doesn’t have any faith in me! Oh, that’s hilarious! Ha-ha-ha-ha-ha.
(interrupting) No! You have lasagnas! (Storms out and an awkward silence follows.)
Hi.
Ohh, I’m such an idiot. I can’t believe I actually thought she could change.
Oh good, I’m glad that’s catching on.
What?
(getting up) All right, I’ll go down there. But, I’m not gonna serve the lasagna. I’m gonna serve something I make.
Well?
Really?!
Yes!!
And you?
So if everyone liked it, and you liked it, that would make this a success. Which would make you…
Well, I was going for wrong, but we can use your word.
Wow!
That really means a lot. Oh, and Mom, don’t bite your nails.
(in a sexy voice) Hello, Chandler. (Phoebe has a huge smile on her face.)
Why are you talking about volcanoes all of the sudden?
Oh! Did anybody see that-that documentary on the Korean War? (Joey is pissed)
Rachel!
You just put an empty carton back in the fridge!
Have you ever taken out the trash? (Hands her the garbage.)
Third door on the left.
God! If you’re gonna cry about it! (She grabs the box and goes to through it out.]
Joey, please don’t do that. I think it’s best that we just forget about it.
(Picking up a card from Chandler’s wallet.) My God! Is this a gym card?
What’s the matter?
So do them for free.
Wow! And you got a petticure. Your feet are all dressed up.
You’re gonna do some feet flirtin’!
What a minute, what did he say?
I told you not to go down there!
Rachel always cries!
Now Joey, you go down there and you suck up to him. I mean you suck like you’ve never sucked before!
His dancing partner?!
Oh, would you let it go already?! You’re fine!
Wait, now so you joined the gym?
Well, you could actually go to the gym.
Well, next time your massaging him, you should try and distract yourself.
Hey-hey, how goes the dancing? Gay yet?
Yes you did! You did like a little hop.
(laughing harder) You know the words! You are so into this!
All right, then show me some manly moves.
So you didn’t leave the bank?
Oh my Gosh!
Just go up to her and ask her out. (Chandler laughs) Oh, what's the worst thing that could happen?
Phoebe! You're sick, you shouldn't play. You should just go home, get in bed, and stay there.
Just be yourself. But, not too much.
That cold makes you sound so great.
Y'know what, I like Kathy.
(turning around and doing that, "I'm making out with someone," thing with her hands) Ooh, umm, oh Kathy! Kathy, I love you! Oh! (She turns around and sees Gunther staring at her and stops suddenly.)
Oh umm, how about your mom dying, or having to live on the streets when you were 14?
Hey!
Rachel's not here.
How's it going with her?
Hi, Josh.
So, did you play in college? (She points to his NYU Soccer (football for the rest of the world) sweatshirt he's wearing.)
Very!

It's this dumb thing that Ross made up `cause he was trying to fool our parents. It's a way of giving the finger, without actually having to give it. I remember I cried the night you made it up, `cause it was the first time that I realized that I was actually cooler than my older brother.
Oh come on! You're making it sound worse than it actually was.
Phoebe, you'll catch pneumonia.
(sneezes) Oh gosh, Phoebe, I think I caught your cold.
(lying on the couch suffering from her cold) Ross isn't here.
What?
Why?
Thank you so much Phoebe.
What are you doing with those?!
Sorry, Phoebe.
Umm. (nodding her head, "Good.")
Ohhhh!! Gross!!
No, sorry.
Hey Rach, could you get me some cough drops?
Ross, cough drops, please?
(interrupting) You have nothing! You're not even going out! You're her baby sitter! You have a 12-year-old girl's job!
And what are you laughing at, Miss `My-keg-sucking-boyfriend-is-stealing-from-me!'
That's mine!! Now, would you both please start acting like adults? And get me my cough drops!
Probably the only time I'll ever say this, but did you see the ass on her?
(Entering from her bedroom, talking on the phone) Yeah, once again, I am sorry. Thank you. Bye. (To the gang) I just had to turn down a job catering a funeral for sixty people.
Sixty guests.
Because I don't have the money or the equipment to handle something that big on such short notice. I mean there's no way.
I don't know.
Really? Cause I'd need like $500 for all the food and the supplies and stuff.
Well, you're not working either.
Yeah, that'd be great! Thank you!
Hey!

Oh my God, it was the best funeral ever! I mean, everyone loved the food, and guess what? I even got another funeral for tomorrow--the dead-guy-from-today's best friend. I mean, it is like I am the official caterer for that accident!
Thanks. Like, check out my new catering stuff. (Picks up two frying pans) Look at this! I'm an omelet station! Omelet? Made to order!

Oh. Well, I didn't realize that you needed it back right away. I mean, you told me to go and be a caterer. So I went. I beed. I mean, I... I used it to buy all this stuff. But look--I've got another job tomorrow, so I'll pay you back with the money I make from that.
Okay.
Oh, is everything in the car?
No. I hate this part.
No, that's not mine.
Excuse me, Mrs. Burkart? Well, we're all cleaned up in the kitchen.
Um, and, well there's the.. the the small matter of...
Just the matter of ...payment?
Oh, Phoebe, she couldn't stop crying! With those thick glasses, her tears looked giant.
What?
Okay. So what do you.... you think she's faking?
Phoebe, she sounded pretty upset to me.
Maybe I can try at intermission? Phoebe, come on... you know what? Let's just go!
I'm gonna leave some cards here. Please think of us for you next event.
Oh, that's great! Congratulations!
Oh, it was great! The widow wouldn't pay, so Phoebe yelled at her 'til she did.
And I'm a wuss. And we should be partners.
Wait a minute, Phoebe! We should be partners. We should be catering partners. I mean, think about it! You're not working right now, and we have such a great time together!
I can cook and you can take care of the money.
Hi. Uh, you... you don't know me, I'm Monica Geller... Ross's sister.
Yeah. Anyway, he told me about your apartment. And, um, I couldn't sleep, thinking about it. So, uh, would it be okay if I cleaned it?
No?
Oh God! Orange juice just came out of my nose, but it was totally worth it. Oh my God, I completely forgot about your sound.
He used to lock himself in the basement for hours. No one was every allowed to hear, "The Sound."
Yeah!
(At a loss for words) Boy, that was-that was, umm… terrific.
Oh God bless my dad sound proofing the basement!
(to Rachel and Phoebe) Y'know, there’s a Starbucks about three blocks down.
(to Phoebe) Hey, aren’t you up next?
Phoebe, Ross sucks!
Okay. Umm, Phoebe, you suck too.
Yeah! Joey has the best boyfriend ever!
Are you serious?
You obviously haven’t screwed over a lot of your friends. (They all look at her) Which we all appreciate.
He loves you.
I remember you did.
(removing ear plugs) What?
Okay, so you were trying to play bad this whole time.
We haven’t eaten yet!
Well, maybe you could give to somebody else. Ooh, like Ross Geller.
Who cares? He works in a museum!
What is wrong with this freezer?! (She jabs her arm into the freezer and a piece of ice flies into her eye.) Ow! Ow!!
Oh my God, ice just got in my eye!
Oh, y’know what, I can’t, it really kills.
No, my eye doctor is Richard! I can’t go to him when I don’t have a boyfriend!
Like I remember his office number! (Pause) Speed dial 7.
Yes!!
Oh my God! How cute is the on-call doctor?
Oh no-no-no, not Dr. Burke. Dr. Burke is out of town. The-the on-call doctor will see me now.
I was probably waiting for it to open.
You look great too.
So how does it look?
Like a pirate?!
Umm, so how long have you been working with your dad? (He looks at her) Come on, one of us had to mention him.
Oh. Big family dinner tonight?
No way!
(disappointed) Oh.
(happy) Oh.
(sympathetic) Oh. (in a pirate’s voice) So you made her walk the plank? Aye, matie?
I know.
Why is it sick?
Hey, come on, Phoebe, you understand don’t you?
Me going out with Richard’s son.

Fine! Judge all you want to but, (points to Ross) married a lesbian, (points to Rachel) left a man at the altar, (points to Phoebe) fell in love with a gay ice dancer, (points to Joey) threw a girl’s wooden leg in a fire, (points to Chandler) livin’ in a box!! (goes to her room)

(running in from her bedroom) I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! (opens the door) Hi, Tim.
Thank you. Come meet my friends. This is uh, Phoebe.
And Joey.
My brother, Ross.
And Rachel. (Chandler clears his voice loudly) And that’s Chandler.
Umm, well, he’s…
All right everybody, this turkey is ready!
Here, let me show you. Okay, the towels are hanging next to the sink, and umm, you can use the fancy soap.
See he’s nice. Right?
I saved you a seat. (Motions to the one next to her.)
Oh-ho-ho, we’ve got company.
(putting off her coat) Ooh, this always happens. (Her coat gets stuck.)
Thank you.
Y’know all my friends think this is weird.
I know! I mean it’s like me and your dad, that’s a totally separate thing.
We’re just two people who find each other very attractive. Right?
Nothing. Nothing.
No-no-no that was good, it was, that was uh, that was a goood kiss…
(interrupting) Don’t say it!
Yeah!
I know!
Oh, he’s catching up to her!
Come on, no peeking! (They are leading the gang out with there hands over their eyes.)
All right, umm, we’re not gonna really keep it this way though.
(to Phoebe) Remember that guy from cooking school I told you about that put cilantro with everything?
Well, I’m gonna fill in for him as food critic for the Chelsea Reporter.
Wow, Monica! What an amazing opportunity to influence… dozens of people.
Oh no-no-no, it’s only one night a week, and plus I get to take all of you out for a lot of free dinners.
Oh.
All right, were you guys smoking something in the back of our van?
Hey! My first review is out!
All right, look at my on the back page.
Hey, they don’t pay me a penny a word to make friends.
Oh! Do you need me to go with you?
Haven’t we made this decision?
Bye!
(answering it) Who is it?
Oh my God.
Oh my God, oh my God. (on intercom) Call me on the phone!
Look, I-I’m never gonna let you up so you may as well just go away.
No! Phoebe!
I couldn’t eat it! I had five friends who couldn’t eat it, and one of them eats books.
The waiter carried the breadsticks in his pants!
All right, that I’ll retract. But I stand by my review, I know food and that wasn’t it. You’re marinara sauce tasted like tomato juice! You should serve it with vodka and a piece of celery.
Oh my God! You own an Italian restaurant and you think that tastes good?! Where are you even from?
Hand me those tomatoes, I’m gonna show you what it should taste like! Come on, hand me them.
Okay, the owner of Allesandro’s came over to yell at me, but instead I made him some sauce, and he offered me the job as head chef!!
Can you believe it? I finally get to run my own kitchen!
You got the job?! Why didn’t you tell me?
Ohh! Umm, Phoebe, I kinda need to talk to you about that. (Rachel excuses herself) Umm, well I-I-I think it might be time for me to take a step back from catering.
I know, but now we have this second one and it just, it feels like it’s snowballing, y’know?
I got offered the head chef job at Allesandro’s.
It’s okay, ‘cause y'know what? You don’t really need me for the business.
All right. But umm, I-I-I’ll pay you back all the money you invested, and you can keep the van.
Phoebe, wait a minute! (runs after her, leaving Rachel alone)
(entering) Ohh, here you are. Y’know, I’m-I’m glad you decided to hear me out.
I’ve been doing a lot of thinking. A lot! And umm, well, I came up with a whole bunch of businesses you can do with your van. Okay umm, you could be flower delivery person.
Or! A bakery delivery person.
Pizza?!
All right, I’ve got a whole bunch of uh-uh, stuff in this area, but umm, I’m getting the feeling that you don’t want to deliver.
Okay. I’m guessing that if you don’t want to deliver, you probably don’t want to pick stuff up either.
Y’know what, let’s do the catering business.
Yeah, y'know I-I made a commitment to you. Y’know what, it’d be, it’d be fun.
Really?!
Thank you.

Umm, I just wanna say, uh (reads from a 3 X 5 card) that with a pinch of exictement, a dash of hard work, a dollup of cooperation, we can have the recipe... (Looks up and sees eveyone glaring at her) Are you gonna kill me?
Ohh, everybody at the restaurant still hates me.
I thought I was making headway, everyone was smiling at me all day, I get off work and I find out that they wrote this (puts on her chef hat) on my chef’s hat. (The hat says ‘Quit, bitch’)
I mean I have not been picked on this much since kindergarten and they had to bring in someone from junior high to do the see-saw with me. (Joey laughs and Monica glares at him.)
I mean they’re trying to do everything they can to make me quit, and if there were any other job, I would. But this is something I’ve been waiting for my whole life.
I would love too, but I can’t! I mean I just can’t, you know that I’m not good at confrontation.
That’s a good idea! Wait, do you know how to waiter?
All right, you’re hired!
Didn’t your dad used to call you Pumpkin?
(getting up) All right, I’m gonna go to work. Does anybody have a problem with that?
You want a problem? I’ll give you a problem!
You bet your ass, I’m gonna fire you! Thank you.
Hey.
They baked it. I can’t take this anymore. I’m gonna call a meeting tonight, I’m gonna fire you tonight.
What are you doing?!
Thanks. (Joey’s still patting the burn spot) I think you got it!
Hey, Joey, could you pass the cheese?
Okay. Could the waiters gather around to hear tonight’s specials? Okay, first there is a Chilean Sea Bass prepared with a Mango relish on a bag—Why is nobody writing these down?
Because your all gonna make up fake specials and make me cook them like you did the other night?
Okay, forget the specials for a minute. Umm, all right here’s the thing, for the last two weeks I have umm, (quietly) tried really hard to create a positive atmosphere…

(louder) A positive atmosphere! But I-I-I have had it up to here. (She holds her hand over her head as an afterthought.) From now on, it is gonna be my way, or the highway! All right? Does anybody have a problem with that?!! (Joey looks at the money he’s holding, and doesn’t speak up.) Hey new guy! I said, does anybody have a problem with that?!
What the hell happened?!
Joey, we had a deal. That-that’s why you’re here! I’ve got to fire you!
What kinda things have you been saying?
I need more swordfish. (to one of the assistant chefs) Can you get me some more swordfish?
You did a minute ago!
Fine!
Okay! Very funny! Somebody let me out please?! Come on, I’m cold! (She spills something.) And covered in marinara sauce! Come on! Let me out! (the door opens)
That’s not funny.
(starting to cry) I’m a good person. And I’m a good chef, and I don’t deserve to have marinara sauce all over me! Y’know what, if you want me to quit this bad, then all you have to do is…
You do?
Well if you want a problem? I’ll give you a problem!
You bet your ass I’m gonna fire you! Get out of my kitchen! Get out!! (Joey leaves) All right! Anybody else got a problem? How ‘bout you Chuckles? You think this is funny now?
How about if I dance around all covered in sauce? Huh? You think it’s funny now?
Good! Now, take those salads to table 4, (to the kitchen worker from earlier) And you! Get the swordfish! (to another assistant chef) And you! Get a haircut!
Thanks.
Enough!
No, you've messed it up. You're stupid.
Are you serious?
What did you tell them?
Yeah, I mean you'd be pregnant. I mean, pregnant.
We just want you to think it through.
In the beginning, you know, where it's all s*x and talking and s*x and talking...
And the s*x?
Then what is it?
Big deal, so Joey's had a lot of girlfriends. That doesn't mean he's good in bed.
Sweetie, with you it's going to be different. The s*x is going to be great 'cause you guys are in love.
I eat by myself in the alley because everybody hates me. [Rachel puts her arm consolingly around Monica]
What?
[to Chandler] So, did you do it?
Uh-oh, was it bad?
Well, it was the first time. You know, there's not always a lot of agreement on the first time.

All right, I'm going to show you something a lot of guys don't know. Rach, hand me that pad over there. [Rach gets a pad and pen off the table and hands it to Monica.] All right. Now...[starts to draw]
Now, everybody knows the basic erogenous zones. You got, [starts labelling her diagram] one, two, three, [Chandler nods impatiently], four [now Chandle looks up, surprised], five, six, and seven.
[chuckles] Kind of an important one.
Okay, now, most guys will hit one, two, and three and then go to seven and set up camp.
All right, uh the important thing is to take your time. You want to hit them all and you want to mix them up. You got to keep them on their toes.

Okay, you could, uh, start with a little one; a two; a one, two, three; a three; a five; a four, a three-two; a two, a two-four-six; [Monica starts to get into it ] two-four-six; four [Rachel kind of moves back and stretches out] a two; [Monica now has her eyes closed and is getting visibly excited] two; four-seven; five-seven [Chandler looks away from both of them as if he can't believe what's happening]; six-seven; seven, seven, [faster] SEVEN, SEVEN, SEVEN-SEVEN-SEVEN-SEVEN-[Chandler looks at her in disbelief] SEVEN-SEVEN! [Monica, eyes still closed, leans back and shudders and says silently, while holding up seven fingers, "seven".]
You know, I never saw that.
What are you doing?
[to Phoebe] It's going to be so great.
Would you surrogate?
What if I asked?
Really?
No.
Boy, you are really not a morning person.
What kind of changes?
Oh, good luck.
That is sooo not true!
I just—I can’t believe that you think that you and Chandler know me and Rachel better than we know you.
Yeah.
Deal!
Ha-ha!
Aww, man!
That does not mean you know us better, I-I want a rematch.
Yeah! And the winner gets a hundred bucks.
Are you scared?
Ross will do it.
You guys! Do you realize that any minute now, Phoebe can be pregnant?
Same category?
Michael Flatley, Lord of the Dance!
No!!
I knew that! Rachel! Use you’re head!
Viva Las Gaygas!
You guys are dead, I am so good at lighting rounds.
Huh, wanna bet?
How about we play for more money, say 150?
You’re doing it again.
We won’t. (to Chandler) 300?
I’m just trying to spice it up!
I got it! How about, if we win, they have to get rid of the rooster?
Deal!
Rachel, I have not missed one question the whole game. I own this game! Look at my hand. (Holds up her hand.)
No! Steady as a rock! Now, are you with me.
Come on!
Come on!
Sandwiches!
Maurice.
And processing.
It’s umm, it has something to do with transponding.
That’s not even a word! I can get this! I can get this!
NOOOOOOOOO!!!!!
Man, I feel like I’m coming down with something.
Yeah. (to Chandler) I bet you can’t guess what color my tonsils are? I’ll bet the apartment!
How do you feel?
Really?! How much?!
Look Rach, we have to move. I mean if they had lost, we would’ve made them get rid of the birds. Right?
All right, look, I hate this as much as you, but if it makes you feel better, it’s all your fault.
Chinadolor Bong, come on, we steal that TV Guide every week!
Well?
It’s only been a couple of hours, so just give it some time.
Hey, Rach, can you give me a hand with this box?
I’ll take care of it.
I lost our mattresses.
Hey!
Hey, don’t mix those up, you could really ruin that lollipop.
Hey, we would still be living here if hadn’t gotten the question wrong!
I can’t find garbage bags!
What is it?!
I can’t believe we’re living here!
Yeah, I think I have some around here somewhere. Why?
Hey, Rach! I made a pile of your stuff over on this side of the room. If you could just…(Rachel grunts and throws her purse at it)…throw your purses at it.
Oh my God, are you out of a job?
Umm, excuse me, we switched apartments. You can’t eat are food anymore, that-that gravy train had ended.
If you have the big apartment you have to deal with people coming over all the time. That fridge has got to be stocked, okay, that’s your department now. (She takes back the turkey leg)
What are you doing?
(entering) Hey!
You made pancakes?
Okay. (She does so and starts to walk towards Joey to receive her pancakes.)
Oh, I was thinking about having people over for the game.
The players.
(laughs) Please, it’s a relief is what it is, is what it is.
Fresh cookies! Hot from the oven!
Please, have some!
Yeah, I’ve just been fiddling around in here making delicious treats for everyone.
Yeah, it’s just something I picked up.
Wait! Wait! This isn’t take-out!
No, wait, please don’t go! I’ve got p0rn for you too!
People are supposed to wanna hang out here!

I’m the hostess! Not those guys! I’m always the hostess! I mean, I was always the hostess, I mean even when I was little, I mean the girls brought their dollies to my tea party, I-I served the best air.
‘Cause they took our apartment, I wanted to punish them. But I’m-I’m done now. They’ve suffered enough.
All right then, when I’m done with this place, it’s gonna be ten times better than that place!
Are you sure?
Nah, I got it.
(entering) Okay, it’s ready. Come on.
Just come.
Pretty much. (to Joey) So, what do you, what do you think of the floor?
You used to have carpet.
So I made snacks. Please, just hang out okay? I’m just gonna rest my eyes just a little bit.
Oh no-no-no, stay, stay, stay, just keep talking. I’m always the hostess.
(not wanting to be left out, picks up something) Hey umm, what’s this?
Hey, Joey, I don’t think that you should leave Chandler alone. I mean it’s only been two days since he broke up with Kathy. Maybe you can go fishing next week?
What’s Phase Two?
You stink!
Uh-oh, what’s the matter?
I don’t know sweetie.
I can’t! I have to work!
No, Chandler’s still in Phase One, and Joey’s that thing you smell.
I think she’s here.
(looking out the peephole) Ohh, she’s looking down the hall. Oh! She looked right at me! Oh wait, you can’t see people through that little hole, can you? (Goes back to the door.) Hello!
I-I-I think you look great.
What?
Oh my God!
Oh wait, Joey, you can’t go like that! You stink!
Yeah. Run ten blocks, that’ll help the smell.
So? How did it go with Joshua last night?
What?
So you hit her in the face?
Hey! You’re wearing pants!
It’s 9:30 in the morning!
Hello. (Listens) Oh, hey Ross!
Oh-oh, my God!
(to Chandler) Shh!! (On phone) Wait, what?
He’s with Emily at a Bed and Breakfast in Vermont!
He had to go, there’s a deer just outside eating fruit from the orchard.
Why do you care so much anyway?
Well, when you first met Barry, you flitted off to Vail.
A couple of days.
What are you doing?! Chandler! You can’t just go back a phase!
Yeah, come on, we can be guys!
(coming back to the stage and sitting next to Chandler) Okay, I’ve got some Ones, you wanna put them in her panties?
Very good, (getting up and sliding a One into the dancer’s hot pants) so good.
(to the waitress) When you get a sec, another round of daiquiris.
Oh! And don’t let me leave without getting the name of that carpet guy.
I think somebody needs another lap dance. (Motions for one.)
So, we did okay at the strip club, right?
What, he doesn’t like Josh?
Yeah. And y’know, if you wanna cry, that’s okay too.
Come on! Chandler!
They really were pretty, weren’t they? (Rachel and Phoebe both agree)
Oh, Candy! She was so spunky!
Y’know, I think if I were going to be with a woman. (Chandler is intrigued.) It’d, it’d be with someone like Michelle, she was so oh, she was so petite.
Oh, Chantal!
Really?!
That’s-that’s not Phase Three.
Hey!
Wait, now, what am I doing again?
Joey let me ask you a question. What does this light switch do?
Didn’t it drive you crazy to have a switch and not know what it did?
They wouldn’t have put it there if it didn’t do something! How can you not care?
Janice?!
How have you been?
Done?

This switch thing has been driving me crazy. So I turned it off and checked every outlet. Now, four of them don’t work. Which means, one of them has to be controlled by the switch. So, I plugged in things in all four of the outlets that-that make noise, so that way, when I turn it on I just follow the noise and find out which one it is.

Yeah, well, I’m using noise. Okay. All right! So, is everybody ready? Here we go. (She flips on the switch and a hum starts.) I hear something! I hear something! Where is it? (They all start looking until Rachel realises it’s Joey.)
He asked you out?!
Saucy!
Electrical plans for the building.
I know that switch does something, okay? So-so I went down to city hall and got these. All I had to do was pay $25 and wait in line for three hours.
Hi!
Oh, just some pictures I made and hung up. I thought they’d brighten up the place. They do don’t you think?
No-no-no, no!
I know that there’s no hole there, I just really liked that picture.
Okay, but there is a wire back there! I mean that switch is connected to something!
I just thought that if I could follow the wire I could find out what it did.
No. It disappears back there behind that baseboard. For a minute there, I thought it went downstairs.
But it didn’t. Say hello to Mrs. Chatracus.
All right. The super couldn’t figure out what it did. A $200 an hour electrician couldn’t figure out what it did. I’ve had seven pretty serious shocks. I officially give up.
I guess Joey was right, it does nothing.
What is it hon?
Aww, honey I’m sorry.
I don’t know how museums work in England but, here, you’re not supposed to take stuff.
Oh no, two days, you must be bummed.
