I'll get it. (On phone.) Hello. (Listens.) Hi Emily! (Listens.) Yeah, uh you-you tracked him down. Hold on one second. (She hands the phone to Ross.)
How can you tell? You can only see the back of his head!
Oh, sweetie. Oh, look at you. You're shivering.
Oh, Larry.
Okay, knock yourself out, Larry.
Larry?
Uh, look, Larry honey, umm, I wrote the book on Section 5 and I know that you don't have to wear your hat unless you're in the kitchen.
It's in the kitchen, I'll go get it.
Thanks.
Hmm?
He's not great umm, but he's dealing with it. Oh wait a minute, you're not gonna try…
Right, you only go for them 5 minutes before they get married.
(To Monica) Danny. Are you guys ever gonna go out again?
Ohh, fun!
Well, I guess we won't be warming his house.
And you're not gonna do that.
So-so there is no party.
I think so. Se, he-he's not inviting you to his party because he likes you.
Oh, thanks! We'll try to stop by.
You are?
Okay.
What one? You wanted him to invite you to the party and he did it!
Great. So the ball is in his court?
Hey!
I don't know, clean places?
(looking through the peephole) It's Danny.
(to Danny) We'll be right there! (To Rachel) Can't you just say it starts later?
The fake kind!
We have a ladle. (Gives him one.)
Okay, great!
Just go over and say hi.
Hey, Danny!

(turns his back to the stairs) Oh, it's a great party! Great food. Y'know, most parties it's all chips and salsa, chips and salsa. (As she's saying this Rachel tries to head downstairs but is blocked by people coming upstairs. She quickly retreats back up the stairs.) (Sees that she has to keep him distracted longer.) So umm, what's this? (Points to his plate.)
Ooooh! (Rachel now succeeds in getting downstairs.) And-and-and what-what's this? (Points again.)
(upon seeing Rachel she points) Oh.
I thought there wasn't a ball?
I think I need a drink.
Phoebe, you have to lift it and point.
That's very nice.
Is anyone thankful for anything else besides a thong?
Oh, let's not tell this story.
(entering) Hey!
Hey, did you get the turkey basted—Oh my God! Oh my God! (She sees someone is stuck in the turkey.) Who is that?
What-what are you doing? Is this supposed to be funny?
Well, get it off now!
Well, I don't care! That-that turkey has to feed 20 people at my parent's house and they're not gonna eat it off your head!
Okay, I got it. Phoebe? All right, you pull. I'm gonna spread the legs as wide as I can. (Joey starts giggling.) Joey? Now is not the time!
Okay, count to three. 1. 2. 3!
That's it. That's my worse Thanksgiving.
Umm, I-I really don't want to tell this story.
Look umm, of all people, you do not want me to tell this story!

I'll get it! (She runs in, and she's her old fat self like The One With The Prom Video. Not only that, she's out of breath after running a short distance. She goes over and opens the door to reveal Rachel with her old nose.) Happy Thanksgiving!
Well, I do.
Yes, it was!
(interrupting her) Okay, now Thanksgiving's over, let's get ready for Christmas. Who wants to go get a Christmas tree?!
Hi, Chandler.
What-what's the matter? Is there, is there something on my dress? (She turns around making sure he gets a good look.)
So Chandler, I guess I'll see you at dinner.
Well it didn't!

Yeah, I mean yeah, I look great. Yeah, I feel great and yeah, my heart is not in trouble anymore! Blah, blah, blah! Y'know I still don't feel like I got him back, y'know? I just want to humiliate him. I wanna, I want him to be like naked and then I'm going to point at him and laugh!
How?
What?! I mean, I didn't work this hard and-and-and lose all this weight so that I can give my flower to someone like him!
Yeah.
And when he's naked I can throw him out in the front yard and lock the door and all the neighbors will just humiliate him!
Okay, so how do I make him think I wanna have s*x with him?
What do you mean?
(excited) I can do that!

Umm, I'd love too! (She goes over and picks up the box and decides to follow Rachel's advice and holds the box up to her cheek.) Ooh, I love macaroni and cheese. I love-I love the way this box feels against my cheek.

Boy, I love carrots! Oh! (She picks up a bunch of them and holds them between her fingers.) Sometimes I like to put them between my fingers like this and-and hold them down here while I talk to you. (She is rubbing her hip with the carrots.) Umm, and-and-and y'know if I get really hot umm, I-I like to pick up this knife (She picks up a knife without putting the box down. She's holding the box between her cheek and shoulder) and-and umm, I-I put the cold steal against umm, (Pause) my body. (She doesn't have any exposed skin within reach of the knife, so while holding the carrots in one hand and the box between her face and shoulder, she rubs the knife on her stomach.)

Oh yeah, of course. I'm fine it's just that—(She drops the box and in a reflex action tries to catch it with her arm, the knife slips out and slowly flips through the air and comes point first down into Chandler's shoe.)
Oh yes! I have it right here, on ice! (She takes a bag of ice out of her purse and hands it to the doctor.)
What?! What is it?
God, I'm sorry! I'll go back and get it!
Wait, no-no-no, I can go really fast! Dad, give me the keys to your Porsche!
I didn't mean to cut it off. It was an accident.
I'm sorry! It wasn't your whole toe!
Chandler! (Follows him out.)
Chandler, I said I was sorry.
Oh wait, Chandler, come here is there anything I can do? Anything?
Wait, wait, wait! (She puts a Shriner's hat on the turkey.)
Look! (She puts a big, yellow pair of sunglasses on the bird.)
I bet this will work! (She starts dancing and Chandler cracks up.)
What?
You said you loved me! I can't believe this!
Yes, you did!
You love me!
Yeah!
(entering) Thank you Joey, thank you so much!
(inspecting his leg) Wow! And around the ankles, y'know that is a tough spot.
We'll try to be more careful okay? It's just that, we don't want everyone to know because this is going really well, and maybe the reason it's going really well is because it's a secret.
We are! Help us!
Joey!
Hey, Phoebe!
Okay, look, I-I have enough stuff for one more sandwich, I mean I was going to eat it myself, but (motions that he can have it.)
Phoebe, you are a bad ass!
Phoebe?
Yeah, the best you got in high school was Wet Pants Geller.
We're so sorry.
Okay, just wait, please. I promise we'll come up with something. Just give us a little more time.
Hey. Okay, so umm, since that video camera thing didn't work out uh, I thought that I would give you just a little preview. (Hands him a Polaroid.)
I know.
Ross, are you okay?
Why?!
A pill?
Wait a minute, they're making you take time off work?
(yelling and waving her hand in the air) I know! I know! I know!
(grabbing the picture) Give me that!
It's okay! It's good! It's good. It's a disease!
Yes you are! That's the only way to explain all this stuff!
Oh no!
Yes it's true.
I guess I wanted to keep it (Pause) as a souvenir.
I guess I set up the video camera to try and entice Joey.
I'm Monica. I'm disgusting. I stalk guys and keep their underpants.
(entering, happily) All right everybody! Everybody guess what? I just convinced Paul to give us a test next week!
Come on! Tests make us all better learners! Oh yeah! (Running out) We should have essay questions!!
You know, I knew a girl in high school who did that. She was very popular. (Chandler laughs.)
Danny? You know Rachel? She’s nice. She’s not bad to look at, right?
Do you want to go out on a date with her?
Friday’s perfect...She can’t wait.
(Walking in from off screen.) Phoebe!
I just wanted to see how it's going.
(Taking out her wallet.) Well good, here let me help you out.
Yeah!
Yeah. I guess. (She puts more money in the bucket.)
Yes Phoebe, but this is all I have. Okay? (She pours out the rest of her change purse into the bucket.)
Hey, what's up?
Oh, honey, I'm sorry.
You had no relationship!!

Oh God, stop with the plan! So what, so what you saw him with a girl? Who cares?! That doesn't mean anything! Now look, you're going to go out on a date with Danny and you're going to be so charming he's gonna forget all about that stupid subway girl.
Come on, hurry!
No.
No.
Eww!! (Throws the bucket down.)
Yeah, good for you. Y'know you're tough, you lived on the streets.
Hey!
All the time. In fact, I was undefeated.
Still, I was quick as a cat.
Oh, you're kidding.
(laughing with Ross) We don't, we don't wrestle now.
Too strong for me?
You wanna go right now? 'Cause I'll take you right now, buddy! You wanna go?
Ready? (They grab a hold of each other's necks.) Wrestle! (They start wrestling.)
That was unbelievable!
Hi, how are you doing Kelly?
It's my new perfume. Why don't you come closer where you can really appreciate it?
This is disgusting!
Oh no, wait! Joey!
Happy New Year.
She has a better chance of sprouting wings and flying up your nose than you do of not making fun of us.
Hey Rach, maybe your resolution should be to umm, gossip less.
Well if Ted Kopel talked about his coworkers botched boob jobs, I would.
Hi Ben!
I like 'em.
I like them a lot.
It's my New Year's resolution!
No! To take more pictures of all of us together. I mean I really think it's the best resolution because everyone will enjoy the pictures.
Thank you. (Leaves.)
(on phone) I can't wait to be with you! I'll sneak over as soon as Ross picks up Ben. I'll just tell Rachel I'm gonna be doing laundry for a couple of hours.
(on phone) Awww, y'know what your nickname is, Mr. Big…
We heard about your pants, I'm so sorry.
Hey, hey, look. Look Ross, Ben drew a picture of you! (Shows him Ben's picture.) Huh? You're-you're a cowboy!
See? Ben doesn't think you're a loser, he thinks you're a cowboy! Now that's something.
Okay, now that everything's wrapped up here, I think I'm, I'm gonna go do my laundry.
Look at us all dressed up for the big office party! By the way, what are we celebrating?
I think this is so cool because none of our friends are here and we can be a real couple. We don't have to hide.
Ooh, and I can do this. (She kisses him on the cheek.)
Hi, nice to meet you!
What was that?
That noise you just made?
Really? Your work laugh?
All right, check me out.
Really?
Hey, I thought you already had one.
Hi!
What are you doing here? I thought you had to do inventory all day.
Uhh, not much. Uh, work's good.
Okay. Umm…
Okay, what's going on with you?
Well, I-I—there was this guy at the bank that I thought was cute umm, but I don't anymore.
Yes, I'm sure! Rachel is there something that you want to talk me about?
Game!
Am I on fire today or what?! Those birds are browned, basted, and ready to be carved!
I'm sorry, I don't understand what you just said.
Are you crazy?! We own those two! I mean look at 'um, he can't breath and she's popping pills.
They have racquets don't they?!
I'll take it down to 95% but that's the best I can do.
I got it! (She hits a forehand smash that bounces right in between Doug and Kara and scores a point.)
I got it!!
I can't believe you let them win!
I was frustrated.
I was frustrated with you!

Y'know what really bothers me? Is—it's how-how different you act around them! I mean y'know the throwing the tennis games, the fake laugh, the "I'll see you around, Bing!" "Not if I see you first, Doug!" (Mocks the fake laugh.) I gotta tell you, I don't like Work Chandler. Okay? The guy's a suck-up.
I'm telling you, something's wrong! My brother does not stay out all night.
Oh my God! (She goes to hug him, stops short, and hits him on the shoulder.) Where the hell have you been?!!
My turn? What-what are you talking about?
What?!
Well. Sounds like you're writing yourself a little play there Rach. Wow! Let me know how that one turns out.
Well, if you had kept listening, you-you would have heard me call him Mr. Big…(Thinks)…ot.
Mr. Bigot. He tells the most racist jokes.
Me and Chandler?! (Does her fake laugh.)
Oh, none for me. Thanks.
(To Chandler) How does that laugh not give you a headache?
Y'know, I-I-I don't think that I can. So if you don't mind, maybe this will be it for me on the work things.
I'd rather hang out with a sniveling work weasel guy when I can be hanging out with my boyfriend who I actually respect.
(interrupting) Honey, I just don't think that you understood the joke.

Yeah! I mean it was really funny, I-I just don't think you got it. You see Kara's coffee is-is-is weak tasting, okay? But-but what Doug was-was imply that it was weak physically. You get it now honey?
I thought you could use the help.
Sorry! I'm just—I'm not very good at this! I'm a terrible liar and I hate having to lie to Rachel!
I know! It's just that…ever since high school Rachel was the one person I told everything too. Y'know? I miss that so much now. She's my best friend.
(entering) Joey?! Oh my God, Rachel!
Wh-wh-what are you doing here? (She tries to pull her shirt down to cover the fact that she's wearing men's boxers.]
Okay great!
Great! Umm, well what-what I was doing in Chandler's room is that umm, I was cleaning it! In fact, he pays me to clean it!
Y'know when I said to you earlier that I was at work umm, I'm at my new work.
Okay.
I'll get back to my new job.
I can't believe we've never done this before! It's sooo good! So good for Monica!
That was a half an hour?
Y'know, I don't like to brag about it, but I give the best massages!
It's so good, isn't it?
Say good-bye to sore muscles!
(entering, in a hurry) Guys! Guys! I just saw two people having s*x in a car right outside.
Ohh my God, I'm so sorry.
(to the guys) Not the way they're doing it. What, what happened? How did she die?
What?! What honey?
Oh, did you catch him?!
All right, let's go say good-bye.
Well, at least you scared someone.
Phoebe, you do seem a little tense. Here, let me help you.
What are you talking about?
(indignant) I give good massages! (Ross laughs.) I used to give them to Rachel all the time before she got allergic! And-and-and Chandler loves them! Watch! (She starts giving Chandler a massage.)
No he's not!
What?!
You've been lying to me? I can't believe you'd do that.
But the minute we start to lie to each other… (Pauses after she realizes what she's saying.) And by 'we' I mean society.
No.
Oh, please, stop! Look, we're supposed to be honest with each other. I-I just wish you could tell me—just say, "I don't like your massages."
(starting to cry) See? It's no big deal.
I'm not crying about that! I'm crying about something that happened at work.
(bursting into tears) My boyfriend said he didn't like my massages.
Oh my God! You don't know me at all!
I'm crying here!!
Huh. So you're saying like umm, if there was an award for the best bad massage, well who would get that?
So maybe they could umm, call the award the Monica?
Okay. I suck!
Y'know, Joey, I think it's time to give up the bag.
You are so cute! How did you get to be so cute?
Okay, now you're even cuter!!
What?
What are you talking about?
That's not possible!
I'm sorry it's just, Phoebe just always thought you were, you were charming in a, in a sexless kind of way.
I'm sorry, I think that you just misunderstood her.
This bicep?
Uhh, y'know actually I was gonna do some laundry.
Hey Chandler, wanna do it with me?
Okay.
I mean I-I don't I think I have enough quarters.
Oh, is it that pinball machine with the big bow on it?
Well what did you send?
Bye!
Actually, I did!
Ohhh, oh my God! Oh my God! She knows about us!
Phoebe knows and she's just trying to freak us out! That's the only explanation for it!
Them?! Who's them?
Joey!
Unless…
Oh man, they think they are so slick messing with us! But see they don't know that we know that they know! So…
(in the kitchen with Chandler) Look at them, they're-they're panicked!
Oh yeah!
All right, it'll be great! You just make her think you wanna have s*x with her! It'll totally freak her out!
Relax, she-she's gonna give in way before you do!
Because you're on my team! And my team always wins!
Just go get some! (Kisses him.) Go! (She runs to hide in the bathroom.)
She's bluffing!
You go back out there and you seduce her till she cracks!
Of course.
I love you too Chandler. (They kiss.)
Well actually, Ross doesn't.
What are you doing?!

Come on Chandler, come on, I can handle Ross. (They go to the door. Ross is trying to stick his hand through and undo the chain; Monica pushes his hand back.) (To Ross) Hold on! (She opens the door.) Hey Ross. What's up bro?
I'm so sorry that you had to find out this way. I'm sorry, but it's true, I love him too.
Guys, you're a few steps ahead of us.
But what?
In that cute, little, sweet way she just did?
I know what you need, you need a bodyguard. Hey Ross, what is Ben doing after preschool?
Isn't this great?
Couldn't you just stay like this forever? (His eyes snap open.) Chandler! Couldn't you just stay here forever?
Are you okay?
What-what are you doing?
Man, I knew it! I knew you were going to do this!!
Get all freaked out because everybody was talking and just joking around about marriage and stuff.
Oh and you know what I want!
I do not have baby fever!
Have you lost your mind? Chandler, this isn't about me! This is about you and all your weird relationship commitment crap!

You don't know everything. Did you know that I'm going out with Rachel tonight instead of you? Hmm? And did you know that the only baby around here is you?! And did you know that I can't even look at you right now?! (She storms out.)
Gunther, can I get a coffee (Looks at Chandler) to go?
I'm still not done not wanting to talk to you.
What?!

Really? I'm really tired of being your relationship tutor. You're gonna have to figure this one for yourself. All right? Y'know what? If you're too afraid to be in a real relationship, then don't be in one. (She walks out.)
(raising her hand) I'm Monica.
Okay.
Wait what-wh-wh-what are you doing?!
No-no, don't-don't-don't do it!
Chandler, why are you doing this?
Chandler.
Do you umm, you really think the best reason to get married is because you're sorry?
(kneels with him) Chandler, umm, I want you to take just a minute and I want you to think about how ridiculous this sounds.
Honey! Do you know that none of that stuff came from me?! I mean I never said I wanted to have babies and get married right now!
Who? Two divorces and Joey?!
Y'know what? Y'know when I said that I want you to deal with this relationship stuff all on your own? Well, you're not ready for that.
Oh my God, what would have done if I said yes?
Well I think the length of teasing is directly related to how insane you were so, a long time.
Hey!
(checks to see if it works) Yes, you are so smart! (Kisses him.)
I know.
Wow!
Hey.
Oh yes, it is. I'm sorry I borrowed it, I was cold. I hope its okay?
I'm sorry, I'll give it back to you.
Are you saying I smell bad?
What's with him?
(cooking something) Phoebe, you were supposed to take that back!
Hey Joey, sweetie, taste this. (Holds out a spoon for him.)
What is going on with you?
What was the dream about?
Wait, Joey! Joey! That doesn’t mean that-that you're in love with me!
No!
Or, it could mean that-that you saw Chandler and me together and we y'know were being close and stuff and then you just want to have that with someone too.
Um-hmm.
Well sure! I'm just wearing sweats! (Looking at Chandler and slowly realizing what his point is.) But that's good that you're not in love with me, because you just want a girlfriend!
You become friends after?
(laughing) That's right.
Joey, I thought you were gonna try to be friends first!
What about the closeness?
Who is it?
Let me try. (Gets up to join them.)
Did I squeeze it too hard?
Is he doing his shark attack bit yet?
Get in there man! Flirt back, mix it up!
(joining him) Wow! She is pretty, huh?
What happened?
No Joey, I think he's just watchin' TV.
What?
Wow! For just a week you guys are really close, huh?
I know it is the best.
What? It's still going on.
I-I am serious, I mean, we're, we're all over each other all the time.

(Start annoying hyper-competitive mode now.) (Jumping up) What don't you just calm down Phoebe! All right?! Why don’t you just get all your facts before you run around telling everybody that you're the only hot couple!!
Oh no, it is okay, I mean as long as you know that Chandler and I are also very hot and fiery, just as hot as you! I mean our flame, whew, is on fire!
You are so cute. (She goes over and kisses him passionately.)
(entering from the bathroom) Hey Rach, a guy from Ralph Lauren called, you got a second interview!
Yes!
A kiss? What are you talking about?
He probably wants you back because you're right for the job.
Phoebe, do you want to go see a movie after dinner tonight?
What are you doing?
(That annoying competitiveness thing kicks in again, what the heck is that with her and why must the writers show it every flippin' episode?!) Oh, we're not seeing a movie!
Oh umm, that's because I just wanted to y'know walk in on me and Chandler while we were, y'know, doing it all night. Will you excuse me for just a second?
Okay. (She gets up and walks over to Chandler.) Chandler? Can I see you for a second?
Okay. (They walk away to get some privacy.) We have got to beat them! {Here we go yet again.}
'Cause, Gary and Phoebe think they're a hotter couple than we are!
So! So we've got to go upstairs and have a lot of s*x to prove them wrong!
Phoebe and Gary are so gonna hear about this at dinner.
We are the hottest! Huh? No one is hotter than we are! You're the best.
No, you're the best.
I am the best.
(looking out the window) Hey Joey! Isn't that the girl that waved at you the other day?
Why?
What are you talking about? (Pointing out the window.) She obviously lives on the second floor, seventh apartment from the left!
No, those first two windows, (Points) that's the lobby. And y'know the other one over there, that's the stairway. You've been counting wrong.
You better believe he's tired, after the day we had! If you know what I mean. You know what I mean?
Phoebe, you have a, a twig in your hair.
You didn't!
The park huh? A public place.
I hear ya. Excuse me for just a second! (Gets up and heads for the bathroom as that annoying Gotta-win-at-all-costs-super-competitive thing kicks in again.)
Hi Chandler.
Yes it is. You see I've always found the men's bathroom very sexual. Haven't you?
Come on, we can't let them win!
Because Phoebe and Gary are in that-can't-keep-their-hands-off-each-other-doing-it-in-the-park phase!
I feel really sad that we're not…really there anymore.
Wasn't it a lot more exciting when we were y'know all over each other all the time?
Really?
That is so sweet. I know that I was acting a little crazy but umm, I feel the same way.
Yeah. (They hug.)
Did not.
Okay, I freaked out a little.
Thank God! I can't watch him anymore!
Besides, if anybody's gonna get free stuff, it's gonna be me.
I think it's a great idea. Yeah, we could have a dinner party and just invite her close friends.
I would love to do it together!
It's gonna be weird to watch some actor pretending to be Ben's dad.
That doesn't seem fair.
Rachel, you can go down there, you don't have to smoke. Just say you wanna get some fresh air.
Hey!
Yeah, me too! (Runs and grabs her 3-ring binder of ideas.)

All right, that's a little sketch of the cake, umm some sample menus, umm y'know what I thought we would start out with Tuscan style finger food, and for music, here's an alphabetized list of all my CDs! I've highlighted the ones that would go really good with the food.
Oh, we're not doing that. Okay…
What?! I didn't take care of everything, there's-there's plenty of things for you to do!
(Thinks) Cups.
And ice!
Wait a minute, I can get ice at the restaurant…
Hey! How'd the audition go?!
Wait a minute, are you doing Joey's (sadly) "Audition didn't go so well. (Happily) Yeah it did?"
You got a callback too didn't you?
(To Rachel) How did work go?
You stink!
No, I'm-I'm serious!
That's so gross!
Chandler! I have to tell you, you smell so smokey I have to get up. I'm not kidding. (She's not; she stands and walks away. Chandler moves closer.)
(overhearing that) Why don't you just go out with her!
Chandler! Everyone--no one's eating my Tuscan finger food 'cause they're all filling up on Phoebe's snow cones!
Y'know…go! Go! Right there! (Points)
That's the surprise!
(entering from the bathroom) Hey! Happy Anniversary!
So umm, when I was in the shower I was thinking about our first night in London…
Is that the one that speaks English or the one that doesn't?
That was some hot love you gave me! I'm gonna go get ready.
That's a great idea! I was saving them for something special.
(runs over to Phoebe) You have got to go home!
You gotta go home and get the earrings that you borrowed from me okay? Chandler wants me to wear them tonight.
Great!
(noticing Rachel crawling behind the couch) Rach? What are you doing?
It's a diaper commercial.
What's goin' on?
It's okay. I don't care. It's uh, it's fine.
It's no big deal, I do it all the time.
Sure! It doesn't mean anything! Just like I know it doesn't mean anything with you!
Chandler, this actually bothers you?
What?
(following her) Phoebe! I have to have those earrings, we're going to leave as soon as the show is over.
No you didn't.
Yeah, it's good.
Chandler! (Joey and his grandmother shush them and wave them away, which they do.) Okay, let me get this straight, it's okay for you to flirt, but not for me.
Go on, teach me something about men and women.
No way!
Well that's pathetic!
And this goes for all guys?
No! You are not gonna run out and leave her here!
(entering from her room) Phoebe! (Motions for the earrings. Phoebe gives her the one-minute sign.)
Yeah, what is it?
(shocked) Wow! All right well, I mean, what can you do? If you lost it you lost it.
All right, sweetie that's fine. You didn't do it on purpose.
Look at you! Come here! (They hug.) Feel better?

(angrily) That is exactly why I do not lend you stuff!! (Rachel looks over at Phoebe in resignation.) Okay?! I mean, first it's my jewelry! And if it's not my jewelry, it's-it's my blue sweater! And if it's not my sweater, it's my sunglasses!
Yes!
What about these? These look the same?
Not as each other!
Hi!
Yeah.
Ohh, you're about to get a little luckier.
Oh, honey, the earrings…
My boyfriend really does have good taste!
Okay, guys, listen, don't forget that tomorrow is the day that Emily gets married again, so whatever we do, just try to really keep Ross's mind off of it.
Hey!
Hey! Oh, I'm so glad you're home, I thought tonight we could finally organize these photos!

Okay, I've broken them down into categories. Okay, we have uh, we got holidays, birthdays, candids, y'know… And then what I've done is I've cross-referenced them by subject. Right? So if you're looking up, oh let's say birthdays and dogs, you get Photo 152. See? (Hands her the photo.)
You can also find him under umm, dog and dead.
All right, hand me that other box of photos; that's the very last one.
I hadn't! Photo 152 was a prototype.
All right, he's keys are in the drawer. Y'know what? I also need some cash.
Nah, while you're at Ross's if you see any lying around…
What?! I-I-I don't, I don't do that!
(on the answering machine) Rach! It's me! Pick up!
I need a few more things to make the margaritas. Uhh, I need some salt, some margarita mix, and tequila.
See if he has ice.
(does Rachel's) Nooo!
Well thank God you were here! I mean, we have to erase that!

We have too! I mean what if Ross's hears that and then calls her back and then they get back together? Is that what you want? Ross back with that controlling, neurotic, crazy Emily? The Emily that wouldn't let him see you?
I'm his sister, okay? I love him! I don't want to see him get hurt! Come on! Doesn’t that give me the right to control him—help him?

No, look, she's obviously unstable, okay? I mean she's thinking about running out on her wedding day. (Rachel slowly turns and glares at her.) (Realizing what she just said.) Okay, fine! But I mean, look at the position she's putting him in! What's he gonna do? Ross is gonna run over there on the wedding day and break up the marriage?! I mean, who would do that?! (Rachel again turns and glares at her in disgust.) Okay, fine, all right, but that's y'know, it's different! Although it did involve a lot of the same people.
Y'know what, this is obviously some kind of twisted joke she's trying to play on him.
All right, I guess we should go.
Oh yeah right! (She grabs the money and shoves into her pocket.)
There's nothing we can do. You erased the message!
Well, if you're gonna be totally rational about this, I can't argue with you! All right? Fine, if you wanna tell him, tell him. I just don't want to be a part of it.
Wow! Play that message for Emily and this whole problem goes away!
Man, I would be great in a war! I mean, I really, I think I would make a fantastic military leader. I mean I know I would make General way before any of you guys.
No. I think we learned that from the sugarlips incident. I'm gonna get some tea.
So it looks like it's going really well for you two, huh?
(shocked) Oh my God!
I think that is so great! When are you gonna ask her?

I swear, I promise. I promise. Oh my God, I'm so excited! {And I just can't hide it! I'm about to lose control and I think I like it! Sorry, just couldn't resist it.} All right, listen let me tell you, do not get her flowers. Okay? Because y'know, she cries when they die, and there's the whole funeral…
(sitting down) Gary's gonna ask you to move in with him!!
He just told me at the counter. He made me promise not to tell, but I couldn't hold it in any longer!
Relax! It's Phoebe! Not you!
Ohhhh!
That is so sweet! (She kisses him and turns to add some sugar to her tea.)
(entering) Hey guys!
Joey, I left my watch on the counter last night. (Goes to the counter) It was right here, where is it?
All right, come on, I'm-I'm late for work!
Guys, could you please just stop throwing the ball for one minute and just help me find it!
What?!
Really?!

(on phone, faking she's sick) I-I'm not gonna be able to make it into work today, I don't feel very good. (Joey makes a high throw and Monica has to catch it way over her head.) (Not sounding sick) Yes!! (Realizes what she just did.) (Sounding sick again) Wow! Uh, for a second there I thought I was really better, but I'm not. (Hangs up and keeps throwing the ball.)
Rach?
You have scratches all over you, what happened? (Rachel's arms are covered with scratches.)
(shocked) What?!
I don't want a cat!
(To Rachel) What?! You paid a thousand dollars for a cat when you owe me 300!!
(jumping in front of him) No-no! Don't do it! Don't!
He's a dropper!
Oh my—Oh good God!
So, why don't you just take it back to where you got it?
Rach, why won't they take it back?
Look, if you want you can keep it at our place until you find out what to do with it.
Oh my God, the cat's made my eyes water! Don't-don't throw it to me! My vision's been compromised!! (Quickly grabs a tissue to wipe her eyes.) Oh God! Okay. Okay. It's okay. Man, that was close.
So you're moving in with him. What happened?
Why, do you write him a lot?
Come on guys! Suck it up! We're closing in on ten hours! It's gut-check time!
Please! I made this game what it is.
All right, there's some pizza at my place, we can all eat with one hand right? Are you with me?
All right! Let's go! (Runs to the door.) Let's go Team Monica! (The guys all stop and stare at her) All right, we can work out the name later.
Rachel! What is your cat doing in one of my bowls!
Wow! You made a profit!
All right! Come on Monica! Look alive! Come on, look alive!
It's okay. It's okay. Just pretend that it didn't happen! Okay? No one needs to know! I mean, Phoebe's not an official ballplayer! I mean, only official ballplayers can drop the ball!
Okay! Okay, let's race! First one there wins! Ha-ha! (Runs out the door and everyone watches her leave.)
(To Rachel) Wow! It's really red! You should go see my eye doctor.
Since we've been going out, I think I've mentioned his name twice!
It's not Richard! Okay? It's this new guy and he's really good.
Hey Rach, remember that great song, Me, Myself, and I? (And on the "I" part she mimics poking her eye.)
Bye!
Why are so mad at him?
Well, it just seems that…
Chandler! You don't have to ask for my permission. (Quietly) You can go.
Hey Rach, come on! We're gonna be late for the eye doctor appointment!

No. If you thought this mess is going to bother me, you are wrong! All right, let's go Blinky! (She ushers Rachel out the door, but before the door fully closes she sticks her head back in.) Chandler!!!! (Chandler agrees to clean up the mess.)
(looks at it more closely) Oh that's an eye removal machine.
I'm kidding! I'm kidding!
A small puff of air, now come on!
Y'know what, I'm gonna hold her head.
Okay. (Monica backs off.)
Dr. Miller? (She covers her right eye and reads from the chart) P E C F D.
I sure do! (She runs over to a drawer, opens it, and grabs a lollipop.) (To Rachel) And you don't get one!
They're still in my coat.
I love you.
I wanna say good-bye at the car!
Oh, I know! Umm, is it because he's always correcting people's grammar? Whom! Whom! Sometimes it's who!
Chandler! What are you doing here?
Not even close.
Okay! All right! Let's do it!
Sit down. (They sit down on the couch.)
Put your head back.
All right.
Now, open your eyes.
How many fingers am I holding up? (She's not holding any up.)
Oh my God, I was thinking four.
Yes! All right, y'know what? Why don't we start with a practice run? Okay?
No drops!
Okay.
On three, 1…2…3! (Rachel turns her head on three to avoid the drops.) Now my pillow's all wet! (She was trying to fool Rachel and squeezed the eyedropper.)
Then why did you move?!
All right, come here! (She gets up and drags Rachel off of the couch by her legs.)

I am going… I'm going--Turn it over! (Rachel rolled onto her stomach and Monica rolls her back.) I'm… I am going to get these drops in your eyes. (She is holding Rachel down with both hands and has the eyedropper in her mouth.)
(spitting out the eyedropper) Damn! It's empty!
(answers the phone) Hello? (Listens.) (To Phoebe) It's Joey. (Phoebe's proud of herself.) (To Joey) I'm so glad you called! Chandler told me what happened. Y'know he's really upset about it.
What did you do to his sweater vests?
Yeah, she's here. Hold on a second. (She hands the phone to Phoebe.)
Well, maybe you should send him something. So that when he gets to Las Vegas he'll know that you're sorry.
(answering it) Hello?
Hey Joey! Aww, you remembered even though you're a big star!
Joey, what's it like on a movie set, huh? Do you have a dressing room? Do you have a chair with your name on it?
Go!!
Okay! Okay! Okay! (She succeeds in getting the eye drops in and everyone climbs off of Rachel.) We'll see you in about 3 to 4 hours.
(entering) Phoebe? (Phoebe comes back into the living room) Oh, Phoebe, I'm so sorry. Have you been here long?
Okay, you can not tell Chandler. Okay? That I ran into Richard.
The Richard.
Noo! My ex-boyfriend Richard! Y'know the tall guy, moustache?
It was, it was really nice. We started talking and I-I ended up having lunch with him.
Really?
The strange part was, he was really nice, umm and he looks great, but I didn't feel anything at all!
Because it would totally freak him out and tomorrow's our anniversary. I just don't want anything to spoil that.
I know.
What?
It's almost our anniversary!
I got you a present!
I know, but you have to open it today! (Hands it too him.)
(grabbing the gift from him and opening it) Okay! There you go! It's two tickets to Vegas!
For this weekend! Oh gosh, it would be perfect, we get to see Joey plus we get to start our anniversary celebration on the plane. We can call it out plane-aversary.
No.
Oh, he just doesn't want us to go through any trouble. Think of how excited he'll be when we go out and surprise him! Plus we get to have our own, ani-Vegas-ary! A-Nevadaversary!
But we can go, right?
Okay!
Ditch you? Phoebe, you were pregnant with the triplets!
Aww! I love you!
Okay!
I love the "I forgot the present" fake out!
Oh that's okay. Don’t worry about it, you can give it to me when we get back.

Okay, I umm, I ran into Richard yesterday and he asked me if I wanted to go for a bite and I did. The only reason I didn't tell you is because I knew you'd get mad and I didn't want to spoil our anniversary.
Really?!
Great!
Phoebe, you don't eat animals.
Who are you talking too?
I'm so sorry.
I knew you were not okay with that.
It meant nothing! Okay? After all this time, how can you not trust me?
You're right. I'm sorry. I should've told you.
I promise you, next time I will absolutely tell you.
I can not see him? I mean, you can't tell me what to do!
Oh y'know what? If you're gonna be acting like this all night, I really, I don't even want to be around you.
Fine! Happy Anniversary!
No it is not!
(to the bartender) Thank you.
I can't believe this! This is like the worst night ever!
This is crazy! I mean, it's such a stupid argument. I don't even wanna see Richard again.
Y'know what? You're right Phoebe. You're right. Thank you! (Gets up to find Chandler.)
Anybody lose this? (Holds up the chip and the woman next to her shakes her head no.)
Hmm.
All right baby, come on! (Rolls the dice) Yes! Yes! I am on fire!
Wait Chandler, what are you doing?!

What? Wait! Why? (He turns and heads for the door and she chases after him.) Chandler! Chandler! Wait! I’m sorry, I was just playing for one second! I was trying to find you to tell you that, look if you don't want me to see Richard again, I won't! He means nothing to me!
Not any more.
Really! (They hug and kiss) All right? Let's forget about this going home stuff and celebrate our anniversary. (She picks up his suitcase.) Okay, this is empty.
Yeah, I couldn't be mad at him for too long.
We have one.
(shaking the dice) A new pair of shoes for the Chan-Chan man! (Rolls the dice.) Yes!
That's right baby! Okay, what do I want now?
Pick a number! That is your only job!
Thank you!
Yes!
(To Chandler) We're not really gonna buy these people steak dinners are we?
Okay, good! Okay, what do I want now?
What?
Okay. (Rolls the dice)
All right, biggest suite in the place. Come on! (Rolls the dice.)
Oh, that's because I had lunch with Rich—Me neither! Okay, what do I want now?
Hard 8?! We should call it easy 8!
Shut up!! It just got interesting!
What did you just say?
Are you serious?!
I've never loved anybody as much as I love you.
Okay!
Nobody move! (To Chandler) Okay, you look that way; I'll look this way!
That could be a four or a five. It's your call.
I think so too.
Okay, come on, I can't get married until I get something old, something new, something borrowed, and something blue.
You're so efficient. I love you!
No-no-no! We need something old!
That'll work!
Okay, now we just need something borrowed!
That's stealing!
Ohh. (Rubs her fake stomach.)
Yep, we wanna get married!
What are you doing?
No, only because that's the graduation song.
Are you sure you wanna do this?
Are you sure you wanna do this?
Whoa!
What are you guys doing here?
Why else would we be here?
This is insane!
What are you talking about? If you get married in Vegas you’re married everywhere.
Yeah!
Hey.
How do I tell Chandler that it’s too soon. It’s gonna break his heart, he’s not gonna think that I don’t love him anymore.
Yes I do!
Oh hi! Hi! Y’know, we were just talking about bacon.
Rach! We weren’t gonna miss our friends getting married!
What are you guys gonna do?
So, what do you think we should do?
I know I love you! (They hug.)
That’s a good question. Look umm, last night we let the dice decide. Maybe we should leave it up to fate again. I love you!
All right, eight we get married, but 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 9, 10, 11, 12 we don’t get married.
Okay. (They approach the craps table.)
Ready?
(sarcastic) Come on eight.
Wow! I can’t believe I actually rolled an eight.
Wait a minute. That wasn’t a hard eight! Last night I rolled a hard eight.
I wanted it so bad! (Pause) Wanna go pack?

Ohh, of course we are! (They walk up to the elevators.) We left it up to fate. (Pushes the elevator button.) If we were supposed to get married there would be a clear-cut sign. (The elevator door opens to a priest reading from a bible with Chandler and Monica standing side-by-side holding each other’s hands.)
That kid really kicked me hard on the plane.
He took my snack!
Okay! Oh God, y’know what? It’s really bad.
This doesn’t mean anything, does it?
Okay.
No, don’t say it! Don’t even think it!
I’m sick of the signs! It’s too fast, I’m happy the way things are!
I don’t want things to change! Do you?
All right then, then nothing changes! Everything is great! Everything stays the same! And you go unpack because it’s been three days and it’s driving me insane!
Then all your stuff would be here.
Then you’d be going back and forth all the time, I mean it doesn’t make any sense.
Live together? There have been no signs for that.
Yes! Okay! Okay! Wait-wait-wait!
Here’s your key (Gets him one.)
Here’s your key. All right, you have to christen it! Now, go out and come back in!
Ready!
Wait! Oh my God! I can’t get out!
No, it’s not a sign! It’s a very old key!
Oh my God it’s old!
I love you!
No.
Of course! Joey wouldn’t let you have one?
Hey, have you figured out a way to tell him you’re moving out?
Y’know, I really have to tell Rachel, but I… We just have to get it over with! Y’know, the next time we see them we’re just gonna tell them. Okay? That’s it.
Pretty much.
Hi!
Joey, we have something to tell you.
Wait! Joey! Joey! Are you okay?!
Hey Pheebs!
Hey, have you seen Rachel?
I have some pretty exciting news!
No! Chandler and I are moving in together!
Hey!
Well umm, Chandler and I are moving in together.
Okay, come here! (Phoebe joins them in the hug.)
Okay, I gotta go find Rachel but umm, if you guys see her could you please try to give her some really bad news so that mine doesn’t seem so bad? (Exits.)
Ugh, I thought you were Rachel!
I just tell her, I have to get it over with. I told Ross and Phoebe and she’s the only one left!
No.
Have a seat. (They sit at the table.) Okay, listen umm, Chandler and I are going to live together, here.
Really?!
Yes, we are. (Chandler is frantically trying to get Monica to correct her.)
Yeah, he’s gonna work on that.
(singing) We’ll be waiting for you…
Soon! I-I just couldn’t before. You saw how upset Joey got! I couldn’t do that to her, she’s my best friend!
I’m not your best friend?
All right, all right, at least I’m prepared.
(slapping his hand) Hey!
These aren’t for you! Are you upset?
Rach, there’s something uh, important I have to tell you.
No! But, I’m throwing this shirt away! I think there was a little misunderstanding before.
Umm, when I said that uh, that Chandler and I wanted to umm, live together we meant alone together.
Oh no sweetie, no! This is my fault, I wasn’t clear! I’m really sorry. And listen, you take as much time as you need to move out okay? There’s absolutely no rush.
Okay. Don’t you want a cookie?
Maybe, do you need a tissue?
I made them!
(entering) Hi.
So I, I told Rachel it was just gonna be the two of us.
Really well. Yeah. Surprisingly well. Yeah, she didn’t cry. She wasn’t angry or sad. (Sits down, slightly disgusted.)

I mean, all I’m asking for is just a little emotion! Is that too much to ask after six years?! I mean what? Are-are-are Rachel and I not as close as you guys?! I mean do we not have as much fun?! Don’t I deserve a few tears?!! I mean we-we told Joey, he cried his eyes out!
Hey. So um, I was thinking that maybe we should start dividing up our stuff.
Y’know, no point in dragging it out. Dragging out the long process of you moving out and us not living together anymore.
Hey Rach, what about this? (She holds up a chrome 5-point star.) Huh? Who-who gets this? See, I don’t know if I want it because it might be y’know, too many memories!
I don’t know. (Picks up a big plate from the coffee table.) Hey, Rachel, you want the big plate? I want you to have the big plate.
Something to remember me by!
But still, it’s a big change. The end of an era, you might say!
I’m fine! I just, I’m thinking how much it’s an end of era.
An era is defined as a significant period of time. Now, it was significant to me, maybe it wasn’t significant to you!
What is the matter with you?!! Why aren’t you more upset?! Aren’t you gonna be sad that we’re not gonna be living together anymore?! I mean aren’t you gonna miss me at all?!
What’s hard to believe?
Rachel, it’s going to happen. Chandler is gonna move in here.
No-no, wait! Just let me finish, okay? This isn’t something that we just, we just impulsively decided in-in Vegas, this is something we both really want. And it is going to happen.
Yeah, sweetie.
No.
I’m gonna miss you! (They hug.)
I know!
Who’s Denise?
Okay listen, y’know when you move in Rachel’s room is gonna be empty, you wanna talk about what we want to do with it?

Okay, I was thinking we should have a beautiful guest room, right? With a mahogany sleigh bed and bedside tables with flowers on them all the time! And we could have a roll top desk with comment cards on them so people could say how much they loved staying here!! Okay, whatever, I really haven’t thought about it that much.
No.
Oh, I’m sorry. Of course I mean that. Interesting idea, umm, talk about it, but no.
I just don’t think arcade games go in the beautiful guest room. The beautiful guest room is gonna be filled with antiques.
What do you have against the beautiful guest room?
Are you mocking me?
Hi.
Stop it Chandler. (Chandler is relieved) I’m sorry too.
Yeah! Oh yes!
Listen, we don’t have to make that a guest room, we can think of something to do with the room together.
Totally!
Oh good.
Changes?
You’re-you’re-you’re gonna bring the Barca Lounger over here?
Well, it’s a set and they should probably stay together.
See now-now you’re taking them away from their home.

Yeah-yeah, y’know what? Yeah, that’s it-that’s it, everything will be mine! Nothing will be yours! That’s-that’s what I said! Oh come on, Chandler! I’m talking about the barca lounger! It just, it doesn’t match! Where is it gonna go?!
Look it is not my fault that your chairs are incredibly ugly!
Ross, we can handle this.
Love is the best medicine.
Why do you do it?
Yes.
That’s very funny!
Ross, you were right before, it was just a stupid fight about a room.
Yeah, no, me neither.
You still want to move in together right?
Ross didn’t scare you?
Come here, I want to show you something!
This is where I thought the barca lounger could go! You see you could see the TV and it’s still walking distance to the kitchen.
Okay!
Uh-hmm.
Oh my God! I love that!
Uh, no!!
This bottle opener. (She grabs it off of the freezer door.)
And it’s a magnet!
Hey Rach, aren’t these candlesticks (holds up a pair) mine?
Ohh! Yeah, I forgot.
(under her breath) That you’re a liar. (Hides the candlesticks in a drawer.)
Wow! Uh what, did he uh, say?
Hey!
Phoebe that’s crazy!
Hmm? (Rachel holds up the candlesticks.)
No-no, I-I just, I liked them so much that I went out and bought some for myself.
I loved them!
Hey!
How’d the lecture go?
That you’re not funny or sexy?
Yeah, but y’know we could sneak in and watch.
What the hell are you doing?!
(in an Irish accent) Monica Gellerrr. (She rolls her ‘R’)
(normal voice) Oh, you can have an accent and I can’t?! (To an exiting student in accent.) Top ‘O the morning to ya laddies!
Gimme ‘em!
You stole them from me!
Gimme them!
You just wanna each take one?
Why don’t you phase it out? Yeah, fade the accent out and people will think you’re, y’know, that you’re adjusting to life in America.
I think you look fine.
Okay, come on, do it one more time!
Yes!
You’re kidding!
Ross!
Joey, why don’t you put them in the lost and found?
Oh my God, what a fun day! That sounds great!
Don’t worry about it Phoebe, we’ll absolutely do it.
Come on Chandler, come on! It’ll give us great practice for when—(realizes what she’s about to say and changes)—people with babies come to visit.
Pheebs, how’s it going?
Nope, sound like me. Pheebs, it’s going great. Look at Chandler with little baby girl Chandler.
What do you mean?
This is so great! This is exactly how we set the plates at the restaurant.
Oh yeah, I got soap and sponges and rags and Carnuba wax and polishing compound.
I know. But umm, one time there was this really dirty car in front of the building, so I washed it.
And six others.
Yeah, two hours, a lifetime that’s the same.
Chandler, what are you doing? That thing can put someone’s eye out!
Oh it’s so cute. I wonder what age it is when you stop being able to put both legs over your head.
How are you still single?!
Good. What made you change your mind?
Damnit! Y’know this whole time we were concentrating on watching the babies and, and no one was watching Chandler! (He does it again.)
And people will think you own a Porsche because you’re wearing the clothes?
Joey, you know you don’t actually have one.
All right, that’s it, we’re going to the emergency room.
The babies are asleep, I’m sure you’ll be okay on your own for a while!
He’s got something plastic lodged in his throat, we’ve got to go to the hospital.
Oh my God.
Phoebe, what, what happened here?!
But my apartment!
But the mess!
You’re right, you’re right I shouldn’t freak out. ‘Cause this is what will happen when you and I have babies! When will that be?!
(entering from her room) Hey!
(thinks) Okay.
Well, instead of being sad that tonight is my last night together with Rachel we thought we’d go out to dinner and celebrate the fact that Rachel is moving in with Phoebe.
It’s not your birthday.
You’re not dressed yet?! We’re supposed to start having fun in 15 minutes!
Rachel, you are packed though right, I mean please tell me that you’re packed.
(entering) Rachel, I need to borrow—You’re not packed!!!! You’re not packed even a little bit!
What?
(grabs a bag of those Styrofoam peanuts) I’ll be coordinator! Oh my God! I’m so sorry, I didn’t get you anything! Okay, look everybody has to help! Okay? You can help, can’t you Phoebe?
You’re plans were with us.
All right, Chandler can make boxes, Ross can wrap, and Joey can lift things. Now Phoebe, go tell the guys they have to help out!
Okay! (To Rachel) Oh my God, thank you!!
(entering and interrupting the guy’s escape attempt) Okay! The movers will be here in 11 hours. Rachel has not packed. Now, everybody has to help! Chandler, we’re gonna start with…
I thought you said you were going to do nothing.
Okay fine, now Ross…
Why not?
It’s almost 8 o’clock, it’s almost past his bedtime. Where-where is he?
Is he really coming? Because I can see right into your apartment!
All right, sorry. (Goes back to Rachel’s room.)
(starting to cry) Oh God!
No.
I’m gonna miss you so much.
I don’t think there’s anything.
Nope, she’s perfect.
Aw, sometimes. Always, actually.
Not just the phone pen. I never get my messages.
Yeah, well I don’t think it really counts if you have to read them off the back of your hand after you fall asleep on the couch.
Hello? (Listens) Oh, hi Ross! (To Rachel) See? Other people call me!
(on phone) What’s up?
Oh, put him on!
"Hi I’m Rachel, is my sweater too tight? No? Oh, I’d better wash it and shrink it!"
"Oh my God, I love Ross! I hate Ross! I love Ross! I hate Ross!"
I’m not talking to her!
Well, maybe you’re right—She made fun of my phone pen!
Listen Rachel, I feel really bad about—What are you doing? (She sees that Rachel is unpacking.)
What?!
It needs to go about 20 blocks to the left!
Because it’s my apartment!

How about, you’re moving!! (Grabs a bunch of clothes and throws them into a box. What follows is a brief sequence of Rachel unpacking and Monica packing the same stuff over and over again as Rachel chants "No." and Monica chants "Yes.")
(entering) I am not!
No Phoebe I am mad!
Well, this is the last box of your clothes. I’m just gonna label it, "What were you thinking?"
Whoa-whoa-whoa, Phoebe you gotta take her! Y’know I-I-I said some really bad stuff about her, but y’know Rachel has some good qualities that make her a good roommate.
Y’know she has 147,000 pairs of boots…
She lets you borrow them.
Do you wanna live outside?! Because it’s gettin’ cold! (To Phoebe) She gets tons of catalogs and umm, she’ll fold down the pages of the things she thinks that I’d like.
When I take a shower, she leaves me little notes on the mirror.
When I fall asleep on the couch after reading, she covers me over with a blanket.

And when I told her that I was gonna be moving in with Chandler, she was really supportive. (To Rachel) (Starts to cry) You were so great. You made it so easy. And now you have to leave. And I have to live with a boy!! (They both break down in tears.)
Kinda. (She hugs Phoebe and looks out the window. She moves closer to it to get a better look.) Oh my God!
Hey. Call me when you get there. Okay?
I’m really gonna miss you.
Thanks.
Yeah.
Bye.
She really left.
Thank you.
