Well Ross, you be careful now. You don’t want to get a reputation as y’know Professor McNailshisstudents.
Joey that is so sweet.
What?! You’re going out with her again!
Joey! You didn’t even know her!
Hey! How’s it goin’?
Yes it has! I made cookies!
But you should eat them now because they’re hot from the oven.
(pulling the plate back) Oh-ho! But not in here! Can’t eat ‘em in bed, remember? No crumbies!
Okay!
(opening the door) What are you doing?
What’s the charity?
Does Ralph mumble when you’re not paying attention?
Oh, I like Elizabeth.
Yeah. In fact, I like her so much you tell her I want my cookies early this year! Y’know, a box of Thin Mints and some Tag-a-Longs.
Well that is great. And seriously, she seems very nice.
Chandler, do you think we talk about our relationship enough?
Hey!
(laughs sarcastically) Rachel is not going to pick your stupid guy.
Yeah!
Well, uh y’know, our guy works with Chandler and he’s really nice and smart and he’s a great dresser!
You’re not supposed to look!
All right fine, your guy may have a great body, but our guy is really funny.
Our guy’s a great dancer!
(To Chandler) Do you want our guy to be your guy?
Hey! How did it go with Elizabeth?
Well, spring vacation is doing nice things with your grandparents. Spring break you’re doing frat guys.
And slept with the professor.
Yes! We found you a really cute and funny guy from Chandler’s work!
Uh, would you stop it with that already?!
Are you funny? Tell us a joke!
All right guys stop it. Rachel, we’re very sorry that is a very insensitive thing for us to do. And y’know what? Let us make it up to you, we have two really great guys for you.
In 1981 you were 13!
Hey!
Hey!
We’re really glad you decided to meet our guy.
You’re gonna like him so much. So umm, when do you want to meet him?
Eldad, this is Rachel.
Okay! Okay! We can take a hint! (They start to leave but run into Phoebe with her guy in tow.) (To Phoebe) What are you doing here?!
No! You can’t do that!
(stopping him) Sit down! We’re winning!
Rachel! Rachel! You haven’t touched Eldad’s hair!
That’s right Patrick, bye-bye!
What?
(trying not to laugh) Oh my God.
Yes.
Alright, well I'm tearing the lettuce.
Oh-oh, no no don't worry, I'm gonna wash it.
That's your call.
Well, I thought that I would cut up the tomatos.
They'r alright.
No really, they're OK.
Actually, I was gonna do them jullienne.
I'm outa here. [Monica leaves]
Well, what happened?
Was it...
(startled) Ahh! Aren’t you dressed yet?
We’re supposed to meet my parents in 15 minutes.
Wh?! What about my allergies?!

Oh, stop beating yourself up! People make mistakes! These things happen! There aren’t any message you’ve forgotten to give me are there? (Chandler has a disgusted look on his face.) Apparently you’re not very good at it! I…
Y’know what? He will forgive you. And I like to bring a pad with me when I go answer the phone just in case… (Chandler gets that disgusted look back.) Okay…
You had no right to go out with him.
You sold me out.
Yes you did.  You absolutely sold me...
Did you just flick me?
Fine!
(To Chandler) You are going to make a joke about my special present! Why would you do that?!
I think our lover’s spat will start a little early this month.
We know how tough those parent/teacher conferences can be.
Ross!!
How crazy that we’d run into you!
(obviously attracted to him) Is-is-is there a-a Mrs. Stevens?
Y’know, it is so strange seeing Ross here this time of day, ‘cause usually he’s got the children’s hospital.
And he’s a great brother!
Ohh!
No, you said the baby creeps you out.
You said the baby.
Why would the little girl creep you out?
What?! Excuse me!
How was your first day?
Well y’know Joey, you’re a pretty charming guy.
No sweetie, you’ve got to win over the guy that controls C.H.E.E.S.E.! You’ve got to kiss some serious robot ass!
Yeah! That’s why I’m sleeping with him on the side.
Phoebe, stop writing about us!
Okay fine! Fine! Then you know what, I’ll just write about Phyllis! Hmm!
(writing on a piece of paper) Phyllis is sitting in a chair.
(still writing) Phyllis sees what I’m doing.
Chandler, we said we would meet at the coffeehouse at six.
We said six!
Yeah and if I had seven, maybe I would’ve said something like this, "Wow! My boyfriend’s such a wise ass—seven!"
Ugh!
What time?
Inside of telling us you decided to write in your stupid book!
Hi!
Oh that’s great!
I mean think about all the money that you’re gonna make!
Well, her father pays you for baby-sitting right?
Oh, I love museums!
Soakin’ up all the culture.
Where do you want to start?
Yeah!

This would be a beautiful place to get married, yeah, but I wouldn’t put the aisle there and I would never have the ceremony there! (Points to both places.) I mean you’d have the ceremony under this big beautiful arch. (The arch at the entrance to the room.)
What?! Are you crazy?! I’m not getting married! I’m not even engaged.
Well, I mean I guess there is no harm in putting my name down.
Phoebe, that stuff is…
Hi, honey.
What? I-I bought groceries, I was gonna make you dinner!
Oh no!
Oh please, he didn’t hear it! He didn’t hear it!!
Phoebe!
Have you seen Chandler?!
The woman from the museum called and said that there was a cancellation and that we could move up our wedding and Chandler heard! (Phoebe gasps.) I know! How bad is this?!
I know! I know! And he totally freaked out and I can’t find him anywhere!
Well, I’m never gonna listen to you again, that’s for sure! (Mimicking her.) "Y’know, harm can it do if you go and put your name down?"
Well Rachel’s not here! (Runs out.)
(going over to him) I’m so sorry. Please, stop freaking out.
Honey, we were at this beautiful place, and I-I-I just put our names down for fun! I mean, what’s the harm in that?
Chandler, please don’t think I was trying to pressure you. Phoebe and Rachel…
It was a mistake. Please don’t take this to mean anything, because it doesn’t.
Really?
I know! I know.
I’m gonna go tell Joey that (laughs) that you’re back. I was really worried about you. (Exits.)
Still crying?
Y’know, I only know of two surefire ways to shut a man up. And one of them is s*x.
I don’t know, I’ve never had to use the other one. I’m just saying y’know, if we’re having s*x, he’s not gonna be talking.
Oh, we have some…
(entering) Hey!
What’s the big deal?
Ross let me ask you a question. All jokes aside, where is this relationship going?
Do you really see this as a long-term thing?
Hi guys.
Oh, thank you! (The gang exhibits signs of quiet apprehension and wears knowing glances.) (Monica giggles.) What’s going on?
What are you doing?
Are you okay?
Yeah. I’m okay. I’m actually—I’m a little cold, can I have your jacket?
(laughs) Are you sure you’re okay?
Ohh that’s sweet!
(interrupting him) Oh my God!
Oh my God, Richard. (Yep, Richard’s back.)
Oh God, maybe he won’t see us. Richard!
Hey, it’s good to see you!
Yeah—Oh that’s right. You, you always wanted me too. Hey, I see you got your mustache back.
Chandler, wh-why don’t we sit down?
(to Richard) It’s good to see you
And so, we’re hiding in the bathroom.
So I hide in the shower and the next thing you know they’re going at it right on the bathroom floor.
Ohh.
I thought you were going out with Elizabeth.
Oh Ross, sometimes grown-ups have commitments they just can’t get out of!
Why don’t you just weigh out the good stuff about the relationship against the bad stuff. I mean that’s what I did when I first (looks at Chandler and pauses) weighing stuff.
If the school finds out you’re fired.
She’s leaving for three months.

Look Ross, the only question you need to ask is, "Do you see a future?" I mean like do you see yourself marrying her? (Ross pauses in consideration.) Oh my God! You did it already! You married her, didn’t you?!
Okay well I think…that’s your answer.
Why do you want to see my hand?
(suspiciously) Okay. (Exits to carry out Phoebe’s wishes.)
(entering) I had to go all the way to the basement because some idiot keeps stuffing the trash chute with pizza boxes!
(entering) Hi guys!
What are you up too?
Well that’s a little crazy. Although I am y’know glad to hear that you’re branching out on what you look at on the Internet.
Why?! To celebrate your relationship! To solidify your commitment! To declare your love for one another to the world!
Okay well that’s good to know.
Sure, I love this part! (Starts to look busy.)
Richard!
Ohh… Oh, that’s okay I hate when people come back to complement the chef. Like I have nothing better to do! So what’s up?
Oh, good to see you too. Did you come down here to tell me that?
What uh—What did you—What?!
Y’know you’re really not supposed to be back here!
Oh God… (Starts looking around.) Why don’t they put chairs back here?!
What the… Yes you’re too late! Where was all this three years ago?!
What were you doing in Africa?
Ohhh! What are you doing to me?! Oh look, I-I… I’m sorry but umm, this-this-this-this is not going to happen.
Well he is! Yeah, I mean marriage is all he talks about! My goodness, in fact, I’m the one that’s making him wait!
Yeah!
Why? Because of the government.
So that marriage stuff that you were saying yesterday, you don’t really believe that do you?
Yeah, but that’s pigs not people!
Wait a minute. Are you honestly telling me that-that you may never want to get married?
Oh my God! Then-then-then what are we even doing?! What is this?!
Y’know what?! I gotta go! Ugh!
Have you seen Rachel? Or a mirror?
Yeah, it’s great.
I’m just having one of those days where you realize you’re in a dead-end relationship!
It’s not like I want to get married tomorrow! It’s just that I-I’d like to believe that I’m in a relationship that’s actually going somewhere, that I’m not just wasting my time!
No I don’t know Chandler! Not anymore! It’s like it’s like something’s changed.
I didn’t change!
What?!
Is that some kind of boat talk?
What does he think? Does he think I’m just gonna wait around for nothing?
(starts for the door) Well there’s some people who do want to marry me.
Yeah! Richard!
That’s right.
You just told me that he hates marriage! That-that he’s a-a complex fellow who’s unlikely to take a wife! That-that he’s against marriage and always will be!
Hi.
I don’t know why I’m here.
I don’t know.
(entering) Chandler is such an idiot!
Yeah, I’ll have a scotch…
(moving over to the couch) Still smoking cigars?
No that’s, that’s okay.
Uh yeah, I-I actually I thought about you a couple months ago.
Yeah but it was because I-I had an eye exam and I don’t like my new eye doctor.
Edward Nevski?
No.
But getting over was the hardest thing that I’ve ever had to do. And I never let myself think about you.
(to the mask) I missed you-you ugly, flat faced old freak!
Oh! (Laughs and points at the mask.) Him.
I missed this apartment! Now, this is a grown-up’s apartment! Y’know, I-I should be with a grown-up, do you know what I mean?!

Y’know, let’s face it, I’m not a kid anymore! I-I need to be with someone who-who wants the same things that I do! I mean coming to my place of work and telling me that you love me, I want that! Talking about pig s*x over lunch, I don’t want that!

Fair? Please don’t even talk to me about fair! Fair would’ve been you wanting to marry me back then! Or fair would’ve been Chandler wanting to marry me now! Believe me, nothing about this is fair! Nothing! Nothing! Nothing! Nothing! Nothing! Nothing! Nothing! Nothing! Nothing! Nothing!
Nothing. (She backs away a little bit but is still in his arms and looks up at his eyes.) I don’t kn—Umm. I don’t know. Umm…
Y’know, I-I… I have to figure…some st—Y’know, some stuff before I can…
You wanted it to be a surprise.
Chandler… In all my life… I never thought I would be so lucky. (Starting to cry.) As to…fall in love with my best…my best… There’s a reason why girls don’t do this!
Yes.
I knew you were likely to take a wife!
Come in! Come in! (Joey, Rachel, and Phoebe burst through the door.) We’re engaged!!!
Oh…
(yelling at the top of her lungs) I’m engaged!!!!!! I’m engaged!!!!

I’m getting married!!!! I’m gonna be a bride!!!! (Someone else yells at her.) No, I will not shut up because I’m engaged! (He yells again.) Ohh, big talk! Huh, why don’t you come over here and say that to me?! Huh, buddy?! Yeah, my fiancée will kick your ass! (Chandler starts to look worried.) Come on, apartment 20! Apartment 20!

Okay! Wait-wait-wait! Shhh! (Bangs on her class with a spoon to make a toast.) Okay, umm, I just wanna say that…I love you guys so-so much and-and thank you for being here on my special night. (Chandler clears his throat.) Our special night. I mean it just wouldn’t be my—our-our night, if you all weren’t here to celebrate with me—us—Damnit!
Awww, come on—wait—stop it. Okay, to Monica.
Y’know what we should do? We should all get dressed up and go to have champagne at The Plaza.
Okay everybody, let’s go! Let’s go!

(looking at her hand) Y’know what shoes would look great with this ring? Diamond shoes! (Sees Chandler sitting on the bed.) You’re not getting dressed. (Chandler quietly folds over the comforter on the bed making a spot for her.)
Yeah, but I don’t think we have time.
(lustily) Let’s do it! (She kisses him and they fall back onto the bed.)
(chasing after him) Chandler! It happens to lots of guys! You-you-you were probably tired, you had a lot of champagne, don’t worry about it!
Phoebe!
Phoebe! Come on! Let’s go! (Knocks on her door.) Come on! (Phoebe enters with guitar and not ready to go.) Why aren’t you dressed yet?!
(grabs the guitar away from her) No, Phoebe, I’ll tell you what, if you get ready now I’ll let you play it at the wedding.
Fair enough, now go get ready!

I’ll get everybody else (Does so), finally we can start celebrating my—(She gasps and is stopped by the sight of Ross and Rachel making out in the hall.) I’m sorry, uh apparently I’ve opened the door to the past.
(interrupting) Can I ask you just a little question, huh? Why tonight?

See, I’ve been waiting my whole life to be engaged, and unlike some people I’m only planning on doing this once. So, uh y’know, maybe this is selfish and I’m sorry about it, but I was kinda hoping tonight could just be about that.
No it’s not! No! No! Now it’s about you and Ross getting back together!
See yeah umm, you kinda stole my thunder!
That’s true.
Thunder being stolen!!
Well, we’re still talking about it, aren’t we?
Yes that would be lovely.
Y’know what? I-I think that umm, I don’t feel like going to The Plaza.
No-no, I-I really don’t want to talk about it! I don’t! (To Rachel) Especially with you. (Goes into her room.)
I can’t believe her, y’know it’s just—it’s so typical.
Paris?
Keep talking.
I love you!
(in a French accent) Bonjour, monsieur.
(opening the door) Hi Pheebs, what’s up? (She enters.)
What?!
Yes.
Well, let’s just say it’s not the first time you’ve stolen my thunder.
My Sweet Sixteen! Remember, you went to third base with my cousin Charlie.
It’s all everybody at the party could talk about!
(gasps) We had a caricaturist!
And yet, here we are doing it again.
Oh please! Why else would you have made out with Ross?!
I just thought it would be nice if I could have just this one night!
Oh, is that why you did it in the secret hallway where nobody ever goes?!

I don’t know! I don’t—maybe you’re feeling a little resentful. Maybe ah, maybe you thought you’d get married first! Maybe you can’t stand the fact that your formerly fat friend is getting married before you!
(yelling after them) I can’t believe you’re gonna have s*x on my engagement night!!
(outside the door) It’s Monica, open up!

I just wanted to say that I hope you do have s*x tonight and I hope that you guys get back together, but I must warn you, the night that you announce your engagement I’m going to announce that I’m pregnant!
I know why!
Okay! Why?!
What do you mean?
(starting to cry) I’m sorry I almost made you sleep with Ross. (They hug.)
(entering from her room) Oww!
I don’t know, my hand feels weird. I guess it’s because, I’m engaged! (Shows off the ring.) How long before it starts getting annoying?
Okay! (Runs off.)
(returning) Okay! (Sets down a huge 3" 3-ring binder on the table.)
This baby has got everything. Take y’know, locations for instance. (She opens up the binder to the locations chapter.) First, organized alphabetically, then geographically, then by square footage.
All right, so I haven’t cleared the budget with my parents yet, but tell me how this is for music.
All right umm, a string quartet for the procession.
A jazz trio for cocktails. The Bay City Rollers for dancing. Wait, that was from my sixth grade wedding.
Of course you can look at it! Yeah, I want your opinion too!
Here you go! What do you think about centerpieces?
Yeah! Roses or Lilies? (Holds up a picture of each.)
Oh my God! It’s like one mind.
Oh dad, really you don’t need to…
Well, at least you’re not hearing it for the first time at your fifth grade Halloween party.

Anyway, we’re really excited about our wedding plans, and well I guess pretty soon we’ll be making a big withdrawal from the Monica wedding fund. (She and Chandler laugh, but her parents don’t.) What?
What happened? You still have the Monica wedding fund don’t you?
I don’t believe you spent my wedding fund on the beach house!
You bought the beach house when I was 23!
What about when I started dating Chandler?
I can’t believe it! That there is no money for my wedding?!
I can’t believe this. Do you think that your parents could help pay for it?
My parents spent the money for our wedding!
No! No it’s not! It’s not gonna be okay! It sucks! No swing band! No lilies!
How? I don’t have any money.
How much?
Whoa!!! Are you kidding me?!
It’s enough for wedding scenario eight.
(To Chandler) How great are you, you little saver?! I mean, the-the amount you have is exactly the budget of my dream wedding!
This is the most special day of our lives.

Honey, umm I-I love you, (laughs) but umm, if you call our wedding a party one more time, you may not get invited. Okay? (Laughs) Listen, we could always earn more money, okay? But uh, we’re only gonna get married once.
You-you’re gonna have to put your foot down?
Hey.
Listen umm, I’ve been thinking, it’s not fair for me to ask you to spend all of your money on our wedding. I mean, you work, you work really hard for that.
Eh, you work for that.
You do?!
Oh, you’re so sweet. (They hug and kiss.) Oh, but wait, what about our, what about the future and stuff?
You thought about that?
How many kids were we gonna have?
What else did you think about?
(laughs) Y’know what? I-I don’t want a big, fancy wedding.
No, I want everything you just said. I want a marriage.
Uh-hmm.
I love you. (They kiss.) Hey listen umm, when, when you were talkin’ about our future you said cat, but you meant dog right.
Oh good.
Sweetie, I think the glasses look great. They make you look really sexy.
Yeah!
Of course! (She mouths, "I have no idea," to the rest of the gang.)
(interrupts him) If someone wants to give us a present, we don’t want to deprive them of that joy.
Oh, I already have one.
Hey, I know what I want!
No, you don’t want this. I want to have your grandmother’s cookie recipe.
Uh-huh, yeah.
I wanted it for years! I was gonna make cookies for my children.
Okay. I’m gonna be the mom that makes the world’s best chocolate chip cookies.
Oh, so you finally took it out of the marina huh?
What?
Wow! That’s great! Dad must really like you, he doesn’t ask just anyone to play.
This is so cool, maybe this is something you can do every week.
Oh, just so you know, you-you have to let him win.
He hates to lose.
What’s wrong Phoebe?
No!! Why didn’t you make a copy and-and keep it in a fireproof box and keep it at least a hundred yards from the original?!!
(To Chandler) This is what happens when you don’t register for gifts!
No! Wait! I think I can figure out the recipe from this cookie! I do stuff like this at work all the time.
Yeah! I bet I can do it.
All right, I definitely taste nutmeg.
You don’t? (Laughs) Well, that’s the difference between a professional and a layman.
Hey! How was sailing?
Hey! How was it?
Oh my God Chandler! I can’t believe it!
You gave my father a lap dance!
Listen, I’m sure that dad doesn’t care. He probably thought this was funny; he’ll be telling this story for years!
I wasn’t escaping.
I was trying to help out a squirrel.
(takes the phone from Ross) Come on. (Answering phone) Hello? (Listens) I’m sorry you have the wrong number. (Listens) (Whispering) Okay, I’ll call you later dad. I love you. (Hangs up.)
Okay, here’s batch 22. Oh, maybe these’ll taste a little like your grandmother’s. This has a little bit of orange peel, but no nutmeg.
Okay. Man, I have not made this many cookies since I was in the ninth grade.
No, just a Friday night.
The ones we had right after you almost threw up.
Well, I’ve tried everything. I give up. I guess I’m not gonna be the mom who makes the world’s best chocolate cookies. I do make the best duck confit with broccoli rabe.  Kids love that right.
Well, I mean what about friends of your grandmother’s? Wouldn’t they have the recipe?
What was her name?
Nestle Tollhouse?!
(grabbing a bag of Nestle Tollhouse chocolate chips) Phoebe, is this the recipe? (Tosses her the bag.)
I cannot believe that I just spent the last two days trying to figure out the recipe and it was in my cupboard the whole time!
(on phone) Hello? (Listens) Hold on please. Joey, it’s your mom. (Hands him the phone.)
Wh-what are we gonna tell him?
And I have costumes.
Phoebe, do you think that your favorite animal says much about you?
Still get a discount on wedding dresses?
I’m so happy for you!
What?!
Oooh!
(To Chandler) Hey sweetie.
I can’t tell you. It’s a secret.
Awww. (Kisses him.) But still no.
Really? Okay, so why don’t you tell me what happened to Ross Junior year at Disneyland?
If you tell me, I’ll tell you what Phoebe said.
Okay.
Oh my God. He threw up?
Oh, Nancy Thompson from Phoebe’s old massage place is getting fired.
That’s right! You lose sucker!! (Pause) Please still marry me.
Hey! Good, you’re home!
Hey baby. (Kisses him.)
I made you a surprise.
Yeah, tacos! Ever since you told me that story I’ve had such a craving for them.
Ross!
No! No. They’re umm… They’re just uh…ground beef smileys. (Holding up one of the shells.)
Excuse me Mr. Mexico.
(trying not to laugh) I’m not laughing.
You’re right. I mean I’m sorry. Yeah, I shouldn’t be laughing. I should be laying down papers for you! (Runs off laughing which gets Chandler laughing.)
(running up to Ross) What happened in Atlantic City?!
(To Chandler) You kissed a guy?!! Oh my God.
Oh my God! (Laughing)
I-I already told him everything! (Threateningly) You shush!!
Ross used to stay up every Saturday night to watch Golden Girls!
It’s hard for some people!
Chandler one time wore my underwear to work!
Ohh, I’m sorry I couldn’t think of any more for Ross!
Y’know, in my defense, umm there was no glitter on the macaroni and very little glue.
No!
I don’t know! Time to kiss a guy maybe?! (Ross laughs.) What are you laughing at Pampers? (He stops laughing and glares at her.)
Yeah?
Ohh, absolutely.
Yeah, definitely!
Then, I’d steer clear of Phoebe.
What’s the matter?
Oh, my mom called, they’re gonna run our engagement announcement in the local paper, so we’re looking for a good picture of us.
That’s not true, there are great pictures of us!
(looking at one) Oh, here’s a great one.
I know, but look at me: all tan.
That’s a good idea! I bet they have one of those wind machines! Y’know… (Does the whole hair blowing in the wind model type poses.)
Chandler what do you say?
Chandler, listen to me sweetie, I know you can do this. Okay? You have a beautiful smile.
Yeah! (They turn to the camera, and Chandler does The Face again.) All right, maybe you don’t have to smile. Let’s try something else. Let’s try umm, try looking sexy.
Or not.

I know. Let’s try a look…of far off…wonderment. Okay, we’ll-we’ll gaze into our future and we’ll think about our marriage and the days to come. (Chandler is still not getting it.) Chandler! What is the matter with your face?! I mean this picture is supposed to say "Geller and Bing to be married," not "Local woman saves drowning moron!" (The photographer laughs.) Hey! Don’t laugh at him! He’s my drowning moron!
That’s it! Take it! Take it! Take it!
They can’t all be bad. (To Chandler) Find the one where you make your bedroom eyes. Ohh, there it is.
Do you really want to pull at that thread?
(seeing him approach) Hey! There you are!
Are you okay?
What?!
Chandler, what were you thinking?
Chandler?
Hey guys check it out! My mom sent me the paper!
Okay. (She opens it up and shows it to them.)
Yeah, we really do!
Wow! Imagine what our kids would look like!
Okay, the reason why I asked you guys out to brunch today is because I have been doing some thinking about who should be my maid of honor.
First of all um, I love you both so much and you’re both so important to me…
Well umm, I was thinking that maybe we could come up with a system where we trade off being maid of honor for each other. Like hypothetically, if Phoebe were mine…
If Phoebe were my maid of honor…
Rachel would be Phoebe’s, I would be Rachel’s, that way we all get to do it once and no one would get upset.
(laughs) Well that’s the best part. Umm, you guys get to decide!
Because then I don’t have to!
I’m really not deciding!
Yeah that’s right.
Yeah hey, a weird thing happened today when I was at brunch. This woman overheard that I was marrying you and-and then she…she wished me good luck.
No, it’s more like a (sarcastically) good luck.
She was like 30, dark hair, attractive.
Come on, was it somebody maybe you dated in college?
What are you doing?
Oh my God yes! Who is she?
Did you break up with her?
Why?
Fat?!
You broke up with a girl because she was fat?!
Well, apparently she does.
Chandler! (Knocks on the door.) Chandler! I just figured out who you are!
You’re Lewis Posin.
Lewis Posin! He was my best friend in fifth grade, and-and then one day I asked him to be my boyfriend and he said no. Do you know why?

No! But because he thought I was too faaaaa…. (Chandler emerges, without flushing by the way.) And every time I think about it, it makes me feel as bad as I did in fifth grade! Y’know, I-I really think that you should apologize to Julie.
No, I know. But y’know what? It would make me feel better if Lewis apologized to me.
It’s pretty clear.
Why don’t you just stop doing stupid things? Then you wouldn’t have to apologize.
All right, I…I have to ask.
Are you gonna break up with me if I get fat again?
Well, you broke up with Julie Grath! How much weight could she have gained?
In one year?! My God what did she eat? Her-her family! That’s not the point.
Well… That’s not the only time this was an issue. You remember when umm, you spent Thanksgiving with us? You called me fat.
How?
What if I have babies, okay? I mean I’m gonna look different. I’m okay with that, but I’m not sure that you are!
Keep going.
Even if I shrink down to two inches tall?
I love you. (They hug and kiss.)
(entering) Hey, what’s going on?

(gasps) Ohh, wow! That’s great! (Rachel and Monica hug.) Oh wow! We really have to start planning! I have, I have a lot of really specific ideas! We should probably get together like four times per week. You can come over to my place; we’ll get together before work! What do you say, 6:30, my place? I’m so excited! (Runs out leaving Rachel completely stunned and Phoebe laughing.)
She sent the chicken back again?!
Well fine! I want to meet this chicken expert! Send the Colonel in!

(to the lobster) Lucky b*st*rd! (Throws the lobster in and turns around to face the planet’s most annoying woman, next to Dr. Laura and Kathy Lee Gifford of course. She’s the most annoying female TV character however.) Janice.
I’m fine.
Oh… Uh…
Well, she saw the ring.
Well, she was shocked when I told her, but then again so were most people.
Well, she actually has a boyfriend y’know herself, named Clark. Uh, she also kinda invited herself to our wedding. Clark too.
Huh?
Well, she cornered me! She asked if the wedding was in town! I mean, what was I supposed to do?!
Come on! So she comes to the wedding! I mean it won’t be so bad.
Oh my God, she’s not gonna like the chicken that night either, is she?!
Really?
So-so you would’ve just lied?
Would it really have been that easy?
Good, so do it Saturday night because we’re going to dinner with her and Clark.
He might still show up.
Is that all?
It’s actually going to be just family.
What are we gonna do?
Janice, what umm, what are you doing here?
(To Chandler) Our kids are gonna call her Aunt Janice aren’t they?
Yeah, in-in-in the bathroom.
We’ll just…we’ll just let her stay.
Kinda like your barcalounger.
I never stop thinking about it.
Oh my God! Oh my God! You have to go!
Because Chandler still has feelings for you!
That’s right. That’s right. And that is why you can’t stay here tonight. And probably why you shouldn’t come to the wedding.
I mean, I realize that his feelings may never completely go away, but you can.
It's a stupid game and I wasn't playing against other people, so technically I didn't lose.
Nobody cares about the Dakotas. (That’s true in so many ways, trust me, I’ve lived in one and been to the other.)
'Cause you invited your assistant.
Oh! Why didn't you tell me? I made him his own individual sweet potato stuffed pumpkin.
Now you think I wouldn't enjoy that, because it is so fake, (Laughs) but I still do.
All right, I'm out of oven space. I'm gonna turn on Joey's. Please, watch him! Do not let Joey eat any of the food!
(entering, to Joey and Rachel) Hey, did you guys know that your oven doesn't work?
Ross, I'm gonna use yours, okay?
Chandler? Can you give me a hand? (Grabs her jacket)
Ross’s apartment is nice! How come we don't hang out here more often?
That's my pie!
Uh-oh! Uh-oh!
We left Joey alone with the food! (Walks towards the window and looks out) Yep! Yep, I knew it! There he is... feeding stuffing to a dog!
Phoebe, why is there a dog in our apartment?
Phoebe, there's a dog sitting on my couch!
Yes there is! He's black and white and shaggy and [Cut to Monica’s apartment] he's sitting next to Rachel and licking Rachel's hand.
I'll be right there!
(walks to Phoebe's door) Phoebe! Phoebe, open up!
Oooh, I wish she could stay here, but Chandler is allergic!
Chandler, if that dog's been here that long, and you haven't had a reaction, maybe you're not allergic to this dog?
Don't do what?
Yeah.
Really? I'd say 3 to 4.
When it's your assistant, I would say never.

Please, don't listen to Joey, okay. Would you look at him? He-he’s obviously depressed. He's away from his family; he's spending Thanksgiving with strangers.   What he needs right now is for you to be his friend.
Okay Phoebe, we should probably go back now.
Stop it. Stop! Okay let's go. We can be strong.
Oh my god! Did you hear that? She said Monica! (She goes back to Clunkers again) Oooh, I can't leave her!
That's not gonna work.
Hey! I didn't know either.
Yeah, I knew.
Relax, Ross. She's not made of ice cream!
Hi, honey.
What? Why, why would...
That's right, she came back all by herself.
Oh yeah, I remember mine! Ohh, it was my sixth birthday, my dad took me to the park, I got it, and…it bent.
Did the girl ever let you ride it?
Making holiday candy for the neighbors.
I’m gonna hang this basket (Points to the one sitting on the table) on the door and when the neighbors walk by they can all take a piece.
See? This is exactly why I’m making this candy. We can learn their names and get to know our neighbors.
Where you can make out with your assistant.
Oh yeah, what’s the plan?
Wow! It took you all night to come up with that plan?!
Did you two…
Matt Guire, Mark Lynn, Ben Wire…
Okay.
The basket is totally empty! My God, the neighbors ate all the candy!
Joey!!
Did you eat all the neighbor candy?!
They love my candy? Oh man!!! I’ve gotta go make more!! (Starts to do so.)
Ross! The neighbors ate all my candy!!
(turning a light on) Who is that?!
Hi. Do you know what time it is?
Oh please! (To Chandler) Did you hear that? Little drops of heaven.
Umm, listen I am sorry, but I’ll put some out first thing in the morning.
Um-hmm.
Ross! That is so sweet of you to get Phoebe that bike! When I heard the story, I almost cried.
Oh yeah! I saw her walkin’ it down the street the other day. She had uh, these flowers in the basket. It was so cute.
Umm, can we see you ride it?
See, this is why I told you never get involved with your assistant! And there is no such thing as keeping secrets when it comes to affairs. (To Chandler) Did you hear that Chandler? No such thing!
I’m sorry, I can’t help you. See? (Points to her new sign.) Rules are rules.
No kidding, out of towners huh? What did you tell ‘em?
Some people have been saying its y’know little drops of heaven, but whatever.
(still talking to the woman) All right, I’ll do it just this once! But you can’t tell anybody!
(closing the door) It’s unbelievable! I-I can’t believe that sign didn’t work!
Hmm?
But they like it!
Maybe.
Oh, you really want to talk about getting people to like you huh, funny man? (Joey laughs but stops when Chandler turns to glare at him.)
Well, they’re just gonna have to wait aren’t they? I’ve only got two hands!!
No! You don’t know the system! There’ll be nobody messing with the system!
(opening the door and frantically) Okay, guys! The candy is coming; I just need another 15 minutes for the chocolate to cool!
(To Chandler) Thank you.
Did you smoke?
I’m fine now, but it was really scary there for a while. I mean, someone slipped a-a threatening note under the door.
Betrothed… (Corrects him)
(Offering Ross the skull) Licorice?
Are you gonna dress up as Santa?
No.
About a half an hour.
No.
Bing's weird.
Hey!
Ahh, Phoebe, I'm gonna miss you!
Phoebe, don't worry about it. I'm sure she wants to live with you.
Well, no. But, um, I bet she probably does.
I'm sorry. But not that sorry, 'cause you don't have to live with it. Um, we have a reservation under the name Chandler Bing.
(pulling Chandler away from the Maitre d') You need to give him money.
No, to get a table! Places like this are always shakin’ you down. Everybody wants to be paid off.
You've got to be smooth about it.
How did it go?
It's easy! Just keep it casual! Give him a kind word, shake his hand and give him the money!
I don't know.
We'd be eating our soup right now.
(sees two people exit) Okay, those people just left, come on! Quick! Give him the money and get their table!
It's not just the drum noise. Every five minutes, Joey throws his sticks in the air, and I have to hear, "Oh my eye! Oh god, my eye!" I mean, it is so annoying.
Phoebe, you got Joey drums to annoy Rachel, so she wouldn't wanna live there anymore?
What happened to Santa, Holiday Armadillo?
Wow, come in, have a seat. You must be exhausted coming all the way from…Texas.
Because Armadillos also wandered in the desert?
Come on Ben.
Okay Ben, why don't you come open some more presents, and Santa, the Armadillo, and I have a little talk in the kitchen? There's a sentence, I never thought I'd say.
(to Chandler) Hey, you think, you can keep it another night? (She has a really teasing look on her face and keeps twirling Chandler's beard.)
Yes, is that okay?
No.
What are you talking about?
You were invited?!
My God, I can’t believe this! I mean I knew that mom and dad were invited, but I thought that was it! I mean from the ages 7 to 9 Frannie and I were inseparable!

Yeah, well you call her and tell her that y’know when we were kids her precious little Frannie tried to undress me several times, okay? And if I hadn’t have stopped her, there probably wouldn’t even be a wedding to go to.
Joey, that paper’s like a year old!
Hey.
Limited seating?! (Screechingly) I am just one tiny person!
(disgusted) Limited seating! Oh, that is such a lame excuse! That’s not the reason she’s not inviting me!
Joan?
Wait a minute, you got Ross Gellar and guest?! I wasn’t invited and you got "and guest?!"
Wait a minute, y’know, you’re bringing me!
Why not?!
Because! She’s my cousin. I mean, we grew up together! We’re family y’know? Well that’s important to me.
(laughs) We’ll see.
David who?
Phoebe, can I talk to you for a second?
What are you doing?
So! He’ll understand!
God, you are so strong.
Limited seating my ass. Let’s see who made the cut. (To the couple sitting to her right.) Hi!
I’m Monica Gellar. Who do you know the bride and groom?
Used to work with her. Used to! I’m a relative and I didn’t get invited! A blood relative! Blood!!
(to the couple on her left) So, how about you huh? How do you know the happy couple?
Okay, you’re fine.
Here’s Frannie. Hmm, won’t she be happy to see me? (Starts to get up and greet Frannie.)
Frannie was the one who found your Playboys and showed them to mom.
Am I doing here? Why? Surprised to see me? Ross brought me. How do you like that?!
You invite my brother, you invite my whole family, and not me?! Why?! What—Why wouldn’t you want me at your wedding? What could I have possibly done?! (Frannie’s husband walks up.) Stuart!
Oh wait I forgot my wrap.
(looking up) Ross, when’s this comet thing start?

Okay, we’ve been out here for two hours and we haven’t seen any stupid comets. Can we go now? I mean, Chandler’s getting chilly. (She walks over to where Chandler is bundled up in a big coat and shivering.)
She’s sleeping.
Deep Impact was the one with Robert Duval, Armageddon is what’s going to happen to you if you wake me up.
It is in the living room where there is also a light! And no one will kick you in the shin.
With a wok? (Chandler’s holding a wok.) I thought you were going to read my boring book to put you asleep.
Here, let me make the milk, I’m up anyway.
Okay that does sound like fun.
The second sister dies?!
The second sister dies in Archie and Jughead Double Digest?
Okay, here’s your milk. What do you want to talk about? (She sees that Chandler has fallen asleep and slams the door loudly to wake him up.)
Ohh! Ohhhh! Were you sleeping sweetie? I’m sorry. Here. (Hands the mug of milk to him.)
Are you still awake?
You do know that was me who just said that right? (He doesn’t respond and she turns on the light, waking him.) Hey. As long as we’re both up…
What?! What are you doing?!
Yeah. We-we had s*x and then we fell asleep.
Nooo! No, that’s not true. No, best time ever! Yeah, you rocked my world! (She turns out the light to go back to sleep.)
What?!
Okay. Okay, I’m ready. Come on big fella!
Give me the good stuff.
Okay, I’m up! I’m up!
That really was some of your best work.
I have to be up in seven minutes.
Really?!
Okay! You get the vacuum cleaner and I’ll get the furniture polish!
(entering, carrying a newspaper) Hey Ross! So, I was checking out the uh, real estate section…
Look at this. (Hands him the newspaper.)
I can’t believe mom and dad are selling the house!
Well, after 15 years of mom and dad keeping it as a shrine to you, it’s time the velvet ropes came down.
Oh please! Dad turned my room into a gym 20 minutes after I moved out! I gotta say, a tanning bed and a stack of Victoria’s Secret catalogues, not a gym!
As much as they love you?
Hey!
That was me and Ross.
Oh that’s a great idea. You’re really good on the phone.
Oh, that’s okay, I can’t wait to see everything again! All of the memories…
I used to love to play restaurant.
Hey, it is unreasonable to expect a child to wait for a light bulb to cook brownies! (She goes to the attic.)
Hey guys! Hey!
Hey, I just whipped us up some Easy Bake treats, they should be ready in about three days.
(wary) Okay. So, which boxes are mine?
Okay. (Starting to go through them) Oh! A coloring book! (Holding it up.)
(looking through it) Really? Wow! It looks like I had some trouble staying inside the lines.
(holding up a glove) Oh, an old glove?

Wow! Look at this! (Picking up a shirt.) I can’t believe I even fit into this shirt! (She holds it up and it reads: Tyrannosaurus Ross.) (She turns it around and looks at it.) Oh, this is yours. (Hands it to Ross.)

(holding up a small cowboy hat) This isn’t mine. (Sets it down and looks at the rest of the boxes.) Hey, this isn’t, this isn’t my stuff! Ugh, Ross! (Grabs and holds up a doll.) These are your boxes! Where are my boxes?
What?
Just mine?
So why-why wasn’t Ross’s stuff ruined? (Pause) And if you say the words medical marvel I’m going to Easy Bake your head!
So wait, Ross’s stuff is fine, but I have no memories because you wanted to keep the bottom two inches of your car away from water!!!
I can’t believe this! (Storms out.)

Oh, this terrible! Everything is destroyed! Look at this. (She picks up some kind of furry thing.) It obviously meant enough for me to save it, and I don’t even know what it is! Ohh, it’s still soft. (She rubs it against her cheek.) What do you think this is?
How do you think I am?! You’ve wrecked all my childhood memories. You love Ross more than me. And I just rubbed a dead mouse on my face!
(opening it) What’s this?
(shocked) What?!
Wait, you’re giving me your Porsche, you’re kidding me right?!
All right!
(entering) Hey guys!
Do you guys know what happened to Chandler’s barca lounger?
Are you kidding?! I get a Porsche and the barca lounger’s gone?! This is the best day ever! (Runs out.)
Happy birthday!!!
It’s your birthday!
Chocolate-chip pancakes!
They all came from the list you handed out to us two weeks ago.
Rach, you’re in a great place in your life. Come on, you’ve got a great job! Good friends…
Well, doing nothing on your thirtieth is better than doing something stupid, like Ross.
I can’t believe you bought this.
All right Rach, for what it’s worth, I think that you’re doing great. I mean y’know let’s face it, no one handles this well.
Weren’t you asked to leave sonny?
Heyyy!! You got the door open!! (Giggles.)

Nooo! (Giggles) Okay. (She tries to pull herself up by Rachel and Joey’s doorknob, but the door opens and she almost falls into the their apartment. She manages to catch herself.) Whoa! (Stands up, unsteadily) Okay. See I was, I was a little nervous about turning (whispering) thirty. (Giggles.) So the bus boys took me out for some drinks. (Pause) I wanna puke on you later!
Noo!!!
Noo!!
Oh no! My parents have never seen me drunk! (Pause) That they know of.
Really?! You promise?
Okay. I love you so much. (Kisses him.)
What about your breath?! (Breathes on him.)
Okay. I can do that.
Ross, just forget about it. This guy’s got you totally wedged in.
Yay!
(sees someone) Paul!
Phil!
Awwwww… (Giggles.)
All you had to do was buy the card!
Really! That long?! (Chandler slowly turns and looks at her.) (To Chandler) Look all you want, it’s happening!
You are so handsome! I wanna make love to you right here, right now! (Growls and pulls him into a kiss.)
I-I-I wanna thank you all for coming. My family and my friends…

I really like to say that I’m-um… (Pause) Y’know what I’d really like to say? I’m drunk!! (Mrs. Geller pulls the camera down.) That’s right mom and dad your little Harmonica is hammered!! (Ross grabs the camera out of his dad’s hands.) And guess what! I’ve been drunk before! And I’ve smoked a cigarette! And I got a box of Ding-Dongs hidden in my underwear drawer! It’s all okay. It’s okay because I turned thirty today. And, and I can do anything I want! Because I am a grown up. (Falls over sideways with Ross filming the fall.)
Phoebe, y’know why don’t we just go upstairs and have some birthday cake?
Oh man!
He’s gonna eat the cake!
I’m glad you’re here, we have a couple of things to ask you about the wedding ceremony.
Uh, so anyway, we thought one of you could read something during the ceremony.
Okay, so Ross will be doing the reading.
Do you mind telling us what it is?
What is DOOL?
Who are they killing off?
She’s my favorite character on DOOL.
And the way she slaps all the time!
Wouldn’t you love to do it just once?! (Raises her hand towards Chandler.)
What is that?
It sounds like it’s coming from across the street.
What?
Nooo!!
No, there is no way! It can not be Ross! (She looks through the window and sees Ross practicing and fumbling around with the pipes.) Unbelievable! Why is your family Scottish?!
He cannot play at our wedding! I mean everyone will leave! I mean come on, that is just noise! It’s not even a song!
Do you want some shortbread? Eh that’s Scottish like you are.
No! No-no they’re not. They’re still very angry! But y’know Chandler is also half-Swedish. You know what the Swedish people are famous for? Sitting down and being quiet.
(interrupting) You can not play bagpipes at the wedding!!
(entering with Rachel) Oh my God! It’s true!! Oh my God you are so amazing! Oh my God, can I just ask you to do me oh, just one favor?
Would you slap me? Would you slap me right here in the face?! (Points to her cheek.)
(breaks away) Oh wait, just one more thing! One more minute! (To Cecilia) Umm, you’re a stupid bitch.
Nice to meet you! My God you’re great!
What about the second minister we met with? I kinda liked him.
Come on! It wasn’t that bad!
All right, what about the third guy?
Can you blame him?
Well then we still have a problem.
Well, we’re trying to find someone to perform our wedding and they’re all either boring or annoying or y’know, can’t stop staring at the ladies. (Points to her chest.)
Phoebe, we’re getting married, married; not sixth grade married.
Are you serious?
We’re never gonna find anybody.
Joey look it’s really sweet…
That is true.
It might be kinda cool.
Hey Pheebs, how’s it going?
Oh, I’m sorry. Can I get you something?
Here, take a couple of these. (She gets up to grab a couple of pills.)
It’s Hexadrin.

Okay, while we’re waiting for these pills to kick in, I’m gonna sit you down on the couch. Come on. (Phoebe gets up and goes with her.) Get some nice soft pillows under your head, I’m gonna turn the TV on and you can watch whatever you want. And I’m—Sit down—(She sits down on the couch)—gonna make you some tea. And then, I’m gonna rub your feet.
Hexadrin. (She gets the box out of her purse.)
No Phoebe, those are like the side effects and stuff.
Y’know, the possible side effects.
Phoebe, relax none of that stuff ever happens! They just put it on there for legal reasons!
In case it happens.
You did it! You got ordained?!
Phoebe, your liver is right here. (She points to the right side of her torso.)
Yeah!
Phoebe, your face is fine! Come on, none of this stuff is going to happen to you! Stop being such a baby!
How about receiving?
It doesn’t say that!
There you go!
No that is not what happened with us. Well, I was umm, I was really sad that night because this guy thought that I was Ross’s mom.
And then Chandler was, was really sweet and he consoled me. And well we drank too much…
(standing outside) Cute PJ’s! You’re really livin’ it up here in London huh?
(entering) Is Joey here?
Wouldn’t you be?
Really?
Well, not anymore.
I know, I just thought it would be fun.
Drunk enough to know that I want to do this. Not so drunk that you should feel guilty about taking advantage.
Okay!
(breaking the kiss) Y’know what’s weird?
This doesn’t feel weird!
You’re a really good kisser.
Hm-hmm!
Wow! You are really fast!
We’re gonna see each other naked.
Do you wanna do it at the same time?
One!
Two!
Eh, we weren’t that close anyway!
Okay, can we change the topic? Because it’s really doing nothing for me.
What?!

Okay, fine but please don’t be upset! Okay? I was really depressed okay? And really drunk! I just wanted something stupid and meaningless. I just wanted…just s*x. So, when I…went to your room that night…I was actually looking…for Joey. (Joey smiles.)
No, because it-it didn’t seem important.
Noo!! The point is that is was you that was there that night! It is you that I am marrying! It is you that I fell in love with!
Chandler, please! Do you know how unbelievably glad I am that Joey was not there that night?!
Wait Chandler come on, let’s—it’s not a big deal!
Hey-hey.
Yeah baby! (Phoebe and Joey nod.)
Honey! Dinner’s ready!
Your favorite!
Yep! And lot’s of it!
Okay, in we go.
So the wedding caterer sent me this list of twelve appetizers and I have to narrow it down to six.
Chandler.
I will.
No, I’ll do it. You just stick to your job.
There were only twelve.
What are peanut butter fingers?!
This is it. Yeah, this is the one. I can’t believe I found it!
Well I’m Monica Geller, ball like a baby.
Have you found your dress yet?

No, I can’t afford this either. No. I-I-I’m, I’m just here to figure out which one I want then I’m gonna get it at Kleinman’s, this discount place in Brooklyn, day after tomorrow they are having a huge sale.
Yeah! So-so when are you getting married?
Oh May 15th.
Yeah!
Jeffery.
The best man? Wow!
Oh, my fiancee wants the Swing Kings.

All right, listen up. There is usually only one dress in each size so when they open those doors, fan out. Now, this is what you’re looking for! (Holds up a picture of it.) Memorize it! When you locate the dress, blow on these. All right? (She passes out whistles to them.) Three short blasts. When you hear it, come running.
All right.
(To Rachel) Hey! Don’t be a baby!

No. No. Not it. Not it. Not it. (Checks another rack and another woman tries to reach around her.) (To the woman) Don’t crowd me! (Finds it) This is it! This is the dress! Oh my God, it’s perfect! (She takes it off of the rack and someone has a hold of it on the other side of the rack and tugs on it.) I’m sorry, this one’s taken! (The other woman tugs harder pulling Monica through the rack.) Whoa!
Megan!
You came?!
This is my dress!
Yes it is! You saw me wearing it!
What? You freak! You wouldn’t even have known about this place if it wasn’t for me!
Maybe I do! I’m pretty feisty! (She blows the signal.)
(handing Phoebe the dress) Go! Go! Go!
NOW!!!!!!!! (Rachel runs off and Monica gets up to follow her.)
Oh…
Hello? (Listens) What?! (Listens) You what?! (Listens) Hey you listen here missy! (Listens) Wh—(She is hung up on.)
That was that girl Megan! She booked the Swing Kings on the day of our wedding and said that I couldn’t have them back unless I gave her the dress!
What am I gonna do?! That is the dress! That is the dress! Wh…Chandler wants the band. What do I do?
How?
Phoebe, he’s gotta be in the room for that to work.
Well umm, we were just talking about the y’know, the Swing Kings and just wondering whether y’know, they were the right way to go.
Oh crap!
(from the bedroom) Don’t come in here!
No! We only mess around at his place!
No, I’m wearing a wedding dress.
Yeah but I’m not keeping it.
Oh. I guess you can. Okay but; I-I have to return it, so you can’t like it.
Really?
Oh because it doesn’t…really fit. Oh by the way, I-I booked the Swing Kings.
Okay! But you can’t rip it. Well, maybe a little.
(entering) Hey guys! Do you wanna look at the song list for the wedding? (They ignore her.) Guys?
Alright, what’s going on?
I’m sorry. I’m sorry. I-I should probably leave you girls alone. (She heads for the bedroom.)
Joey!
Congratulations! Wow! I can’t believe you’re nominated for an Emmy!
Oh Soap Opera Digest award!
Honey? Is that something you’re making up?
(to Joey) Okay, I’ll go!
Really? (Looks.) My God, he’s really cute.
Phoebe, I’m engaged!
Op, can I just tell you something? Very flattered but umm, I’m engaged. (Points to her ring.)
Well you should be embarrassed. (Leaves.)
Hey! How’d your date go with Jake?
Okay, stop it Phoebe, you’re getting me all tingly.
And did he?
Okay-okay, I got it. I got it.
Oh, I haven’t had that feeling since I first started going out with Chandler. Wow, I’m never gonna have that feeling again am I?

No, a guy would be saying, "I’m never gonna get to sleep with anyone else." Oh my God! I’m never gonna get to sleep with anyone else! I’ve been so busy planning the wedding that I forgot about all the things that I’d be giving up! I mean, I…I’m never gonna have a first kiss again.
Phoebe, it’s okay. You don’t have to tip toe around me. I-I’ve been thinking about it and umm, y’know what? I’m okay about not having that new relationship feeling…

See? That’s what I mean. I mean that, that’s great! But I wouldn’t trade in what I have for that. I mean I’m gonna be with Chandler for the rest of my life, and that’s what makes me happy. (Chandler approaches.) Hey sweetie, come here! Come sit down. Hey Phoebe and I were just talking about how our relationship is deep and meaningful. It really is don’t you think?
Have you seen Chandler?
‘Cause I just keeping thinking about all these things that I’m not gonna have and it’s freaking me out. I don’t know what to do about it.
Phoebe! Come on I’m serious! I just got to talk to him about all this.
Why?
You gotta help me out here Pheebs.
So I’m not supposed to share my doubts and fears with the guy I’m gonna spend the rest of my life with?
Your mother told you this?
The woman that got married a bunch of times and killed herself when you were 13?
Honey, as we get closer to the wedding, is there anything that you would like to talk about or share?
You’re wrong! The centerpieces are fine! Do you ever get scared at all?
Doesn’t it ever just freak you out that-that you’re never gonna be with anybody new again?
Just, I love you so much. Just…It’s just sometimes it bothers me that I’m never gonna have that feeling. Y’know when you meet someone for the first time and it’s new and exciting? Y’know that rush?
Okay, but all right you’re a guy, does it not freak you that you’re never gonna sleep with anybody else?
Even with me?
Really?

Come here! Come here! (They hug.) Sweetie you don’t have to worry. No, besides y’know what? I’m gonna have a lot of new things with you. The first time we buy a house. Our first kid. Our first grandkid…
What was it for?
Wow!
Yeah. But a part of me also can’t wait ‘til it’s over. Chandler and I have this pact not to have s*x again until the wedding.
Hey Phoebe, will you give me a hand?
I gotta make up the guest bedroom. (To Ross) Hey, Cousin Cassie is coming to stay with us for a few days.
Uh-hmm.
Ross, she’s 25 years old.
Hey!
Subtle guys!
I know you’re planning my surprise bridal shower.
Okay. Sorry. (She goes into the guest bedroom.)
Hey! What did you decide to do about the movie?
That’s what you say about p0rn.
No! No you should! A lot of major actors do nude scenes! I mean, the chance to star in a movie? Come on!
Plus, everyone’s gonna see your thing. (Giggles.)
Hey!
Oh boy, me too!
Yeah?
The wedding is off, sloppy and immature!
Okay. (They both jump up to head for their room, but Monica stops.) But wait, we can’t. My Cousin Cassie is in the guest room, we’re supposed to have lunch.
Shrill?! The wedding is back on!
So, are you ready to go?
(catching him) Chandler!
(To Ross) Cassie needs to stay at your place.
Because Purvy Perverson over here can’t stop staring at her.
You were staring about eight inches south of there.
She looks exactly like Aunt Marilyn.
Wafer thin ice!
So to get this part you can’t be?
But you are?
But you told them you weren’t?
Wow! Wow! And it’s definitely all gone? There’s nothing there to work with? (Joey glares at her.) What were you thinking?
Joey! This is not like learning to ride a horse! This is like learning to…grow a turtleneck!
Oh my God, what are you gonna do?!
Unless!
Well, this may sound crazy, but there maybe something we could fashion.
Well I’m not sure yet, but umm, off the top of my head I’m thinking double sided tape and some sort of luncheon meat.
(entering) Hey!
Well uh, I’m trying to make something for Joey. Do you mind if I raid your fridge?
Okay. (Opens the fridge.) All right, turkey. Eh, that won’t work. Cheese? (Picks it up) That won’t work. Olive loaf? (Picks it up) I hope that won’t work.
No it’s umm, more like a wrap. Okay so uh, I’m gonna go guys.
I guess you can get back to deciding on what to get me for a present! (Runs out.)
Okay, we have a lot of options here, a number of prototypes for you to try on.
Yeah! Okay, this one is a mushroom cap. (Points to it.) Umm, this one is made of bologna. (Points.)
Oh, just until the glue dries.
(to a whole group) Now, these are-are more realistic, but perishable.
Okay? (To a different group) Over here we have pink suede, which is nice. But umm, if it gets wet then you know it’s gonna shrink.

I also, did a little something in fur. But umm, that’s really just for me. (Rubs it against her cheek.) Okay. So, why don’t you go into your room and try these on and we’ll see—get a better idea of what’s gonna work.
Toothpick?
What are you trying on now?
And?
Joey!
What?! Which one?!
Phoebe! Rachel! It’s Monica! I wonder what you could possibly need me for on such short notice! (She bursts into the apartment to find only Phoebe and Rachel sitting on the couch.) Oh.
For what?
You al-you already had it?
Well no, wait a minute, that’s not true! No, what did, that was really sweet. And it kinda works out for the best.
Well now, I get to spend my shower with the only people I really love! I mean, I get all those presents (Motions to the pile in the corner) without having to talk to people I don’t even like!
Wait a minute, she isn’t… She’s not the one who you…
Wow!
(To Joey) They were lovers.

(telling Chandler the seating arrangement) Okay, so this is where the band is. (Points.) And this is where the bar is. (Points) And all these pins have people’s names on them. (She has pins to show the seating at each of the tables.) And Rach, here you are. (Points to Rachel’s place.)
(To Chandler) Okay, the red ones are my guests and the blue ones are yours.
Chandler, relax it’s not a contest. (To Rachel) Certainly not a close one.
Okay, I think that’s it. The seating chart is done. This is our wedding. They all look like they’re having fun don’t they?
Oh! (Gets up) Let’s see, well…if this is the wedding hall then umm (Walks away) you’re parents will be at home in Queens.
Why would they think they’re invited?
Joey!
Ross’s parents are my parents!
Oh please, you just want more blue pins.
All right, all right. Maybe I can fit them in if I just do some rearranging. But uh, Rachel may actually have to sit at the bar!

Hey. Oh good-good you’re here! All right, I figured it out. I’m gonna take two tables of eight, I’m gonna add your parents, and I’m gonna turn them into three tables of six. Okay? And I called the caterer; I added two extra meals, we are good to go!
(looking at him) What?!
Oh that’s too bad. It’s true, but too bad.
Oh Joey!
No she hasn’t.
Well, what am I going to say?

(on phone) Hello? (Listens) Yeah, hi! Mrs. Tribbiani? (Listens) Hi, this is Monica Geller. (Listens) Yeah I’m just calling to say that Chandler and I uh, really hope you can make it to the wedding. Yeah, apparently a bunch of invitations that we sent weren’t delivered. Umm, I guess there was some screw up at the damn post office! (Joey nods his approval.) (Listens) T-Tell me about it! (Listens) Yeah, yeah, the US Post Office? No, more like US lost office! (Listens) What, are they Irish?! (Joey gives her a thumbs up.)
Well, he did manage to keep his identity secret for a long time.
What are you talking about?! 007 has all those gadgets!
007 has a fancy car!
007 gets all the ladies.
How about you go put on your 007 tuxedo and I’ll make you a nice martini.
How about a Youhoo with a funny straw?
Hey.
The show?!
Have you ever been to one of my weddings?
The wedding starts at six.
You’ll vamp?!
You just carry that around?
Between you and…
A little tight? I could see double-oh and seven in those pants.
All right that’s it, I give up! Whatever you want you can have it! You wanna sing a song? You wanna do a dance? You want your mom to stand at the altar and scream racial slurs? I don’t care!
(defeated) Oh.
Do you realize that four weeks from today we’re getting married? Four weeks baby!! Four weeks!!!
There’s still so much to do. Have you written your vows yet?
Sweetie, you know I have no sense of humor when it comes to the wedding.
No! But I know exactly what I’m going to say.
(handing him a pad of paper and a pen) Let’s just do it right now. Okay? It won’t be hard. Just say what’s in your heart. (She goes back, sits down, and starts feverishly writing.)
You have to help me! I’m supposed to be writing my vows and all I have is this! (Shows them what she’s been working on.)
Thank you.
Those are my eyes! Those are my breasts. (Points.)
Ennnh.
Ooh, are we allowed to lie in the vows?!
Now everybody knows the basic erogenous zones. (She starts labelling them) You got one, two three, four (Chandler is shocked to find out there’s more than three), five, six, and seven!
It’s kind of an important one!

All right. Umm, you could uh start out with a little 1, a 2, a 1-2-3, 3, 5, a 4, a 3-2, 2, a 2-4-6, 2-4-6, 4, (Rachel starts getting worked up) 2, 2, 4-7, 5-7, 6-7, 7 …7..…7…7-7-7-7-7-7-7-7-7-7-7-7…(mouths 7)! (They both lean back on the couch satisfied.)
No fair. I don't even have one. How come they get two?
Oh yeah? When?
Why won't I be married when I'm 40?
Ok, hypothetically, why won't I be married when I'm 40?
What is it? Is there something fundamentally unmarriageable about me?
Well?
(Comes up for below the covers and looks concerned.) Do you think he knew I was here? (Chandler quickly looks at Monica not knowing what to say.)
Wait, wait, wait! (She puts a Shriner's hat on the turkey.)
Look! (She puts a big, yellow pair of sunglasses on the bird.)
I bet this will work! (She starts dancing and Chandler cracks up.)
What?
You said you loved me! I can't believe this!
Yes, you did!
You love me!
Then all your stuff would be here.
Then you’d be going back and forth all the time, I mean it doesn’t make any sense.
You wanted it to be a surprise.
Chandler… In all my life… I never thought I would be so lucky. (Starting to cry.) As to…fall in love with my best…my best… There’s a reason why girls don’t do this!
Yes.
Come in! Come in! (Joey, Rachel, and Phoebe burst through the door.) We’re engaged!!!
Chicken? I could eat some chicken.
Yes, but you cannot tell anyone! No one knows!
Please? Please?! We just don't want to deal with telling everyone, okay? Just promise you won't tell.
(on phone) I can't wait to be with you!  I'll just tell Rachel I'm gonna be doing laundry for a couple of hours.
(on phone) Awww, y'know what your nickname is, Mr. Big…
Bye!
Actually, I did!
Ohhh, oh my God! Oh my God! She knows about us!
Them?! Who's them?
Joey!
Oh man, they think they are so slick messing with us! But, see, they don't know that we know that they know! So…
She's bluffing!
You go back out there, and you seduce her till she cracks!
Of course.
I love you too, Chandler. (They kiss.)
Well actually, Ross doesn't.
Oh, that's Nana, right there in the middle. (Reads the back) 'Me and the gang at Java Joe's'.
Let's see, 1939... yeah, 24, 25?
Hey, you guys!
Oh that’s so sweet.
Yeah, I don’t hear Chandler’s and he doesn’t hear mine.
Chandler!!
Hey!
Yeah, well he’s my brother! And plus he drives so slow he could never hurt it.
Whatever Ross! Just replace the bulbs in the brake lights after you’re done.
Nice work everybody! So much for the y’know, "You can drive it, but don’t tell Rachel" plan!
Great! Well Rachel, the reason why I won’t let you drive the Porsche is because you’re a terrible driver. There! That wasn’t about the wedding.
Chandler, we still haven’t gotten an RSVP from your dad.
Chandler! He’s your father; he should be at the wedding.
Well what are you gonna do when he finds out he wasn’t even asked?!
So what! As long as he’s not wearing a white dress and a veil I don’t care.
Here! (She sets a bag down in front of him.)
It’s your suitcase. We’re going to Las Vegas.
We’re going to Las Vegas to see your dad. It’s time you two talked, and I want to get to know my father-in-law.
No you didn’t. Oh and honey, just so you know, now that you’re marrying me, you don’t get to win anymore.
Chandler, look I-I know that your dad embarrassed you. I know…
Hey, the point is that he was at every one of your swim meets and he was there cheering you on! Okay? That’s a, that’s a pretty great dad.
Who’s Mr. Garibaldi?
Chandler, you’re not fourteen anymore. Okay? Maybe it’s time that you let that stuff go. If your father’s not at your wedding…you’re gonna regret it for the rest of your life.
Yes!
How much did ever really win before?
Uh oh yeah, she did. Uh, he did. (To Chandler) She? (To the waiter) I’m-I’m sorry I’m new. I don’t…
I still say that if we had called your dad we coulda gotten better seats.
Why not?!
What?!
That can’t be your father.
What?
Relax! You’ll be fine. (Chandler exhales and turns off the table light.) Oh much better. You’re invisible now.
Can we have our drinks please?! Waiter—Uh, tress!
I’m-I’m Monica.
New York.
(looks at Chandler) In…in two weeks.
(To Chandler) You okay?
Do you realize this is probably the last time we’ll all be here in the coffee house as six single people?
Old?
That’s much better.
We’re gonna pick up the wedding dress, then we’re gonna have lunch with mom. (Joey stands up.)
I’m making a list of all the things that are most likely to go wrong at the wedding. Now, that way I can be prepared.
Well, so far I have uh, my bridesmaids' dresses won’t get picked up, my veil gets lost, or I don’t have my something blue.
I had to go with the odds Rach.
That other play?
Wait! Wait! Wait! You can’t start today! Today’s the rehearsal dinner!
Oh. Well then way to go, you big movie star!
Who did we fight in World War I?
Honey, we gotta go!
(laughs) I don’t have anything like that, but let me go see if Rachel does.
Hey, do you realize that at this time tomorrow we’ll be getting married?
I just, I can’t believe that we made it!
I’m sorry but…nothing.
Well…honestly ever since we got engaged I have been waiting for something to.. to flip you out.
Really?
Ohh, I’m so glad. Thank you so much for staying so calm during this. I mean it’s really, it’s made me stay calm. (Chandler just looks at her.) I coulda been worse!

(voice on answering machine) Hi! If you’re calling before Saturday, you’ve reached Monica and Chandler. But if you’re calling after Saturday, you’ve reached Mr. and Mrs. Bing! Please leave a message for the Bings!
Hey Maureen! (They hug.) Gosh! Hey uh, Chandler? This is my cousin Maureen.
What is that?
Mrs. Bing? Here, these are my parents umm, Judy and Jack Geller.
Dad! There’s Ross (points), why don’t you go talk to him?
Hi Mr.…Bing.
It-it’s so great to see you both here.
Oh, Rach! Rach! Umm hey, could you do me a favor and would you talk to Chandler’s dad and try to keep him away from Chandler’s mom?
He is the man in the black dress.
All right, I’m gonna go steam my wedding dress okay? Who wants the responsibility of making sure nothing happens to it?
Who wants it? Anybody?
Nobody wants to do it? All right, I’ll do it myself.
Y’know what? You’re right, I’m sorry. Actually you were a big help tonight. Yeah, and thanks for putting my grandmother in the cab and making sure she got to the hotel safely.
Okay. Sorry. (Monica goes into the bathroom.)

(entering from her room, excitedly) I’m getting married today!!! (She trips and falls.) (Getting up) I think I just cracked a rib. But I don’t care because today’s my wedding day! My day is finally here!! (Runs back into her room.)
(re-entering) I’m gonna start getting ready! (Goes back into her room.)
Hey! Okay, so I thought we’d start with my make up and then do my hair.
About what?
Yeah you will! The right guy is just around the corner! Okay, are we done with that?
Any woman would be lucky to have ya.
(jumping up) Rachel! You okay?
(interrupting) The days and nights are hard! I get it! Okay? Look umm, Rachel I’m sorry! I have to start getting ready! I’m getting married today!
(getting up) I’m gonna go put my make-up on, we have to be at the hotel in an hour! (Starts for the bathroom.)
What?!
I can’t go to lunch!!
(entering) What’s going on?
Okay, you’re-you’re really freaking me out.
How can that be?! Oh wait! Wait! Are you, are you serious?!
Oh wow! Okay. Don’t scare me like that okay? I mean for a minute there I was like, "Oh my God! The worst has happened!"
I wanna wear this everyday.
(starting to cry) I’m so happy for me.
I know! Hey, how’s Chandler doin’?
Are you okay?
Well, you’re-you’re sweating.
Oh that’s sweet. Don’t touch me.
She’s right there.
Not now.
(To Chandler) Who is this?
(To Rachel) He took off?

Chandler, for so long I…I wondered if I would ever find my prince, my soul mate. Then three years ago, at another wedding I turned to a friend for comfort. And instead, I found everything that I’d ever been looking for my whole life. And now…here we are…with our future before us…and I only want to spend it with you, my prince, my soul mate, my friend. Unless you don’t want to. You go!
I do.
What baby?
We have a baby?
I didn’t take a pregnancy test.
Okay.
Guys! I’m not pregnant.
You didn’t tell anybody I was did you?!
(To Joey) Oh, about that. Joey, you have to change before the party.
Find some! Please! Anything that doesn’t say I-I died tragically in France. (Joey leaves to find clothes.)
Because I’m not.
What are you talking about?
Wait a minute! So you told people I was pregnant?! (Flash) Does this look like a conversation that I want to remember?!
Yeah!
Why?!
Phoebe, come on, you have to tell us.
Honey, I’m going to put my hand in your pocket!
No.
What?!
Oh that is so sweet!
Yes.
What’s the matter?
Well, are you going to be able to do this?
Well, the good news is, I don’t think anyone’s looking at us.
(seeing him) Oh sweet Lord.
Honey, I’m not even going to pretend I was listening. (Sees someone else.) Hey! Hey! (Goes over to that person.)
Can you believe Phoebe got pregnant?!
This is so huge.
Of course not nothing is. Between me and you…
…in this day and age how dumb do you have to be to get pregnant?
How?
Well I-I talked to and uh, she’s definitely going to have this baby. Y’know, she said she was gonna raise it on her own.
Maybe. I just hope she realizes how hard it’s gonna be.

Well, there’s a lot to think about. I mean, how is she, how is she going to handle this financially? How is she going to juggle work? Does she realize she’s not going to have a date again for the next eighteen years?
Are you okay?
Oh really?!
(interrupting) Rachel’s really the one who’s pregnant.
How do you feel?
Yes! Maybe it’s a false positive. Are you sure you peed on the stick right?
You-you gotta take it now. Come on, do it as a present to me.
Okay.
Oh, wait a minute! Who’s is the father?!
Oh, come on it’s my wedding! That can be my present.
Hey, are you ready to get back on the dance floor?
Ohh come on, I love this song! Come on, you’ll be fine. (She starts to walk towards the floor.)

Oh sweetie, you can never embarrass me. (Chandler grunts.) Okay, you can easily embarrass me. But come on, it doesn’t matter. All right? I married you! So I want to dance on my wedding night with my husband. Come on. (They go onto the floor.) Just try not to move your feet at all. (Chandler starts to get into the groove and bust a move.) There you go.
(entering) Did I miss it? (Phoebe nods no.) Rachel, I-I want you to know that, if it’s positive, we’re gonna…
Go ahead Rach.
Well… Well, great.
Oh God…
Are you really gonna do this?
(depressed) That’s right. I’m no longer a bride. I’ll never be a bride again. Now, I’m just someone’s wife!
Oh yeah, right. (Rolls her eyes.)
That’s not ‘til Thursday.
They won’t be ready for weeks.
That’s true! (Happily) I knew I married you for a reason!
Okay.
Ross has never checked out of a room a minute before he had to.
Oh thanks. (Reading the bill) Champagne, strawberries…Oh my God! I can’t believe Chandler ordered p0rn on our wedding night!
Hey!

No! (Pause) But, they’re callin’ out to me! I mean this little guy (Holds up a small one) even crawled up into my lap. Oh come on, Chandler wouldn’t mind if I opened just one present! What do you think it is?
A tiny salt shaker!!!
Oh wow! Okay. Well that was fun.
Good. Okay, I’m just gonna wait for Chandler to open the rest of them.
Whew. Although y’know, this is part of a salt and pepper set. I mean… I guess y’know it may just count as a half a present. What do you think?
Or this one! (She grabs and starts to open the biggest present.)
Hey, how are you feelin’? Any morning sickness?
No! Joey and Ross don’t know anything and Chandler still thinks that Phoebe’s pregnant.
Wow. Y’know it is so weird. I mean, you’re gonna tell this guy today and he has no idea what’s gonna happen.
What was that bam?
Who’s David Lynn?

No! No! I shouldn’t have even opened these! I mean I—Joey I am out of control!! Joey, you have to do me a favor. No matter what I say, no matter what I do, please do not let me open another present! Okay?
Give me one more.
Oh my God! Joey!
You can’t marry him!
Phoebe!
She’s not pregnant. It’s Rachel. Rachel’s the one who’s pregnant.
Phoebe I think he would notice if you didn’t have a baby in nine months!
There’s a dude?
People have got to finish their stories!
(throwing up the last present) I don’t know how any of these got opened?!
I know! I know! I am a terrible person! I mean, Chandler is never going to trust me with anything ever again!
Yeah. What is that?
Hey! How’d it go?
So are you ever gonna tell whoever it is?
What?!
Great! We’re hangin’ in the kitchen! (She drags him into the kitchen and turns his back to the living room) Let’s stay in the kitchen!
Wow! That is a great picture!
Yeah! Oh and interesting because I found the cameras in one of our bags! (Throws them into his chest.)
That would be a good idea.
You kissed another woman!
Okay! (They high-five and he walks out.)
Yeah I am!
That’s right. Get it out of your system while we’re alone.
Oh no, I already packed. The only thing I couldn’t find though was your Speedo.
Hey!
Thank you.
This is so great! And I’m gonna be your baby’s aunt!
Yeah, but I’m the only one related by blood.
Well, what were you gonna say?
Hey! Good luck!
Well I guess there is no harm in telling you now, Rachel and Ross are gonna have a baby.
I didn’t think you could keep it a secret.
They’re kissing let’s just go around them.
I’m in love too! But in an orderly fashion.
(to the couple) Hi! Can you do that and walk? ‘Cause she said, "Next."
(To Chandler) Did you hear that?! They bumped them up to first class because they are on their honeymoon! Come on! Let’s act like we’re on our honeymoon.
Grab my ass!
Hi, sorry. I almost didn’t hear you, because y’know I’m just so in love with my new husband. We’re on our honeymoon.
Oh no, you see we’re on our honeymoon. So umm, can you do your little thing and bump us up to first class?
You see, if we’d gone around them like I said, we—She would’ve given us those tickets. Damnit!
Look at that! Look at that! They’re going into the first class lounge! Do you know what they have in there?
Me neither! We have to get in! (She runs through the door with Chandler in tow.)
Oh my God! Oranges!
Fine. (Starts to walk away then she runs over and grabs an orange before she exits.) Go! Go! Go!
I can’t believe we’re here.
What? (Monica sees the first couple and gasps.)
No!! You have been screwing us all day!
Yeah! You already got the first class tickets; you got the lounge! I mean we should get free stuff too! I mean you’re not the only ones on your honeymoon!
What? Are you serious?! (To Chandler) Joey smells gas!
Well do something! Get in there!
Yeah! Do that!
No! (Pause) Are you doing it?! I don’t hear anything! Come on!
You’re really sticking with the shell necklace huh? (Points to necklace of shells he’s wearing.)
Hi sweetie!
Oh, so much fun. But the best part is, we met this incredible couple on the way back.
No, they were really cool. They were on their honeymoon too!
Yeah, can we go call them? Is it too soon to call? I wanna call.
I know.
This is different! Greg and Jenny are in a relationship.
We didn’t get anything for anyone.
That you can have.
It was great! It was great! How about you?! I mean you’re having a baby!
Oh great! (Shows them the picture.)
All right, so now that Ross knows can you tell us y’know how it happened? I mean, when did it happen? How many times did it happen?
Do you still wanna call ‘em? I wanna call ‘em.
(on phone) Hello? (Listens) Eighth street deli?
(on phone) Uh sorry, wrong number. (Hangs up)
(on phone) Hello? (Listens) (To All) It’s the deli again!
(hangs up) I don’t think this number’s right!
What?! People don’t do that!
They gave us a fake number? Why? Why would they do that?
And you’ve never been funnier. Joke, joke, joke, you were a hoot!
Yeah, definitely.
I still don't get why Greg and Jenny would give us a fake number.
Okay, maybe people give out fake numbers, but they don’t give out fake names.
I know! Although, you did tell an awful lot of jokes.
(rolling her head from side to side) Joke. Joke. Blah! Blah! (Joey and Phoebe laugh.)
What about my questions?
Oh, I’m sorry. Was that another joke?
Hell yeah!!!
(taking Rachel’s hand) Sweetie okay. It’s okay. Everybody made it to the wedding. I’m fine.
I know.
You used the Europe story!

(on phone) Hello Greg? (Listens) Hi, this is Monica from the plane? Listen, the number that you gave me 853-5… (Listens) (To Chandler) That is their old number! Jenny’s been giving it out since they moved!

(on phone) Hey listen umm, how would you like to get together? Say next Saturday? (Listens) Okay, how about Sunday? (Listens) Okay umm, the week after that? (Listens) The week after that? (Listens) Y’know what Greg? Y’know what? We are good, interesting, funny people with good questions and if you and your precious Jenny can’t see that then… (Listens) January 15th? (Chandler dances.) We’ll see you then! (Listens) Okay!
Okay, now this one is rare, this one is medium well! Now go-go-go! (Phoebe enters) Hey Phoebe!
Hey how was dinner?!
Okay!
Okay!
Uh Tim? This is Phoebe. Phoebe this is Tim, my new sous chef.
Hey Tim? I need a calamari and a Caesar salad. And umm, could you get me the pesto?
All right, I still need a calamari and a Caesar salad.

All right, all right! Let’s just cut to the chase, okay? (To Phoebe) You’re single. (To Tim) You’re single. (To Phoebe) He gets off work at eleven. (To Tim) She’ll be waiting for your call. (To Phoebe) I’ll give him your number if I can get one calamari and one Caesar salad!! (Everyone in the kitchen stops.) I did not yell. I am not putting a dollar in the jar.
Hi!
I…I have to fire him.
Because he’s terrible! Okay, he’s slow, he burns things, last night he lit my pastry chef on fire!
Well, now she has no eyebrows, mission accomplished.
(thinks about it) All right, but if-if he lights someone else on fire he is out of there!
I paid to have this done.
Hey. Okay, I gave him another chance, but Tim has got to go!
