(To Joey) Yeah I know—I’m good—I got it! (Joey slowly backs away.) (To the boy) Now wait a minute, I’ve got one more thing I have to say to you…oh right! Shut up!
No! Wait no! Shut up—I mean don’t cry! Let me get my checkbook! (Grabs her checkbook and runs after him.)
Hey! Well, I had to give the kid fifty bucks to stop crying.
No, I also had to go to a couple houses with him as his girlfriend. Oh, I am just awful with children!
Really? You think that’s all it is?
Wow! What did he do?
I can’t. I’m busy. I’m apartment hunting.
Yeah, I can’t live with Joey once the baby comes. I don’t want my child’s first words to be, (in a baby’s voice) "How you doin’?"

Well, I haven’t discussed it with him yet, but I know he’s gonna be relieved. Last week, he brought this girl over and I started talking to her about morning sickness and then I showed her pictures from my pregnancy book.
Not so much.
Oh my God! Was she old? Does she have a view?
Yeah that would really be great.
Well can we see it?! Oh maybe we shouldn’t. I mean if she just died this morning out of respect.
Shall we?
And I’m Rachel, an admirer of the building.
Ahh.
So she’s really not dead.
Hmm. Do you think—Could you tell me if she’s hanging in, in a one bedroom or a two?
Hey!
How was the game?
Oh.
Oh yeah! Hopefully across the street if certain Dutch people would just let go.
Oh but Joey, I have to go. There’s no room for a baby here.

Honey, it’s not just a matter of where you put it. I mean a baby changes everything. They cry all the time. I mean imagine bringing home some girl and trying to score when there’s a screaming baby around.
Honey, it’s so sweet that you want me to stay, but I-I can’t do that to you. I mean it would disrupt your entire life.
I know.
I do too a little bit.
Hi!
You gave them to me!
All right, I took them. But I figured it would be okay because you got a big ink stain on the crotch.
What bra?
You mean the one that you’re wearing? (Adjusts Monica’s pink bra strap as Monica looks down her shirt.)
What is this?
You’re so sweet. (Notices something in the crib.) Oh my God! And you gave the baby Hugsy! (A stuffed penguin wearing a ski jacket, goggles, and hat.)
But Joey the baby is going to be crying, it’s going to be loud.
It’s gonna be up all night!
It’s gonna poop!
What about all the women you want to bring home?
Joey, are you sure?
I want me to stay too.
Thank you. (They hug.) Oh Joey and look at this crib! It’s so cute!
Are you serious—Really?! It’s in such good condition.
Wow! Whoa-whoa what’s under the covers?
It’s moving.
It’s still—(Screams)—It’s got a tail! Get it out of here! Get it out of here!!
Ewww. Yeah. Umm. I think I’m gonna stay here.
(coming from the bathroom) Hey Pheebs?
I’m having dinner with my dad tomorrow night, do you wanna come?
Oh no, no, I’ll be there too.
No Phoebe! I just need you there for support. I haven’t told him I’m pregnant yet.
‘Cause I know he’s gonna flip out and I hate it when he’s angry.
What Phoebe? Wait! One time he caught me smoking he said if he ever saw me doing that again he’d make me eat the entire pack.
Thank you.
(panicking) No you don’t.
Well you could’ve untied it with your hands.
Well actually umm…
(To Phoebe) In case you didn’t notice, that is a scary man.
This was such a huge mistake. I can’t tell him Phoebe. I can’t, I can’t, I can’t, I can’t…
No it’s okay, this is what’s gonna happen. I’m gonna wait a couple years and then the baby will tell him.
Hey, that is the…baby’s problem. (Dr. Green returns.) Oh, everything okay with the waiter?
Well… Umm, I got TiVo.
Phoebe!
Well uh, yes and no. Except not no. So to sum it up, yeah.

No, it’s Ross. It’s Ross. You like Ross. (He just shakes his head.) Oh daddy, I hope you’re okay with all of this. I mean think about it, this is a good thing. You’re gonna—This is your first grandchild! You’re gonna be a poppy!
Yeah.
Who?
February 2nd!
I know. I know. I panicked, I panicked. I didn’t want him to start yelling at me like I was some ’74 Latour.
All right here he comes. I’m gonna do this, I’m gonna tell him, I’m gonna be strong.
Yeah?
Really?! The Plaza?!! Oh daddy!! (Hugs him and Phoebe glares at her.) Right. Daddy, I need to talk to you. Please, sit down.
There’s not gonna be a wedding. Ross and I are not getting married.
I’m sorry daddy.
Oh now daddy, stay calm. Please.
Yes. Yes, he says I’m damaged goods.
(quietly) Oh no…
Ross I’m so sorry. Okay. I-I will promise I will straighten this out with him tomorrow in person, or via e-mail.
Oh okay, I’ll fix that to. What’s her e-mail address?
All right, I promise. I’ll fix this. I swear. I’ll-I’ll-I’ll-I’ll talk to her.
Okay.
I know Mona, just hear me out. First of all, I’m so sorry about my father yelling at you, but I heard you totally held your own. You’re gonna have to tell me how you did that.
Okay. Um…But—Okay, yes Ross and I used to date. And yes we are gonna have a baby. But we are definitely not getting back together.
Oh we just—we drove each other crazy!
I mean he was possessive, he was jealous, he could never just let the little things go!
Right! But, none of that compared to how kind and-and how gentle and thoughtful he is. (Rubbing his shoulder.)

I know, I get it, but Mona, what relationship is not complicated? I mean we all have our baggage! You must too! Why else would you still be single? (Mona looks at her.) I am so gonna leave right now. (Ross opens the door for her and she leaves.)

(entering) Forgot my purse! (Sees them kissing.) Oh, you guys made up. (To Mona) He’s a good kisser isn’t he? (Ross goes to close the door on her.) I’m going! (Quickly leaves and Ross locks the door.)
About an hour ago.
Yes! (She gets up and sets the phone on the counter without hanging it up.) Bye daddy. (Phoebe and her leave.)
(looking at her fingers) Oh my…God! Let me see that! (Grabs the book from him.)
Hi!
Oh Pheebs that’s so sweet—(Grabs a pair of pants)—Ooh, those are so cute!
No.
Wow! I don’t remember him. Honey, are you sure you’re not talking about your imaginary boyfriend.
Oh that’s nice.
Remember I had to leave the room the other day when you had that roast chicken?
(entering, carrying a baking dish) Hi!
(sees Will) Oh my God Monica, who is that?

Oh! I do not remember him! Wow! He's really got that sexy, smoldering thing going on. (We see Will angrily staring at Rachel.) Oh my God, he’s… Look at the way he’s just staring at me. I think he’s trying to mouth something to me, but I can’t make it out. (Will mouths, "I hate you.")
Hi! Will, right?
Hi! I’m Rachel Green.
Really?! Aren’t you sweet! I gotta tell you though, I am, I am having the hardest time placing you. Oh-oh hang on! Did we umm, did we fool around at Lance Davis’ graduation party?
Thank you!
All right, who would uh, like some yams? Will?
What? (Joey starts offering Ross some turkey.) Oh y’know what? Can we please keep the chicken and the turkey and everything on the other side of the table? The smell is just yuck!
I’m sorry. What?
Umm, I’m sorry. Do you-do you have a problem with me?
I’m-I’m—I had no idea. I’m sorry. I…
Uh Will umm, I just want to say that I’m real sorry for whatever I-I did to you in high school…
You had a club?!
Whoa! My God! So what, you all just joined together to hate me?! Who else was in this club?
(To Ross) So you were in an I Hate Rachel club?
So who else was in this club?
So Ross, we went out for two years, and you never told me you were in an I Hate Rachel club.
Okay Monica, did you know about this?!
Okay. So what? You guys would just like get together and like just say mean things about me?
What rumor?
Ross!
What?!
(shocked) Oh my God!
What?! You heard that?! (Goes and stands behind Joey.)

Oh no!!!! Oh my God!! This is all making so much sense to me now! This is why Adam Carter wouldn’t go out with me! This is why Billy Tratt would just stay in this region! (Motions to her breasts.) (Joey has turned around.)
Monica, how come you never told me this?!
Joey stop staring! There’s nothing there! It’s not true!
Oh! (Hits him and storms out.)
(entering carrying a book) Okay! Okay! Listen to what Sean McMahon wrote in my yearbook senior year, "Dear Rach, you’re such a good person." Not girl! Person!
(reading what he wrote again) "Dear Rach, you’re a great person. Sorry about your tiney-wienie." (Will laughs.)
Yes!
I don’t care how long ago it was! You told people that I was half and half! Y’know what? I just want to point out I never did anything to hurt you in high school.
What?
Yes it is! I saw you guys going at it behind the card catalog!
Ohh, there’s a picture of her in the yearbook actually.
Wh—Phoebe!!
All right, y’know—Fine! You guys have your stupid little club, but I would just like to say is what you did to me is way worse than what I did to you! You gave me a tiney-wienie! (Will laughs.)
Wow…
She’s right.
You can keep those pants by the way.
(entering) Hi!
Oh my God! (Notices the boots) Oh Monica! Those boots are amazing!
Return them?! Shh! They’re gonna hear you!
(pause) He’s talking to the baby.
Okay. Well, I gotta go you guys. I’ll see you later.
Bye. (She gets up to leave but is stopped by Joey)
Hi.
No, forget it! No way! I am not sending anymore Ralph Lauren clothes to prison. It is a waste.
I guess I can talk to one of my supervisors…
Really?! Oh my God! I’m successful!
Yes! I’d love to! Have her come by the office.
Yeah.
Hi Monica!
Hi boots.
Ahh…
Well-well you can give them to me! I haven’t felt my feet in years!
Oh Joey, I’m hardly a…
Right! Hi Dina!
Nice to meet you. (They shake hands.)

Okay. All right Dina, well let’s talk about the different areas of fashion that you could get involved in. Let’s see, there’s design, but you may need a whole other degree for that. Uh, there’s-there’s sales, which is great because you get to travel…
(stunned) And there’s marketing…
Honey, it’s going to be okay. He’s been incredibly supportive of me, and if he gets a little upset; that’s what the meatball sub is for. (She gives Dina a sandwich wrapped in aluminum foil.)
Okay.
Honey, why don’t you sit down? Dina has something that she wants to tell you.
Joey…there’s something that you…should know. Dina?
(To Dina) Now! Give him the sandwich! Give him the sandwich! (She quickly sets the sandwich in front of him.)
What?! Dina…
I know.
What college was that Dina?
Joey, what are you doing?
Oh Joey this is crazy!

All right Joey! That is enough! (Grabs him and pulls him away from Bobby and Dina) Listen, as beautiful and moving as this ceremony is, it’s not legal. Okay? They-they don’t have a marriage license, they don’t have any witnesses, and the groom only has on one shoe!
You’re supposed to realize that they are adults! And that they can make their own decisions.
Heyyyyy! Contraceptives are not always effective! (To Bobby and Dina) Right?
Oh, come on kids! A little help here!
Joey, just because they’re not getting married doesn’t mean this is going to be a disaster. Maybe they have a plan!
Hey, now wait a minute! I get when you told people at first that you wanted to be an actor they laughed at you! Now come on Bobby, why don’t you tell us a little bit about your band?
(To Dina) Really? (Nods her head at Bobby.)
Oh excuse me! Am I ruining my life?
So forcing her to marry Bobby is gonna make that happen?
Okay Bobby, why don’t we just come over here and let them have a little moment. (Drags Bobby away from Joey and Dina.)
No! Seriously! What’s wrong with you?!
Phoebe?
Look at that guy by the window, wow!

Oh, what is wrong with me lately? I mean it’s like every guy I see—I mean look here. (Points behind them) Look at that guy for example, I mean normally that’s not someone I would-would be attracted to, but right now, with the way I’m feeling, all I want to do is rip off his sweatpants and fanny pack.
Yeah.
Really?! So this has happened to you?
Wow! This explains so much! Last weekend, I went from store to store sitting on Santa’s lap.
Ah.
Well, y’know what? I go see my doctor tomorrow, I’ll ask her about this. Maybe she can give me a pill or something.
Hi!

Oh, okay. Hey, can I ask you a question? Was it me, or-or was the guy who took my blood sample really cute? Y’know who I’m talking about, bald haircut, hairy fingers… (Stops when she realizes it was her.)
Yes, you are.
Oh, really, really good. But enough about me, come on! Where-where are you from? What do you do?
Right! Right! I-I actually meant in your spare time, do you cook? Do you ski? Or do you just hang out with your wife or girlfriend?
Oh, I love to ski! How amazing is this?!
No. I’m very comfortable.
No! Shoot, Dr. Schiff what kind of question is that?!
Well would you like me to lie down on the table?
Do you feel it too?
Hi.
Well, let’s see. Uh, they gave me cute doctor today and in the middle of the exam I put my pinky in his chin dimple.
Okay, even this is turning me on!
Oh hey! Hey Ross! Hey how’s it, how’s it going with you and Mona? Are you guys still together?
Uh Ross? You asked me that.
I think, if it was a little colder in here I could see your nipples through that sweater.
You gave her a key to your apartment?!
Hey!
Yeah. (They go into the kitchen.)
What?
Phoebe no!
No! I do not care what my hormones are doing, I am not going to just do it with some random guy!
Yes. Hi, I’d like to order a pizza. Okay, can I ask you a question? Is-is the cute blond guy delivering tonight? Very Ambercrombie & Fitch. (Joey enters.) I’ll call you back.
It’s just the pizza place.
I’m sorry honey, I’m just having a, having a rough day.
Oh you really, you really just don’t want to hear about it.
Okay, it’s just—and this is really embarrassing—but lately with this whole pregnancy thing I’m just finding myself…how do I put this umm, erotically charged.

Yeah. So y’know, I have all of these feelings and I don’t know what to do about them, because I can’t date like a normal person, which is fine because I don’t need a relationship, I mean all I really want is one great night. Just s*x, y’know? No strings attached, no relationship, just with someone that I feel comfortable with and who knows what he’s doing. For just one great night, I mean is that really so…hard…to find. (Looks at Joey.) So how was your day?
Well, I gotta get up early and it’s almost seven o’clock.
Okay, good night!
(entering) I didn’t ask you to do it!
You’re Joey!
Right back at ya!
And so bad. I don’t even know what you’re talking about because I didn’t ask you to do anything!
No!
That’s the end of this conversation!
Never happened! Good night!
They made you head of the department!
Yeah.
Uh, Paul’s Café. They got great food and it’s really romantic.
Yeah! Oh, and then afterwards you can take her to the Four Seasons for drinks. Or you go downtown and listen to some jazz. Or dancing—Oh! Take her dancing!

Ooh, I miss dating. Gettin’ all dressed up and going to a fancy restaurant. I’m not gonna be able to do that for so long, and it’s so much fun! I mean not that sitting at home worrying about giving birth to a sixteen pound baby is not fun.
Huh?
What?! Joey, you don’t want to go on a date with a pregnant lady.
(interrupting) Okay! I’ll go with ya! I’ll go! I’ll go with ya.
All right?
Joey? Could you get that? (There is no answer and she goes and opens the door to Joey.) What are you doing here? I thought you were in your room?
Ohh, Lilies. Joey, they’re my favorite. Thank you.

Oh man! This is so great! I actually feel like I’m going on a real date! Although, I have a hint of morning sickness, and I’m wearing underwear that goes up to about…(She snaps the waistband on her underwear that is just slightly below her breasts)…there.
Yeah, actually that’s my roommate’s.
Ah yes, but he’s very protective of me so you’d better watch yourself.
Hm-mmm.
(laughs) Yeah, but I’m pretty sure he’s gay.
Now the filet mignon, what comes with that?
Emmm. Now, instead of the vegetables, is there anyway I can substitute the three-pound lobster?
Wow! This is shaping up to be a pretty good date—Oh, I almost forgot. I didn’t pay you the rent check.
Okay. Wow! So I get to see what Joey Tribbiani is like on a date. So do you have any moves?
I knew it! I knew it. Come on tell me your moves.
Oh my God. And that works?!
Oh, you poor little famous man.
(looks interested) Oh my God! Wow! That was fantastic, I almost leaned in. I really almost did!
Alright. So where’d you grow up?
Come on, just answer the question!
And so were-were you close to your parents?
Why not?
(sympathetic) Oh. (Starts rubbing his wrist with her fingers.) It’s gotta be rough.
Huh?
Thank you! And now if you’ll excuse me, I have to go to the rest room.
And now you’re watching me walk away.
I am not gonna answer that!
No one! They are my friends, I wouldn’t punch any of them.
Yeah, but I don’t know why. Look at me, I’m having such a wonderful time!
I know!
Joey, I think everyone saw the wine come out of your nose.
Well that is because you have never been on a date with me before.
All right, now don’t judge me. I normally wait until my date leaves, but you live here. I’m ripping into this swan.
So tell me, what are Joey Tribbiani’s end of the night moves?
How do you do that?
Oh my God!
No, I don’t want to tell you.
Because it’s embarrassing.

(laughs) Okay. All right, stand up. (They do so.) Well, when we’re at the door, I lightly press my lips against his, and then move into his body just for a second, and then I make this sound, "Hmmm." Okay, I know it doesn’t sound like anything, but I swear it works.
All right, I gotta go to bed. Honey, I had such a wonderful time.
…you were 50 minutes late to the class, what did you crawl there?!
Well, why didn’t you just take a cab?
Well you’re not gonna be able to keep doing this.
You what?
Right. Wow!
Hi! Hey, remember how last night we were talking about that movie Cujo?
Relax! It’s not like it’s Citizen Kane!
Yeah I know it’s really boring, but it’s like a big deal. Anyway, I was thinking about renting Cujo sometime.
Well don’t you have that big date tonight?
Hey Joey, can I ask you something?
After our date last night, did you feel a little weird?
I don’t know! (Pause) I’m-I’m kinda thinking it-it was the lobster…
Yeah, I mean I was up sick all night.
Really?! How come we didn’t cross paths?
Oh God! Thank God you’re home! I’m watching Cujo.
Yes! But what is wrong with this dog?!
No! No! Seriously, what’s wrong with the dog?! Wait a minute, what are you doing home so early? What happened to your date?
Oh. Do you want to watch the rest of the movie with me?

Y’know, I never thought I’d say this about a movie, but I really hope this dog dies. (Joey brings over a stool at sits on it next to Rachel who’s in the big chair.) What are you doing over there? Come sit here, you protect me.
Okay. (Pushes play.) Okay, that’s him! That’s him! That’s Cujo! That’s Cujo!
Oh my God….What’s he gonna do now? I can’t watch! (Drags Joey closer to her and cowers into his chest.) Oh. Seriously, how can you watch this? Aren’t you scared?
(coming from her room) Hi, sweetie.
Hi! Oh, Ross, don’t forget, we have that doctor’s appointment tomorrow!
Yep! Happy and healthy! And cute!
Popular.
Oh yeah! I’ve come up with a bunch of ideas!
Really?!
Okay! I was thinking if it’s a girl, how about Sandrine? It’s French.
Okay fine, what do you have?
Wow, oh my God, our child will be beaten to death in the schoolyard.
I’m really, really not.
All right.
Yeah! I don’t think you’re going to need it though. Okay, check this out. If it’s a girl, Rain.
Why?
Ross, why do you hate our child?
Okay, James.
But only if it’s a girl.
Oh! I’m sorry! Are we having an 89-year-old? How about Dayton?
Veto. Sawyer?
Veto.
Oh, oh my God! I can practically hear the mahjong tiles!
But you have it right there in that file? You could tell us whether it’s a boy or a girl? Dayton or Sandrine? Phoebe or Phoebo?
Right. Right.
(looking at the bulletin board with baby pictures) So, which of these babies do you think is the ugliest?
Third one from the left?
What?!
I didn’t!
Okay fine, I did. But I didn’t see anything, I swear.
Okay, but Ross just listen to me…
But I couldn’t even if I wanted to, because I don’t know! I swear; I didn’t see anything, and I don’t want to know! It was just a momentary lapse.
(holding stomach) Okay, a couple months late on the lecture, Ross.
Hey.
You know what? I’ve been thinking about it. I’m really coming around on the name Ruth. I think I would actually consider naming our child that.
I didn’t see anything! I actually changed my mind about the name.
I would—Sequoia?
Fine.
But Ross, you want the name Ruth!
What?
Ross, I swear, I don’t know.
A what?!
We’re having a girl?
That’s what you just said!
You said girl!
I’m not! We’re having a girl! Sometimes I can’t believe it’s with you—But still! We’re having a girl!
Oh, yes! We’ll have ourselves a little baby Ruth…
Yes, please.
(entering) Hey! Ross and I were looking for you! What are we all doing in here? (Looks at Chandler) Oh, my! (Covers the spot where Joey wants bubbles to be replaced.)
No, I was waiting for you!
We’re having a girl.
(entering) Hi, sweetie.
Oh Joey, Iâ€™m so happy things worked out for us that weâ€™re having this baby together. I love you so much.
And I hope itâ€™s not an inappropriate time to say this but, youâ€™re the best s*x I ever had.
(bursts into the room) Joey! Joey!
Come feel this! Come feel my belly!
Joey! The baby is kicking for the first time! Will you please come feel this?!
Yes!
Oh, okay! (She goes over to him and he feels her belly.)
Aw, itâ€™s unbelievable! Wow! She is kicking so much! Oh, sheâ€™s like ummâ€¦ohâ€¦whoâ€™s that kind of annoying girl soccer player?
Mia Hamm!
(looking down) Oh-oh!! One hand on the sheet Joe!
Itâ€™s not kicking right now. Although we would love to see you do (Mimics him) that again.
Last night! I just felt it and I went into Joeyâ€™s room and he was sleepingâ€¦
Joey. Joey, something feels weird and not good weird. I donâ€™tâ€”Whoa!! (Winces in pain.)
Really?
Okay. Oh Godâ€”Ow!â€”Oo!
Hmm, mild discomfort. So I take it youâ€™ve had one of these Braxton thingies?
Thank you doctor. (Dr. Long exits.) (To Joey) Oh thank you for being so nice and calm.
But wait you said everything was gonna be okay.
But Iâ€”But everything is okay. Iâ€™m fine!
Yes! Yes! I got half a mind to contract that doctorâ€™s uterus though. Mild discomfort, whatâ€™s he talking about?
Yeah, everythingâ€™s fine!
Okay, no uterus, no opinion.
Oh you went to the movies by yourself?
Oh, I gotta go back in there.
No, everythingâ€™s fine. I just gotta go backâ€¦
I-I forgot my underwear. (Ross lets her go.)
Hey Ross! Check it out! I learned a new trick!
Ohh! Thatâ€™s so sweet of you! Oh yum! (Takes a bite out of the sandwich and starts to get sick.) Did you put pickles on this?
Oh Ross!! (Runs to the bathroom and closes the door.)
Yeah, Iâ€™ll be fine. But could someone please make sure that sandwich is gone when I get out there?
(entering) Well, if anyone is keeping score, I no longer eat tuna.
Whatâ€™s up?
(Gasps) Are you breaking up with us?
Yeah?
Are you asking me to move out? Do you not want me here?
But Joey, I donâ€™t think Ross wants me to move into his apartment and disrupt his life like that. I meanâ€”(Ross turns to her with wishful eyes.)â€”Or he does.
But Ross, its you and me!
I donâ€™t know. Is it crazy?
Okay, letâ€™s do it. Iâ€™ll move in.
Yeah.
Hi! Hey, Happy Valentine’s Day!

It’s good. Except he makes us watch the Discovery Channel all day long. Did you know that something really boring happened to someone really ugly in the Middle Ages? (to the waitress handing her a cup of coffee) Oh, thank you. I’ll see you guys later.
(entering) Hi.
I accidentally packed these with my stuff. (looks at the dog and gasps) Who is this?

(talking with a higher voice, and puckered lips…kind of like you do to a baby or...well…a puppy…it’s hard to explain. Just use your imagination!) Oh, well, you are so cute! I wish I could play with you more, but I’ve got to go to work! I hope I stop talking like this before my marketing meeting, yes I do. Yes I do. (still talking like that) Bye-bye, Joey. Oh, I seriously can’t stop it. (exits)
Oh, I’ve got big Valentine’s plans! I’ve got my Chinese food on the way, and the rest of your saltwater taffy!
Ross, we actually watched the documentary together.
Ooh! My Chinese food! Let me get my cash! (runs to her room to get her money)
(entering) Oh, hey, Mona!
I’ll be watching TV if anybody needs me. (exits to her room)
I’m not here! That’s just my Chinese food!
You know what I’m going to do? I’m going to get in my sweats, and eat this in bed! (exits)
(entering) I’m just going to grab the phone.
Oh, I’m sorry! Do you need the phone?
(as Ross enters with a present) But, but, Mona, I live here.
(entering) Hi! I’m so sorry to barge in on your Valentine’s, but I had to get away from all the yelling. Mona is dumping Ross.
Why? You saw it? Is it scary?
Well, now, wait. Now I’m all freaked out. Come on, you guys will watch it with me.
C’mon, seriously, you guys, you’re not going to make me watch this alone!
Okay. (watching the tape) Ooh, my! (Rachel jumps when the woman starts screaming) Woah! Why is that baby torturing that woman?!
Uh! It’s horrible!
Oh, my God!
What? Did her ass explode?!
Oh, screw you guys, you don’t have to do it!
(thinking) You’re going to have a baby, and you need to be prepared. Now, you’re going to make yourself watch the whole thing. Just do it! (Rachel puts the tape in the VCR)
(thinking) Hmm…maybe it starts with how she gets pregnant.
Oh-oh! Okay, she’s kicking!
Whoa!!
Wow that was a big one.
Hi!

Oh yes I do. I do. I believe that there is one perfect person out there for everyone. And do you know how you find him? You stop looking for him. That’s why I stopped looking for Russell Crowe. He’ll find me.
(To Phoebe) Well, what’s he like?!
Uh-huh.
Of course, of course.
Oh sure. Older?
Oh, I was just gonna ask!
Oh, it’s so sad they never had a chance to meet.
Joey? What’s up?
Okay what’s up?
Well honey, I’m late for a meeting. So can you just make it quick?
Sure! That sounds great! Just leave me a message and tell me where to meet you. Okay? (Walks away.)
…and I know Chandler is kidding but it happens every time he touches my stomach. I mean I’m really worried the baby’s not going to like him. (Joey is staring at the table.) Are you okay?
No. Not-not for me, but why don’t you take off your sweater?
Oh my God! Really?! Can I see it?
Huh. Wow, I wouldn’t think Hobbs would like that so much.
Um, seven…e-e-eight, eight years. Wow.
Yeah.
So you were saying?
Okay, well you had asked me how long we had known each other, and I said, "Eight years." And the um, waiter came over and cut his tip in half, and umm…now here we are.
(stunned) What?

(looking around) Who are you talking too? Oh, you’re kidding! Oh, it’s a joke! (Laughs.) It’s funny. It’s funny. I don’t get it. (Joey doesn’t say any thing and Rachel realizes it’s not a joke.) Oh. (Pause) Okay. Umm… I-I…uh, wow. Are you uh… How did umm… When?
Wow! Wow. Wow. Wow, it is hot in here.
Joey, Joey I love you so much, but I…
Joey.
No! Joey please! Please don’t! Please don’t leave like this! Now come on, you cannot do this to a pregnant woman! (Starts to cry.)
Can I? (Hug him.)
Oh Joey honey I don’t…I don’t want to lose…
I’m so sorry.
Yeah, that was a real good one.
Joey? Are you in there?
Hey!
Is Joey here?
Well, at least you make each other laugh.
Well, I haven’t seen him since that night that he told me how he y’know… I don’t know, I think he’s avoiding me. Why is that bagel on the floor?
Ew, was Chandler naked? Sort of like a, like a ring toss kind of situation?
All right. Well listen, if you see Joey will you just tell him uh…tell him I miss him. (Exits and Joey enters.)
Okay, I’m done. Do mine.
Ah.
Well, I have been spending a lot of time in the lab.
Well just ask Mona to give it back!
Hi!
Hi.
So I thought Joey and I would be okay once we hung out, but it’s not even like we know how to be with each other anymore.
How do you know that? What if it just gets worse and worse and worse, to the point where we can’t even be in the same room with each other?!
Oh my God!! You guys have such problems!! I feel so terrible for you!
Oh yeah. That makes sense.
Ooh, I can do that.
Hi.
What?
Yeah it’s umm… Yeah it’s uh… It-it’s y’know—It’s nothing.
Yeah—No wait! Joey no wait it is. It’s something. It’s-it’s umm…it’s my boss.
Yeah, and umm my baby.
My boss wants to buy my baby!
I know I told you, it’s a really big problem.
Can you believe that?!
That’s what I told him!

Well I’ll tell ya! (Pause) See uh my-my boss and his wife—They-they can’t have children. So umm, and that—we were at the Christmas party, and he got drunk, and he said to me, "Rachel, I want to buy your baby."
Ohh! Yeah! (Pause) Yeah that-that would’ve been a much simpler problem.
(entering) Hey! Great advice on that Joey thing!
Oh it was perfect! I mean it really felt like he was my friend again.
Oh that’s not important. The point is, I really—I think everything’s gonna be okay.
Hey! Oh Joey, honey listen, thank you for talking to my yesterday about that thing with my boss. That really meant a lot.
(worried) What?
Whoa-whoa-whoa, let’s say more!
What?!
No! No, no-no-no Joey he doesn’t want to buy my baby! I made that up!
So that we would have something to talk about! So it wouldn’t be awkward!
(To Joey) I can’t believe that you yelled at my boss! I’m-I’m gonna lose my job! What am I going to do?!
Oh Joey, I can’t believe you brought my boss into this! I’m gonna get fired!
Well, she told me too! (Points to Monica and Joey glares at her.)
Morning. You wanted to see me?
Okay look Mr. Zelner…
Yeah. (Motions for him to continue.)
Oh God.
Well, as long as we are clear about that. (Exits smugly.)
Hi.

It’s all gonna be okay. They’re just so happy that I’m not suing them that they gave me one extra month paid maternity leave. So long as I understand that the money should not construed as a down payment on this or any other child I should bear.
Chandler, can you give us a minute?
Yeah.
Joey, I’m really sorry that I lied to you. I was just trying to make things…
It kinda worked. I mean y’know, I don’t know about you buy I haven’t thought about our thing since all this.
Yeah I know! I miss that.
My gynecologist tried to kill me.
Hi!
Hey, do you guys have any extra ribbon?
I, uh, think you already are.
Yeah, yeah I like him a lot.
Yeah, otherwise I’m not going.
This is such a great party! 35 years. Very impressive, do you guys have any pearls of wisdom?
Hmmm….
Thank you…we’re so excited
Yeah, if you’re going to do the ears, you might as well take a pass at the nosal area.

No, I know I don’t either, but ya know what, it’s their party, and it’s just one night. And we don’t even have to lie; we just won’t say anything. If it comes up again, we’ll just…smile. We’ll nod along.
Oh…
(looking at the check) Unbelievable!
Open it! Open it! Open it!
But it was beautiful. I mean it was small, but kind of spectacular.
On a cliff, in Barbados, at sunset, and Stevie Wonder sang Isn’t She Lovely as I walked down the aisle.
Yeah, Stevie’s an old family friend. (Hits Ross’s chest)
So would I. You wouldn’t think that Annie Liebawitz would forget to put film in the camera.
What? I’m not you. This may be the only wedding I ever have. I want it to be amazing.
Okay, Ross, it has to be realistic.
And my veil was lace, made by blind, Belgium nuns.
Well, not at first, but it was very intricate work and they said even though they lost their sight, it was all worth it.
Well, I don’t know about that, but some said that I looked like a floating angel.
Oh yeah. That’s a great story.
Shhh! I want to hear the rest!
And the ring, was the size of my fist (makes a fist)!
Ross, it just wouldn’t have been feasible.
It was really fun being married to you tonight.
Okay Ross, can I uh, can I ask you something?
That proposal, at the planetarium…
Are you kidding?! With the, with the lilies, and-and the song, and the stars! It was…really wonderful! Did you just make that up?
Well, that would’ve been very hard to say no too.
Goodnight
I will think about it.
Hi!
So, I’m in my apartment doing the Soap Opera Digest crossword puzzle, and guess who the clue is for three down. (She hands the magazine to Joey.)
So did they call you to tell you your name’s gonna be in this?

Oh, come on Joey! You will totally keep it in check this time, and plus y’know the publicity would be really good for your career! And you deserve that! And if you do the interview you can mention, oh I don’t know, gal pal Rachel Green?
Okay, don’t listen to him. Please?

Come on! We will be there for you the whole time! Just remember gal pal Rachel Green. (Excited) Ha-ha! I’m gonna be in Soap Opera Digest! And not just in the dumb crossword puzzle. (Looks at Joey.) Seriously, proud of you.
Oh yeah, I’d actually love a blueberry muffin and a chamomile tea.
That is the Coast Guard.

It’s a trifle. It’s got all of these layers. First there’s a layer of ladyfingers, then a layer of jam, then custard, which I made from scratch. [Joey and Ross make impressed faces] Then raspberries, more ladyfingers, then beef sautéed with peas and onions, [Joey and Ross look like something’s wrong.] then a little more custard, and then bananas, and then I just put some whipped cream on top!
Oh! Yay! Look! There’s a piece that doesn’t have floor on it!
Hey, come on now!

(interrupting him) Hi! I’m gal pal Rachel Green, and if you want the dirt, I’m the one you come too. This might be Joey’s baby (rubbing her stomach), who knows? I’m just kidding—Seriously, (leans into the cassette recorder Shelley is using) gal pal Rachel Green.
(scoffs at him) Yeah, that’s gonna get you into Soap Opera Digest. Well I…(leans into the microphone again)…I would just like to say that Joey truly has enriched the days of our lives.
You too!
Oh, Joey! Sorry!
Oh but look! That’s gonna leave a stain!
Really?
I’ve never lived like this before.
Oh my God, Jill!
This is Chandler. (Points at him.)
And you know Monica and Ross!
And that’s Phoebe (points), and that’s Joey.
Don’t!! (Joey backs away frightened.)
Yeah!
Wow! I can’t believe they didn’t put it in the part where you said you didn’t watch soap operas.
(entering) Hi!
So what’s the final head count on my baby shower?
What?! You mean they’re not coming to a social event where there’s no men and there’s no booze?! That’s shocking! I don’t care, as long as my mom’s here.
What?! My mom’s not gonna be here?!
My God!
So my mother is not coming to my baby shower?!
Please, make sure she comes. It’s really important to me, I mean it’s my mom!
I don’t know.
Okay. (Mrs. Green helps her up and they walk over and get some tea.)
Oh well actually gonna use a nanny and uh, I don’t even have a housekeeper.
Mrs. Kay! Oh yeah, she was sweet. She taught me Spanish. I actually think I remember some of it, tu madre es loca. (I think that’s your mother’s crazy.)
Well, however great she was I just can’t afford that.
What?
Wh-wh-what? What?
Yes. Yes I do.
Why did you invite my mother?!
She wants to move in with me and Ross to help take care of the baby.
Eight weeks. I mean I love my mother, but my God, a long lunch with her is taxing.
What? You guys, come on! What am I going to do?

You’re right. You’re right. I mean I’m about to have a baby, I can tell my mother that I don’t want her to just be sleeping on my couch! Oh my God! She’s gonna want to sleep in my bed with me. This cannot happen!
Okay. (She goes over to tell her mother.)
Mom that’s okay that you didn’t get you a gift!
Oh yeah. Okay, see mom, the truth is I can do this on my own.
But mom, I really know what I’m doing. I can handle this.
He was a hamster! I am not going to vacuum up my baby!
Wow!

Oh my gosh! Oh wow! Oh, I know what this is! (She’s holding an item with a large suction cup connected to a yellow plastic box, with a long narrow tube and bottle connected the yellow part.) Wait a minute. That can’t be right. Is that a beer bong for a baby?
Did I say I was done guessing? Okay, thank you for that. Oh wow! What’s this?
Oh, it dispenses clean diapers!
Well that’s gross, why don’t you just take it outside and throw it in a dumpster?
What?! It goes ten times a day! What are we feeding this baby?! Indian food?!
I don’t know, I’d leave it on the changing table? (Everyone gasps.) What?! What’d I do? What’d I do?!

Oh come—(Stutters)—Of course I know that. I mean of course you never leave a baby alone! I mean who would—she wouldn’t be safe as she would be with me, the baby dummy. Oh God, okay. Y’know what? I think opening the presents right now is a little overwhelming right now. So I think umm, I’m just gonna maybe open them a little bit later, but thank you all for coming. And for these beautiful gifts, and this basket is beautiful.
Okay mommy, don’t ever leave me. (Hugs her.)
So umm, you’re gonna stay with me as long as I need you?

Oh mom, I swear I’m not an idiot. I’ve read all kinds of books on pregnancy and giving birth, but I-I just didn’t think to read the part about what to do when the baby comes. And-and then guess what? The baby’s coming and I don’t know what to do. Oh, can I throw up in my diaper genie?
Wait-wait where are you going? Where are you going?
Okay.
Oh we did, but my mom got us the greatest gift of all.
No. She’s going to live with us for eight weeks.
Yes! She’s gonna help us take care of the baby! Woo-hoo. (Sees that Ross isn’t happy.)
I do. I really do. I don’t know anything.
Oh no? Pheebs? Monica? Do I know anything about babies?
Hello?! I still don’t know what the hell I’m doing!
I hope you’re going somewhere with this.
Really?
Thank you. (Hugs him.)
(closing a book) Okay! I’m ready.
Yes, I’ve done my studying and I really know my stuff.
Uh, put your elbow in it.
Full, dry, on its back, and no loose covers.
Check if it’s wet, check if it’s hungry, burp it!
A card! A card! I pick a card!
Yeah but y’know what they say Mon, "There’s no such thing as bad press."
I didn’t write it.
Ross!
I am freaking out!
My due date is in one week!
That is seven days!
(interrupting him) No-no-no-no-no Ross! Please, come on we do not have any of the big stuff we need! We do not a changing table! We do not have a crib! We do not have a diaper service!
I’m serious.
Okay. Thank you. That’s great. Thank you. Wait-wait! Where on west 10th? Because there’s this really cute shoe store that has like this little…
(stopping him) Oh, wait Ross! I’m sorry, one more thing!
Umm, our situation. Y’know umm, what we mean to each other. And I mean we-we’re having this baby together, and we live together. Isn’t that, isn’t that weird?
I’m just kidding! You can go pee! (He does so in a hurry.)
Oh.
No-no-no! No, no, no, we’re not married.
Oh yeah! Actually, that’s one of the reasons why we’re not a couple.
Oh. Oh yeah, don’t get to worked up over it. I mean it-it sounds like he’s a doctor, but he’s not.
Oh my God! I’m standing at a cash register, holding a credit card, and I’m bored.
Hi Pheebs!
Oh, it was great! We got everything that we needed! Oh and Ross, almost got something that wasn’t on the list. A whore.
Well, we were paying for our stuff and this saleswoman just started flirting with him.
Yeah.
You don’t understand! You didn’t see how brazen she was.
No! I’m not! I-I-I just think it’s wrong! It’s-it’s that I’m—Here I am about to pop and he’s out picking up some shop girl at Sluts ‘R’ Us!
Oh yeah! You really—You look great.
Chandler, I’m not gonna lie to ya, but I am gonna run away from you. (Gets up and hurries out.)
All this stuff takes up a lot of room. Hey how uh, how serious are you about keeping Ben in your life?
Horny bitch. (They both look at her, pretending that the dinosaurs she’s holding are arguing.) No! You’re a horny bitch! Noooo! You’re the horny bitch! No! You’re a horny bitch!
So you guys go, have a really good time.
So, you had a good day huh? Big commission; picked up a daddy.
Oh yeah! Yeah please, you guys have fun.
Oh and it was great to see you too. And you look fantastic, although you missed a button.
Oh okay, I see what you’re doing there.
Hi! You’re back from your date!
I’m fine, but that’s not important. What’s important is how was she?
Oh uh-huh, uh-huh, coffee, a little rub-rub-rub under the table.
No! No, she’s—She was nice. I mean, she’s a little slutty, but who isn’t?
Of course you did Ross, you would date a gorilla if it called you Indiana Jones!
No! It’s just that, Kate bothered me.
There was nothing wrong with her! All right? She was perfectly lovely!
I don’t want you to date her!

Yes! And not because I want you to go out with me, but because I don’t want you to go out with anybody! Okay? I know it’s a terrible thing to even think this, and it’s completely inappropriate, but I want you to be at my constant beck and call 24 hours a day! I’m very sorry, but that is just the way that I feel.
What?!
Really? But I’m being so unreasonable.
(starting to cry) Oh Ross, thank you. Thank you. (They hug.)
No, not really. You’re pressing the baby into my bladder and now I have to pee. Sorry. (She gets up and starts for the bathroom.)
Yeah. (Stops and starts doing the I-have-to-go-to-the-bathroom dance.)
Uh-huh.
(pause) Wow! I don’t know, maybe. I’m…
(laughs) I knew that! I knew that! I was just messin’ with you too!
Oh no-no-no-no, no!
No that’s just—(Laughs)—That’s just ‘cause I’m such a good messer!
Yeah?
Right! (Heads for the bathroom.)

Well obviously I won’t be able to come, for those of you who haven’t checked their calendars today is my due date. Well y’know, I just want to take a moment and thank you guys for how great you’ve been during this time. I really couldn’t have done it without you. And I have loved these last nine months! And even though I am so looking forward to the next part, I am really gonna miss being pregnant.
That’s right, still no baby! (To Monica, Joey, and Chandler on the couch) Come on people! Please make some room!
You. Like you haven’t done enough.
God. (Sits down.) I have never been so uncomfortable in my entire life!

(interrupting her) Oh Phoebe, that’s a great story. Can you tell it to me when you’re getting me some iced tea? (Phoebe gets up and Rachel groans.) (To the baby) Oh God, get out! Get out!! Get out!! Get out!!
Do you want me to come over there and sit on you? ‘Cause I’ll do it.

They sent me home from work. They were like, "Start your maternity leave now! Just rest, get ready for the baby." Well y’know what? Screw ‘em! If they don’t want me there, I’ll just hang out with you guys.
(overhearing that) What-what about me?
I don’t. But I would still like to be acknowledged. What? Just because I’m pregnant you think I’m invisible.
Oh, I have to pee. If I don’t come out in five minutes it’s because I’ve choked to death on the potpourri stink. (Goes into the bathroom.)
(calling from the bathroom) All right, who’s turn is it to help me get up!
Oh, I have to go pee. Apparently this baby thinks that my bladder is a squeeze toy. (Goes to the bathroom.)
In a minute!!!
(entering) All right, all right. Let’s go!
No, I’m fine.
Ross, it is 100 degrees outside. For the first time in weeks, I am somewhat comfortable.
Oh uh-uh pal! Don’t call me mommy! It’s bad enough you call your own mother that. (He looks at Monica.)
Ross.
Can I ask you something?
When Carol was pregnant with Ben…
…were you this irritating?
Excuse me?!
Well then you just must have a natural talent for it.
(silently) Okay. (Pause) Seriously, breathe louder Ross! That’s great!
Hi Dr. Long, how are you?
She has the drugs!
Okay. (Rachel lies back.)
Yeah.
Eh, just a tad.
Well, we are ready to try anything.
Okay.
Great! We will do all of those.
Hi!
No. But she did give us some ideas on how to induce labor.
Well, there is one thing that we haven’t tried, but someone thinks that, (mimicking Ross) "That will open up a can of worms."
Why? Why today?
I’ll take that bet.
Well, I’m miserable here! I might as well make some money out it!
Oh honey, don’t worry. I really do feel like tomorrow’s the day.
Ross I—We tried all the spicy food. It’s not working.
I am feeling nothing. Speaking of hot, watching you do that really makes me want to have s*x with you.
Oh come on Ross, why are we wasting our time with this other stuff?! We know what’s gonna work! It’s doctor recommended!
Oh come on Ross, we’ve done it before we’ll do it again, it’ll be a nice way to bookend the pregnancy.
Make love? What are you a girl?
But you will, you will be performing a service. Okay? Just-just think of me as a ketchup bottle, y’know you sometimes you have to bang on the end of it just to get something to come out.

Oh, I know it. You’re right. That’s not sexy. Oh…Oh! (Drops a fork on the floor.) Whoops! Oh, I seem to have dropped my fork. Let me just bed over and get it. (Tries too, but can’t quite seem to make it.) Oh God!
Come on Ross! I’m miserable here! Come on! You started this, now you finish it! Come on wuss, make love to me.
What?!

Oh wow! What now Ross you’re not gonna talk? How on earth will you ever annoy me? Oh wait a minute, I know. (Mimics his breathing.) I mean you’d think the damn jalepeno would’ve cleared up your sinuses, but no!! That’s not enough… (Ross jumps over and kisses her.) What are you doing?!
(breaking the kiss) Oh God!
Oh no. No-no! I think my water just broke.
Okay! I got the keys! Okay! Okay!
Yeah.
I didn’t uh, really have time to read this part of the books, but do you think we have time to…
Okay.
(deadpan) Yes, the hard part is truly over.
Hi! (Ross is stunned.)
Ross, you stay here and talk, I’m gonna go have a baby.
(interrupting her) Whoa-whoa-whoa-whoa! I’m sorry, semi-private? We (Laughs), we asked for a private room.
Okay. Just give us a second. Ross! (They walk away from the desk.)
Give her some money.
They’re not!! Ross, they’re just saving them for the important people!! Okay?! What-what if I was the president?!

(standing up) Okay. Y’know what? I’d have to say I really don’t care for your tone. And this is not the only hospital in this city and we have no problem to—Whoa! (She starts a contraction) Oh gosh! Whoa!
Ow! Ow! Contraction. (Sits back down.) Ow-ow! Ow-ow! (Starts breathing heavily.)
Yeah, it couldn’t hurt to look.
Oh, okay.
Thank you. (Dr. Long exits.) Well, I guess we have some time to kill.
Yeah well it looks great!
Hi!
How are you?
Yeah it is.
That’s so sweet.
Oh.
Oh no, I really don’t want any—(He takes the picture)—Oh! Thank you. Oh. Oh Ross…
Here comes another contraction.
Oh, that’s very—Really very-very okay.
(simultaneously as Ross) No, I don’t think we’ll be doing that.
Oh. Oh wait no.
No-no-don’t! Don’t leave me here with these people.
No Ross! Ross! Ross! My child has no father!
Hi!
Oh, thank you so much for coming. Ross, get in here!
New people.

They’re having their baby! It’s not fair Ross we got here first! Right after you left they wheeled her off into delivery. Oh but not before she gave me a juicy shot of little Jamie just crowning away.
Well they have uh, some unusual pet names for each other. Including umm, evil bitch and uh, sick b*st*rd. Oh God oh! Contraction!
Ooh! Ow!!
Ross.
He’s looking at me.
Ugh, is she pregnant yet? She doesn’t need to be; she’ll still have the baby before I do. Oh Ross, another contraction! (Leans back on Ross for some support.)
Yeah it was.
Dr. Long, I’ve been at this for seventeen hours! Three women have come and gone with their babies, you gotta give me some good news! How many centimeters am I dilated? Eight? Nine?
Hey, y’know what? I’m not waiting! I’m gonna push this baby out! I’m doing it! I mean it’s what? Three centimeters? That’s gotta be like this! (Holds her hands a couple inches apart.)
Oh stupid metric system!
Oh for the love of God!
Oh come on!!

Okay! Okay wait! You listen to me! You listen to me! Since I have been waiting four women, that’s four, one higher than the number of centimeters that I am dilated, have come and gone with their babies! I’m next! It’s my turn! It’s only fair! And if you bring in one woman and she has her baby before me I’m going to sue you! Not this hospital, I’m going to sue you! And my husband (Points at Ross) he’s a lawyer!
Go get back on that case honey!
Okay, well then bring her in.
Oh!
I get it!
Oh we-we didn’t.
Just tell me how.
Oh hi.
Oh not bad. Do you know that feeling when you’re trying to blow a Saint Bernard out your ass?
Oh that’s five Ross. Five women have had five babies! And I have had no babies! Why doesn’t she want to come out?
Oh. Look at you making up crap for me. Oh God! (Starts another contraction as Dr. Long enters.)
Doctor you gotta do something! I think you gotta give me drugs or you gotta light a fire up in there and just smoke it out.
What?
My God. Okay. (Another woman enters.) Ha-ha-ha beat ya! Sucker!
I can’t. I can’t push anymore, I can’t.
Oh God twenty seconds my ass!!
Don’t say, "Oh my God!" Oh my God what?
Oh God. Is she gonna be okay?
I’m sorry, I can’t!
I can’t!
I can’t. Please, you do it for me.
Are you okay?
Oh God!
Oh, she’s so tiny. (Starts crying) Where’d she go?
Okay. Well be careful with her, she’s really tiny.
Oh hey you. Thanks for coming out of me. (The baby cries.) I know. Oh. Yeah. Oh, she’s looking at me. Hi! I know you.
No, not yet.
Oh no, Baby Girl Geller-Green.
Hello baby girl.
Here. (Hands her to Monica.)
What?
Oh nothing I… Sorry, I just can’t stop crying.
So? You guys are all sleep deprived. I don’t see you weeping because you put your slippers on the wrong feet. Oh God. (Starts to cry harder.)
I was reliving it.
Yeah, and y’know what? I love them both, so why don’t you just pick one and that’ll be it.
That’s not her name! I’m sorry, she just doesn’t feel like an Isabella.
Oh great! Suddenly she sounds like a biblical whore.
Well what are we going to do?
Well tell us! What are they?
And if it’s a girl?
Oh, just tell us! We’re not gonna want it!
(gasps) Emma! (Looks at the baby and starts to cry.) See? I don’t want it.
What?
Oh honey, but you love that name.
Ohhh! (Looks at Aaron and recoils in horror.) Wow! He kinda takes your breath away doesn’t he?
Oh, I’m fine. (Gasps in pain as she sits down.)
Oh, I’m not doing it alone. I have Ross.
Well then he gets a divorce, it’s Ross!
Well I—That’s never gonna happen with Ross.
Really?

Well… That’s…y’know—That’s—We’ve been alone for the last twenty minutes we’re doing okay. Besides y’know what? I-I—Maybe we won’t be alone, ‘cause lately I-I—things have been happening between me and Ross, y’know? Right before I went into labor, we-we had this kiss. Y’know? So it might be the…the beginning of something.
Uh-huh. (Ross takes off his coat and sets in on a chair.) Y’know what I was, I was thinking about?
Umm…that kiss before we left the apartment. That was some-something huh?
(pause) Right.
No! No, of course not. No. That’s why I brought it up. (Pause) They didn’t have any sodas?
That’s all right. (He goes to get her a soda.) And so it begins.
Nothing.
Really it’s nothing. I’m just…
I’ve just been thinking about how my baby and I are gonna be all alone.
Oh please, he’ll be with his real family, the twins and little miss new boobs.
I’m just saying that y’know, someday Ross is gonna meet somebody and…he’s gonna have his own life. Right?
